story:
Short Summary

Mala Greña, a musical project from Ohlone Land (Oakland), CA, is ready to release its first musical work, the Serpiente EP. This EP is an exploration of latin percussion, salsa, cumbia, hip hop and progressive rock sounds. It will consist of three songs titled Mi Kumbia Se Fuma, Movimientos de la Serpiente and Viento de la Muerte which features Afro Puerto Rican cross genre singer/songwriter, Art3mis Prim3.

Here is a snippet of Mi Kumbia Se Fuma:

 

And here you can hear a clip from Movimientos de La Serpiente:

 

Quotes from Serpiente EP

 

“...I hear the whispers of a clandestine government, got our people in tenements, reservations, imprisonment and we all in that paper chase showing papers to get through gates, fuck the borders, no borders, that new world order gonna have to wait..” -Viento 

 

“Sola en el infierno,

Pero bien acompañada 

Rabia colectiva está saliendo de las casas.

Déjela que salga así de adentro” - Mi Kumbia Se Fuma 

 

“Seré yo libre al fin ,

En en mi verdad vivir .

Sin leyes, mi cuerpo vibra así.

De género ambiguo soy.

Cuando me muevo así” - Movimientos de La Serpiente 

Mala Greña's member’s identities are non-negotiable. We honor those through our collective lived experiences, and through the pursuit of  a powerful sound that heals us and others. We consider that music is a powerful tool to break down walls, dismantle systems, express ourselves and connect people, and that being independent musicians with day jobs shouldn’t be an obstacle for us to bring these sounds to you.

We need your help! 

What Your Contributions Will Fund

  • Professional mixing and mastering of the 3 songs in the Serpiente EP, plus the mixing and mastering of one extra single song release after the EP. 
  • The labor and costs of the artists* helping us with the design and manufacture of the Mala Greña merch we will be distributing when the EP is released. 
  • The labor of the artist(s)* designing the EP cover. 
  • The costs of hosting an EP fundraising event where local dj's, performers and artists are featured. 
  • Professional video recording and editing of our upcoming performance for KPFA radio in Berkeley, CA. 

*We prioritize working with QTPOC artists in our community. 

What We Need & What You Get

Donate to our campaign! These are the rewards we are offering per donation amount: 

  • $1 Our eternal thanks for your support
  • $6 2 4x4in Mala Greña stickers
  • $11 4 4x4in Mala Greña stickers
  • $16 6 4x4in Mala Greña stickers
  • $24 3 Mala Greña stickers + Serpiente EP Digital download 
  • $36 3 Mala Greña stickers + Serpiente EP Digital download + Screen printed Mala Greña t-shirt
  • $60 3 Mala Greña stickers + Serpiente EP Digital download + hand dyed, hand painted, unique Mala Greña shirt 
  • $99 3 Mala Greña stickers + Serpiente EP Digital download + Mala Greña shirt + free entry to the next 5 shows or 5 tickets to any show 
  • $250 3 Mala Greña stickers + Serpiente EP Digital download + Mala Greña shirt + Show tickets + Mala Greña will record a live video covering your favorite song* we reserve the right to ask for a different song. 
  • $600 3 Mala Greña stickers + Serpiente EP Digital download + Mala Greña shirt + Show tickets + Mala Greña private performance

  • $700 3 Mala Greña stickers + Serpiente EP Digital download + Mala Greña shirt + Show tickets + Mala Greña private performance + You'll get to have a hot dinner date with the team 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this campaign as much as you can
  • Follow us on social media for updates
  • Come say hi at our next show

  • Tell your friends about our music!

Who is Mala Greña? 

A seed was planted by an ancestral spirit or energy. From the seed, encased in bone and darkness, its roots desperately took hold. From flesh and blood, roots and branches grew. Its flowers manifested themselves to Greñudx in the form of sound - a sound that demanded and embodied transformation, bringing self awareness and healing.

It reverberated through space, resonating with the other musicians, all on their own journeys of transformation. Together as roots, nurturing these connections, they tore through the ground, flowering Mala Greña’s mystical essence.

The lineup formed.

Grenudx, a Xicane sound arranger from the Bay Area, is the originator of the project's sonic signature style. With an experimental, no rules needed approach, they give this sound life on stage through guitar and keys/melodica.      

Mala Grena’s conga player is Jesus, a U.S. veteran of Puerto Rican/Mexican descent. He bridges the traditional musical roots with the more experimental aspects of the sound. 

Oscar, of Chilean ascent; is the band’s drummer. With a strong background in heavy metal, progressive and traditional rock sounds, his arrangements ignite the gritty, energetic aspect of the music. 

Gi, on the bass, is a queer non binary composer and musician living in the Bay Area. With experience in a broad variety of genres, from jazz, to classical, to ambient, to cumbia, their mastery in the bass is the backbone of the sound, the timekeeper of the vibe.

Flama is the lead vocalist; a Costarican queer non binary performer, dj and producer; their lyrics and performance give you a glimpse into their spirit: anti-establishment, unapologetic, trance-like - a place where identities merge. Their contribution is the lyrical and corporal interpretation of the music.          

Their musical work is influenced by artists in the likes of The Mars Volta, Chicha Libre, Sonido Gallo Negro, Caifanes, Aterciopelados, XIXA, ZZK Records and Combo Chimbita. 

Mala Greña’s sound and performance has begun picking up the attention from the Bay Area’s musical community. They’ve played in an array of popular venues, such as the San José Ritz, the Uptown, and the Elbo Room in SF and Oakland. They’ve also brought their music to well renowned events such as the San José Jazz Festival, with support from the Sonido Clash crew, the California State Fair, for Out At The Fair, and La Diáspora Festival at the Mission district in San Francisco. They’ve shared the stage with Turbo Sonidero, La Misa Negra, LoCura, Calafia Armada, Fulminante, Extra Action Marching Band, Valley Wolf, and more. 

 

Find us

@malagrena 

facebook.com/malagrenaband

malagrena.com

story:
Hey friends! It’s Sadie Rock. I have written a fresh new album for you, and I am so excited to share it with you! The Mad Ryans and I have been working very hard preparing this crazy new music for recording and I hope you are going to love it! 

It's gonna be a rager. Come with?

We'll dance, spin old records, laugh, share stories, and get weird, all inside this kickass new album. Grab your bundle and come in; the door's open.

 

I make music with the goal of shamelessly speaking what is in my heart and soul in the hopes that it will speak to something in your heart and soul.

I think ultimately we all have the same experiences and needs. If I can give voice to some of that common experience, in the form of fun, innovative, really enjoyable music that you will love listening to, I hope it will make your life a little bit better.

I am here for you!

 

I would love for you to join me on this journey and be a part of the creation of this new work! Will you be a part of bringing this new album to life and making it possible?

 

Your contribution helps bring us together. It helps me bring this music to your ears and share my stories with you. 

 

What we need:

We need $7,685 by August 22nd to fund the album. 

This money will pay for:

-- recording, mixing, and mastering at a quality, affordable local studio  ($6550)

--CD production, cover art and design, printing, and shipping   ($585)

--Digital distribution ($50)

--Indiegogo fee ($400)

--Other expenses (taxes, fees, shipping perks, etc.) ($100)

 

I would love your support!

  

What YOU get:

 

No matter what perks you choose, they will come with my undying gratitude for having you on my team, in my corner, and at this PARTY we are creating together! And of course, you get to be part of the production of a great album!

 

But I also have some great treats for you!

CDs and digital downloads of the music, of course! 

Plus...

exclusive sneak peeks and access to unreleased songs!

mystery boxes!

midnight talks (Zoom calls)!

custom songs! 

music lessons!

delicious food!

and more!

 

I hope to reach 100% of my goal.  However, in the event that I do not, I will still use the funds raised to record and bring you as much of the music as I am able.

 

This album will make a difference.

I strive to create music that is different from other music out there.  I am stretching genres, trying out new musical ideas, and pushing the boundaries of what is expected from rock and pop music.  More importantly, I am here to provide radically honest, relatable music that is fun to listen to, fun to dance to, and inspires you to be who YOU want to be.

 

Making an album is not easy or cheap.  But we are up to the task.

I and everyone involved with this album are passionate, committed, hard-working musicians who are serious and excited about making this album and serious and excited about making music for the rest of our lives.  Nothing means more to us than getting this music out from our rehearsal space and to your ears.  We can't wait to do it.

 

Other ways you can help

Of course we would LOVE your contribution to our campaign.  And make no mistake: any size contribution helps!  

And there are other ways you can help as well!

Please get the word out by making some noise about this campaign!  Post on social media, tell your friends... anything you can do to let people know about it is greatly appreciated!

Don't forget you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

Thank you so much for taking the time to hear my story and join my campaign.  You are helping me use my voice and live my dream. I will do everything in my power to return the favor. :)
 

 

Visit me at 

Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/sadierockofficial/ and https://www.facebook.com/sadierockandthemadryans

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCSDHcOmlBh6qj8...

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/sadierockofficial/?hl=en and https://www.instagram.com/sadierockandthemadrya...

Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/artist/7dpe0fsHbsQwZhm...

web: www.sadierockandthemadryans.com

story:
LIVE "Lonely Island" performance: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4i0obm2xcjg

Mixed-genre dark-lyrical electro-rock band Lucretia's Daggers won a (small) grant through the Massachusetts Cultural Council to produce several multi-media Environmentally/Socially Progressive Educational Awareness Music Videos in 2021. The first, featured here in a live video, is "Lonely Island," our homage to mental health/depression awareness from our Earth Day 2019 EP, Thoughts & Prayers. 

With the grant, we can start this initial video this Spring including taping, editing, effects, imagery, animation, still art, space rental, props, and more. Increased funding will mean greater artistry and possibly additional videos for other tracks like "Thoughts & Prayers" (anti-gun violence), "New Army" (climate change awareness), "Terror Nation" (inclusiveness, anti-discrimination & social justice).

TO FUND THESE PROJECTS AND TO SPREAD OUR PROGRESSIVE 21ST CENTURY SOCIO-POLITICAL MESSAGES THROUGH ART AND MUSIC, WE ARE OFFERING SPECIAL PACAKGES OF LD'S MERCHANDISE FOR OUR 20TH ANNIVERSARY (August 2021). Please join us in our vision by purchasing cool merch (CDs/EPs, jewelry, keyrings, buttons/magnets, patches, etc. Even a performance!) for yourself, for others...and so we can produce more music & videos, which of course will be available in the near future!

Our original goal for four videos was $3-5k. With the grant, we are short $500 for just one. Switching gears, if we succeed in reaching our $3k+ goal, we will look to recording both new music and videos in 2021 and beyond. By contributing to our projects, you will be backing songs of protest and social justice from climate awareness/environmental sustainability, mental health awareness, and immigration and police reform to the #METOO, LGBTQ+, anti-bullying, anti-gun violence, and anti-fascist movements of today. Regardless of our success, you will be supporting the creation of music and art for you to share, use to educate, and simply enjoy; your money will not be wasted...and you'll have cool stuff - including free videos online - in return (just give us your email address so we can send you a copy of it online!: lucretiasdaggers@rcn.com)

Please see the Lucretia's Daggers and Bandcamp websites for our music and visuals: https://www.lucretiasdaggers.com, https://lucretiasdaggers.bandcamp.com/album/tho...

And to purchase (or get FREE) Downloads: https://lucretiasdaggers.com/downloads - $1-10

Merch Packages for Lucretia's Daggers 20th Anniversary Music/Video Fundraiser (also cash donations via Paypal @ lucretiasdaggers@hotmail.com):

1.  Thoughts & Prayers EP - Produced at Waltham Watch City Earth Day 2019, (62) EPs printed in Eco Wallets using recycled paper & vegetable-based inks. 5 tracks: "Thoughts & Prayers" (anti-gun violence), "New Army" (climate change), "Lonely Island" (depression/despair to hope), "Toxic Leaders" (bad bosses), "Drawn & Quartered" (bad relationships). Listen here: https://lucretiasdaggers.bandcamp.com/album/thoughts-prayers - $7

2. Sad Flower Songs CD - LD's full-length 2005 album: Single wrapped (17) or unwrapped (2) - $10 each, or boxes (5) $75 each, of 30 wrapped, 12-track CDs on love, lust, and loss with all the snark and erudite poetry singer/lyricist Lucretia could muster out of everything from romantic relationships to workplace shenanigans, such as in "Horrors of Retail". Watch LD's first professionally-produced video for it by Metropolitan Films: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ac1rRZGp_R0​ 

Box of 30 copies - $75/box:

3. Extremely Limited edition (only 8 total left!) Sky So Grey CD - Boston Gothic Rock Compilation 2008: Sealed CDs with 14 tracks by 14 Boston-area artists, including early Walter Sickert & The Army of Broken Toys, Amber Spyglass,  What Time Is It, Mr. Fox?, The Milling Gowns, Dreamchild, Sharon Crumrine, Melt, and of course, Lucretia's Daggers. Listen to LD's "Tragedy" here: https://lucretiasdaggers.com/downloads - $20 

4. PurpleDreamArts Skull & Dagger jewelry by Larisa Gassel:

Pewter/brass dagger & skull necklaces with or without beads (blue, green, plum, pink pearl, red, orange, black, silver, brass) on 9” black cord, and pewter/dagger earrings with or without beads (blue, green, plum, pink pearl, red, orange, black, silver, brass) and chains. See more photos here: https://lucretiasdaggers.com/cds-jewelry-swag 


For any issues or questions on pieces, please email: lucretiasdaggers@rcn.com​

5. Ben Carlson Pewter & Dagger Jewelry - 7 collections in full color (midnight black, brick red, purple, bright blue, cobalt blue/black splatter, forest green/black splatter, burnt orange/black splatter); with or without 1 pewter skull on a dagger necklace, dagger earrings & dagger keyrings. See more photos here: https://lucretiasdaggers.com/cds-jewelry-swag

​For any issues or questions on pieces, please email: lucretiasdaggers@rcn.com

6. LD Sad Flower Songs (SFS) Magnets (19) & Pins/Buttons (25): Check them out on our website Store page: https://lucretiasdaggers.com/online-store - $2

7. LD Limited Sew-on Patches by Canney: (11) Long "Lucretia's Daggers" - 5" x 1" and (5) Square "LD" 3" x 2". Check them out on our website Store page: https://lucretiasdaggers.com/online-store - $4

5 Big Package Deals!: 

Package #1 (10): 1 Thoughts & Prayers EP (5 tracks), Sad Flower Songs CD (12 tracks), 1 Canney LD patch (long or square - random), 1 Sad Flower Songs magnet & 1 Sad Flower Songs button/pin - $50

 

Package #2 (7): 1 Thoughts & Prayers EP (5 tracks), 1 Sad Flower Songs CD (12 tracks), 1 Canney LD patch (long or square - random), 1 Sad Flower Songs magnet, 1 Sad Flower Songs button/pin, and 1 Ben Carlson Dagger keyring (random color) - $75

Package #3 (7): 1 Thoughts & Prayers EP (5 tracks), 1 Sad Flower Songs CD (12 tracks), 1 Canney LD patch (long or square - random), 1 Sad Flower Songs magnet, 1 Sad Flower Songs button/pin, and 1 Ben Carlson Dagger necklace (random color) - $75

Package #4 (5): 1 Thoughts & Prayers EP (5 tracks), 1 Sad Flower Songs CD (12 tracks), 1 Sky So Grey Limited Boston Goth Rock Compilation (15 tracks/bands), 1 Canney LD patch (long or square - random), 1 Sad Flower Songs magnet, 1 Sad Flower Songs button/pin, 1 Ben Carlson Dagger necklace (random color), and 1 Ben Carlson Dagger keyring (random color) - $100

Package #5 (3): A PRIVATE PEFORMANCE - A Lucretia's Daggers Performance - at your house/location (or ours)! Plus both a Sad Flower Songs CD and a Thoughts & Prayers EP. Lucretia's Daggers will come to your yard or open-air space (or indoors when Covid safe) anywhere within 50 miles of Boston, on a mutually-agreed upon date, preferably on a weekend, sometime 2021-2022. We'll bring the sound system...unless you have your own! - $500

All purchases carefully packaged in bubblewrap/CD mailers. Jewelry in plastic baggies. FREE WITH ALL PURCHASES...LD stickers & mini daggers! Contact us with questions: lucretiasdaggers@rcn.com, or to get a link the the finished videos/dates for CD releases. And, of course, donations to our PayPal account are always welcome! (Paypal @ paypal.me/LucretiasD, lucretiasdaggers@rcn.com.)

Note: Even if you don't make a purchase from this fundraiser, you can still help our projects go forward. Please get the word out & MAKE SOME NOISE about our campaign! Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools. Thank you! 

            

With a namesake derived from '80s cult band The Sisters of Mercy, Shakespeare/Livy-penned poetic biography, and 16th c. Borgia legend, Boston, Massachusetts' musicians Lucretia's Daggers blend darkwave, synthpop, and ambient metal with dramatic female vocals and have brought an arty touch to their "dark lyrical electro-rock for the apocalypse" since August 2001. (Below: Artemisia Gentileschi, Lucrezia 1623-25, National Gallery, Washington,DC)

                                                                     

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The winter of 2019 found the reformation of the band with Maxx Charvelle on guitar/vox, Donni Darko on bass/vox, and Lucretia X. Machina on the mic/tambourine/megaphone. Rounding out the group is the fourth, most reliable, most electronic partner yet, a laptop named FOUR.
story_txt: LIVE "Lonely Island" performance: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4i0obm2xcjgMixed-genre dark-lyrical electro-rock band Lucretia's Daggers won a (small) grant through the Massachusetts Cultural Council to produce several multi-media Environmentally/Socially Progressive Educational Awareness Music Videos in 2021. The first, featured here in a live video, is "Lonely Island," our homage to mental health/depression awareness from our Earth Day 2019 EP, Thoughts & Prayers. With the grant, we can start this initial video this Spring including taping, editing, effects, imagery, animation, still art, space rental, props, and more. Increased funding will mean greater artistry and possibly additional videos for other tracks like "Thoughts & Prayers" (anti-gun violence), "New Army" (climate change awareness), "Terror Nation" (inclusiveness, anti-discrimination & social justice).TO FUND THESE PROJECTS AND TO SPREAD OUR PROGRESSIVE 21ST CENTURY SOCIO-POLITICAL MESSAGES THROUGH ART AND MUSIC, WE ARE OFFERING SPECIAL PACAKGES OF LD'S MERCHANDISE FOR OUR 20TH ANNIVERSARY (August 2021). Please join us in our vision by purchasing cool merch (CDs/EPs, jewelry, keyrings, buttons/magnets, patches, etc. Even a performance!) for yourself, for others...and so we can produce more music & videos, which of course will be available in the near future!Our original goal for four videos was $3-5k. With the grant, we are short $500 for just one. Switching gears, if we succeed in reaching our $3k+ goal, we will look to recording both new music and videos in 2021 and beyond. By contributing to our projects, you will be backing songs of protest and social justice from climate awareness/environmental sustainability, mental health awareness, and immigration and police reform to the #METOO, LGBTQ+, anti-bullying, anti-gun violence, and anti-fascist movements of today. Regardless of our success, you will be supporting the creation of music and art for you to share, use to educate, and simply enjoy; your money will not be wasted...and you'll have cool stuff - including free videos online - in return (just give us your email address so we can send you a copy of it online!: lucretiasdaggers@rcn.com)Please see the Lucretia's Daggers and Bandcamp websites for our music and visuals: https://www.lucretiasdaggers.com, https://lucretiasdaggers.bandcamp.com/album/tho...And to purchase (or get FREE) Downloads: https://lucretiasdaggers.com/downloads - $1-10Merch Packages for Lucretia's Daggers 20th Anniversary Music/Video Fundraiser (also cash donations via Paypal @ lucretiasdaggers@hotmail.com):1.  Thoughts & Prayers EP - Produced at Waltham Watch City Earth Day 2019, (62) EPs printed in Eco Wallets using recycled paper & vegetable-based inks. 5 tracks: "Thoughts & Prayers" (anti-gun violence), "New Army" (climate change), "Lonely Island" (depression/despair to hope), "Toxic Leaders" (bad bosses), "Drawn & Quartered" (bad relationships). Listen here: https://lucretiasdaggers.bandcamp.com/album/thoughts-prayers - $72. Sad Flower Songs CD - LD's full-length 2005 album: Single wrapped (17) or unwrapped (2) - $10 each, or boxes (5) $75 each, of 30 wrapped, 12-track CDs on love, lust, and loss with all the snark and erudite poetry singer/lyricist Lucretia could muster out of everything from romantic relationships to workplace shenanigans, such as in "Horrors of Retail". Watch LD's first professionally-produced video for it by Metropolitan Films: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ac1rRZGp_R0​ Box of 30 copies - $75/box:3. Extremely Limited edition (only 8 total left!) Sky So Grey CD - Boston Gothic Rock Compilation 2008: Sealed CDs with 14 tracks by 14 Boston-area artists, including early Walter Sickert & The Army of Broken Toys, Amber Spyglass,  What Time Is It, Mr. Fox?, The Milling Gowns, Dreamchild, Sharon Crumrine, Melt, and of course, Lucretia's Daggers. Listen to LD's "Tragedy" here: https://lucretiasdaggers.com/downloads - $20 4. PurpleDreamArts Skull & Dagger jewelry by Larisa Gassel:Pewter/brass dagger & skull necklaces with or without beads (blue, green, plum, pink pearl, red, orange, black, silver, brass) on 9” black cord, and pewter/dagger earrings with or without beads (blue, green, plum, pink pearl, red, orange, black, silver, brass) and chains. See more photos here: https://lucretiasdaggers.com/cds-jewelry-swag For any issues or questions on pieces, please email: lucretiasdaggers@rcn.com​5. Ben Carlson Pewter & Dagger Jewelry - 7 collections in full color (midnight black, brick red, purple, bright blue, cobalt blue/black splatter, forest green/black splatter, burnt orange/black splatter); with or without 1 pewter skull on a dagger necklace, dagger earrings & dagger keyrings. See more photos here: https://lucretiasdaggers.com/cds-jewelry-swag​For any issues or questions on pieces, please email: lucretiasdaggers@rcn.com6. LD Sad Flower Songs (SFS) Magnets (19) & Pins/Buttons (25): Check them out on our website Store page: https://lucretiasdaggers.com/online-store - $27. LD Limited Sew-on Patches by Canney: (11) Long "Lucretia's Daggers" - 5" x 1" and (5) Square "LD" 3" x 2". Check them out on our website Store page: https://lucretiasdaggers.com/online-store - $45 Big Package Deals!: Package #1 (10): 1 Thoughts & Prayers EP (5 tracks), Sad Flower Songs CD (12 tracks), 1 Canney LD patch (long or square - random), 1 Sad Flower Songs magnet & 1 Sad Flower Songs button/pin - $50 Package #2 (7): 1 Thoughts & Prayers EP (5 tracks), 1 Sad Flower Songs CD (12 tracks), 1 Canney LD patch (long or square - random), 1 Sad Flower Songs magnet, 1 Sad Flower Songs button/pin, and 1 Ben Carlson Dagger keyring (random color) - $75Package #3 (7): 1 Thoughts & Prayers EP (5 tracks), 1 Sad Flower Songs CD (12 tracks), 1 Canney LD patch (long or square - random), 1 Sad Flower Songs magnet, 1 Sad Flower Songs button/pin, and 1 Ben Carlson Dagger necklace (random color) - $75Package #4 (5): 1 Thoughts & Prayers EP (5 tracks), 1 Sad Flower Songs CD (12 tracks), 1 Sky So Grey Limited Boston Goth Rock Compilation (15 tracks/bands), 1 Canney LD patch (long or square - random), 1 Sad Flower Songs magnet, 1 Sad Flower Songs button/pin, 1 Ben Carlson Dagger necklace (random color), and 1 Ben Carlson Dagger keyring (random color) - $100Package #5 (3): A PRIVATE PEFORMANCE - A Lucretia's Daggers Performance - at your house/location (or ours)! Plus both a Sad Flower Songs CD and a Thoughts & Prayers EP. Lucretia's Daggers will come to your yard or open-air space (or indoors when Covid safe) anywhere within 50 miles of Boston, on a mutually-agreed upon date, preferably on a weekend, sometime 2021-2022. We'll bring the sound system...unless you have your own! - $500All purchases carefully packaged in bubblewrap/CD mailers. Jewelry in plastic baggies. FREE WITH ALL PURCHASES...LD stickers & mini daggers! Contact us with questions: lucretiasdaggers@rcn.com, or to get a link the the finished videos/dates for CD releases. And, of course, donations to our PayPal account are always welcome! (Paypal @ paypal.me/LucretiasD, lucretiasdaggers@rcn.com.)Note: Even if you don't make a purchase from this fundraiser, you can still help our projects go forward. Please get the word out & MAKE SOME NOISE about our campaign! Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools. Thank you!             With a namesake derived from '80s cult band The Sisters of Mercy, Shakespeare/Livy-penned poetic biography, and 16th c. Borgia legend, Boston, Massachusetts' musicians Lucretia's Daggers blend darkwave, synthpop, and ambient metal with dramatic female vocals and have brought an arty touch to their "dark lyrical electro-rock for the apocalypse" since August 2001. (Below: Artemisia Gentileschi, Lucrezia 1623-25, National Gallery, Washington,DC)                                                                               The winter of 2019 found the reformation of the band with Maxx Charvelle on guitar/vox, Donni Darko on bass/vox, and Lucretia X. Machina on the mic/tambourine/megaphone. Rounding out the group is the fourth, most reliable, most electronic partner yet, a laptop named FOUR.

story:
Short Summary

We are working on  launching a pilot docuseries reflecting the story of Hal,  who has been making a living playing music in Las Vegas for the last 15 years. Now, with his entire family along for the ride, kids and everything, we will be going on tour to pursue his dreams of playing his own original music. 

Added to the authentic underdog plot is an exploration of cities through music like Anthony Bourdain did with food. HELP us turn our idea for the show Highway to Hal into a reality.  

 

What We Need

Our short term goal is to raise at least $18,000. These initial  funds will be used to create a pilot episode to show networks, sponsors, and producers as we hit the road on our 6 weeklong tour.   

Here is how the funds will be used: 

  • Film Crew
  • Transportation
  • Lodging / Meals
  •  Marketing
  • Social Media Re-Branding 
  • Content Creation 
  • Merchandise 
  • Video Editing 

 

The Impact

Live music is an important part of our world. Hal is currently hosting original talent showcases in Las Vegas as a way to recognize up and coming artists. Now, he will be able to highlight amazing artists and music venues across the country. 

Structure of each episode (subject to change):

  • Music influencers will meet Hal and give him insight about their city /  experiences.
  • Have a front row seat to some of the countries unique venues as Hal lights up their stages.  
  • Embedded in each episode will be genuine family experiences.
  • A new Hal original song will be released in each episode. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by sharing this link with everyone you can.

We need help finding...

  • Music influencers to be highlighted in an episode.
  • Studio or production executives interested in picking up our show.
  • Booking agents or venue owners in any city we will be visiting. (Complete city tour dates here): 
  • Sponsors interested in helping us fund our pilot and tour.

story:
Any money donated will go directly to recording and production fees even if I don't reach the full funding amount. I am dedicated to completing my 1st Album 

I have music ready to go! In investing in me you will really be lifting me of the ground and helping at the begin of my musical career,  It’s been a rocky road being an artist but I really believe in my path as an artist and with a lift from you guys i will be able to complete my first body of work. I am so thrilled I am getting such a good response to my demo tacks! be it from industry people, friend’s, family and you at Indigogo! I have overcome many an inner struggle and hurdle in life and it’s been through the power of music and in doing my music, I wish to pass on these learnings and vibrations that are captured in my music. I feel I’m on the home stretch and as for any hurdles that I accept which is just a thing  called life I will use them as challenges to over come creatively giving me more strength and force and creative fuel. I will always continue to song write and express myself. I will organize events and gigs to raise awareness and money for my music and help other talent along the way. Also I will work on recording more demos. I am  getting my songs executed and delivered the way i want them to be heard.  I will also work on exciting collaborations and keep evolving and developing as a musician, finding great joy and fullifment in my work.

If you cannot help financially you can help in any number of ways; you may be someone with good PR skills or good at organizing gigs/tours or may even be able to aid in production and recordings. Or you may wish to work with me as a musician. Quite simply I'd love your help and for your involvement on this musical adventure. Thank you for taking the time to read this and listening to the tracks up loaded! ENJOY!

I am very greatfull to everyone who has been helped me so far, imparticular the very gifted  musician ive worked with in a band; Eighly Hattary, Jimmy the Angle, Roy Jackson, Greame  and Steve Vicars (who has also recorded demos for me and we have co-produced a few dance tracks together- Steve is a great tallented singer songer writer you should check out!). Also I am so appreciative to Derek T at the Edinburgh Haymarket Music station for his deadication to music and his amazing musical ability in instramental parts he put down on a couple of demo tracks he recorded for me. I am so greatful for the tallent i have been able to work with and learn from along the way so far they are such valid clogs in the wheel and really hope to pay they for their efforts and contibutions past present and infuture terms.

story:
Kids Are the Hardest Hit When Budget Cuts Happen.

That's because music and art programs are being cut across the country due to lack of funding which means lack of arts opportunities for our youth.  The correlation between music and academic achievement is relevant and undeniable. Studies have already proven the link between arts participation and academic success. A student involved in the arts is four times more likely to be recognized for academic achievement. Low-income students who are highly engaged in the arts are twice as likely as their uninvolved peers to graduate from college. In spite of statistics such as these, 97% of elementary schools nationwide still do not offer dance and 96% do not offer theater.

It's Time to Turn Things Around and Give Kids The Edge They Need in a Challenging World.

Singer/Songwriter, Stephen B. Steward, alongside LOV Olive Branches CDC (LOBCDC), is making arts available.  Our mission is to Equip, Empower, and Educate.  LOBCDC serves at-risk youth in the Greater Los Angeles area through three programs:

1) Mentorship

2) Life Skills Training

3) Youth Music

Youth Music  is hosting it's 2nd Annual SBS Youth Talent Competition and Music Festival.  Winners of the competition receive scholarships to pursue their talent. The scholarships are designed to assist youth in the continued development of their talent while also providing financial assistance for education.  The event proudly offers a showcase for local youth musicians and performers. It gives the kids a chance to present their talents and it gives the community a chance to support them.

The competition is open to submissions from March 11th, 2015 through May 11th, 2015 for youth ages 5-17 and is a nation-wide search through online submissions at www.stephenbsteward.com/2015-talent-competition.  The 2nd Annual SBS Youth Talent competition and Music Festival event takes place on July 11th, 2015, at the Los Angeles Convention Center. We are inviting all to attend and encouraging youth ages 5-17 to participate.

This important youth program stays alive through community donations and sponsorships. 

Michael Austin, a 19 year old Music Major and one of LOV Olive Branches own, continues to make music at Sacramento State University. The college sophomore, with a 4.0 GPA this semester, got his start playing the drums and clarinet at Loma Alta Elementary and Elliott Middle School in Pasadena. He later added the piano, hammond organ and xylophone. Before graduating high school  Michael was voted in by his peers and elected Assistant Drum Major in his Junior year and Head Drum Major in his senior year at Pasadena High School. Michael played with the jazz band, symphony orchestra, drum line and marching band. He is currently studying Music Education and Music Performance and helps write music for a competitive drum line at Cordova High School.   Michael is just one of several students who have benefited from our program.


We're turning to crowdfunding to help the kids in the greater Los Angeles area to keep this program alive and thriving.  All pledges go to the non-profit and are tax-deductible.

The funding we're looking for will directly benefit kids as follows:

Youth Scholarships- $4,800

Public Awareness & Outreach - $2,799

Venue Fees and Audio Equipment Costs - $2,295

Miscellaneous - $200

We would love to exceed our goal of $10,094 so we can offer more scholarships, invite a photographer and videographer, and finance staging costs.  We already have a bare-bones budget so if we don’t meet our goal, a child may miss out on receiving a scholarship!  Please help us to continue by pledging a donation and receive a special thank you gift.  Let’s keep music and arts alive so our kids can thrive!

Show Your Support For Music and the Arts and the Kids Who Are Involved - We encourage you to back our project and spread the word about this Indiegogo campaign. Tell 5 people music is essential for student success in school and in life!

story:
Hello!

Hi, we're Standard Protocol a pop punk/alternative band from Stillwater, Minnesota. We're here to ask you to help us get our EP, Apartment 609, up and running. We plan to publish on platforms such as iTunes and Amazon MP3 (both of which we will release to). Getting us to this point will be a massive accomplishment for the band.

What We Need & What You Get

To release we need to raise $800; paying for studio time (around $600) and for distribution. If we don't reach our funding goal, any money raised will go to stage equipment for the band: on-stage monitors, microphones, etc. 

For your donation, all amounts are welcome, you can receive: 

  • A signed Thank You letter from the band for $5
  • A digital copy of the EP for $25
  • Your name on a list of donors on the EP for $100
The Impact

Your contribution is priceless to the band and helping getting us to where we want to be will make a big mark on our lives and hopefully yours too!

Risks & Challenges

None of the band members have produced an album and have never published work on places like iTunes, Google Play, Amazon MP3, etc. This is all new for us. As a band, we have achieved numerous great live performances and some demo work on songs. Taking these abilities to the next level, we plan to enter the studio and release a great EP for you.
Other Ways You Can Help
Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign and remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
About us!

Vintage Jukebox Orchestra (VJO) is an orchestra dedicated to the music of the 20s, 30s, 40s, 50s and early 60s!

The VJO is one-of-a-kind orchestra - the repertoire is very ambitious - the repertoire includes in fact 3 different and distinct repertoire - it would usually take 3 different bands to cover all of them - we do it with one!

- Gypsy Jazz / Jazz Manouche: this is a style of jazz music started by guitarist Jean "Django" Reinhardt in the 1930s. He later collaborated with violinist Stéphane Grappelli!

- Traditional Jazz / Dixieland / New Orleans R&B: there are festive, toe-tapping beats of New Orleans traditional jazz and dixieland music.  Featuring 20s and 30s repertoire from such luminaries as Bix Beiderbeck, Clarence Williams, Fats Waller, Jelly Roll Morton and Louis Armstrong.

- Big Band Era / Classic Swing: it was made popular by the famous orchestras of Count Basie, Duke Ellington, Jimmie Lunceford, Fletcher Henderson, and Artie Shaw  as well as the songs of Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin, Sarah Vaughan, Ella Fitzgerald to name just a few.  The repertoire includes an extensive catalogue of standards from the Great American Songbook, featuring the works of legendary songwriters: Irving Berlin, Cole Porter, Jerome Kern, Rodgers & Hammerstein, Cahn & Van Heusen, Julie Styne, the Gershwins and their peers.

This campaign is so important for us to take the orchestra to the next level - the only way to get there is to shoot a professional promotional video of the band performing all that music in the different configurations we are able to! We'll feature the band from a 4 piece to a 12 piece band!
Indeed, nowadays, audio samples, to promote such a large band, are no longer enough - booking agents and promoters for concerts, music series and corporate functions want to see and hear what the band sounds and looks like!

And this is where you come in! Help us make this orchestra a project come true!
You love one or all the repertoires listed above and would like to help us make it available to more listeners!
If you live in the Greater Bay Area (including the Sacramento area), you'll get a chance to see the band perform live!
If you live far away, you will probably enjoy some of our video but also we'll stream over the internet one of our future live performances!!
But no matter where you are, you will be able to listen and enjoy our music from the comfort of your own home!


What We Need & What You Get

We need $4000 to get us started!
Once the budget is raised and invested, the band should be self-sufficient financially to run on its own and cover future expenses!!

Take a look on the side at the different perks you will be receiving and see below how we will invest the money!

$4000 will be spent as follow:
$1,300: One day recording studio time with audio engineer + mixing all the songs
$300: Additional Lighting + backdrop
$600: One day video shoot + editing
$400: Catered lunch the day of the recording
$50: Rehearsal space rental
$300: additional horns players hired for the day of the recording (for the 6-horns section)
$200: Black band stands
$800: 20 charts for 3 & 6 horns

What if we go over $4000?

Well, that would be a nice thing to deal with. Depending on the amount raised, we'll consider:
- recording a live album
- adding a stage backdrop and some stage props for our live concerts
- invest in some additional custom arrangements


We thank you for reading, for sharing with friends and family members and for contributing to this project! And more importantly, we look forward to sharing our love of this music with all of you!

The Vintage Jukebox Orchestra team!
story_txt:
About us!
 Vintage Jukebox Orchestra (VJO) is an orchestra dedicated to the music of the 20s, 30s, 40s, 50s and early 60s!
The VJO is one-of-a-kind orchestra - the repertoire is very ambitious - the repertoire includes in fact 3 different and distinct repertoire - it would usually take 3 different bands to cover all of them - we do it with one!
- Gypsy Jazz / Jazz Manouche: this is a style of jazz music started by guitarist Jean "Django" Reinhardt in the 1930s. He later collaborated with violinist Stéphane Grappelli!
- Traditional Jazz / Dixieland / New Orleans R&B: there are festive, toe-tapping beats of New Orleans traditional jazz and dixieland music.  Featuring 20s and 30s repertoire from such luminaries as Bix Beiderbeck, Clarence Williams, Fats Waller, Jelly Roll Morton and Louis Armstrong.- Big Band Era / Classic Swing: it was made popular by the famous orchestras of Count Basie, Duke Ellington, Jimmie Lunceford, Fletcher Henderson, and Artie Shaw  as well as the songs of Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin, Sarah Vaughan, Ella Fitzgerald to name just a few.  The repertoire includes an extensive catalogue of standards from the Great American Songbook, featuring the works of legendary songwriters: Irving Berlin, Cole Porter, Jerome Kern, Rodgers & Hammerstein, Cahn & Van Heusen, Julie Styne, the Gershwins and their peers.This campaign is so important for us to take the orchestra to the next level - the only way to get there is to shoot a professional promotional video of the band performing all that music in the different configurations we are able to! We'll feature the band from a 4 piece to a 12 piece band!Indeed, nowadays, audio samples, to promote such a large band, are no longer enough - booking agents and promoters for concerts, music series and corporate functions want to see and hear what the band sounds and looks like!
And this is where you come in! Help us make this orchestra a project come true!You love one or all the repertoires listed above and would like to help us make it available to more listeners!If you live in the Greater Bay Area (including the Sacramento area), you'll get a chance to see the band perform live!If you live far away, you will probably enjoy some of our video but also we'll stream over the internet one of our future live performances!!But no matter where you are, you will be able to listen and enjoy our music from the comfort of your own home!

What We Need & What You Get
 We need $4000 to get us started!Once the budget is raised and invested, the band should be self-sufficient financially to run on its own and cover future expenses!!
Take a look on the side at the different perks you will be receiving and see below how we will invest the money!
$4000 will be spent as follow:$1,300: One day recording studio time with audio engineer + mixing all the songs$300: Additional Lighting + backdrop$600: One day video shoot + editing$400: Catered lunch the day of the recording$50: Rehearsal space rental$300: additional horns players hired for the day of the recording (for the 6-horns section)$200: Black band stands$800: 20 charts for 3 & 6 horns
What if we go over $4000?
Well, that would be a nice thing to deal with. Depending on the amount raised, we'll consider:- recording a live album- adding a stage backdrop and some stage props for our live concerts- invest in some additional custom arrangements

We thank you for reading, for sharing with friends and family members and for contributing to this project! And more importantly, we look forward to sharing our love of this music with all of you!
The Vintage Jukebox Orchestra team!

story:
Short Summary

Hey, Guys!!!

I am DJ Mo-Rilla, a new up and coming here in the grand city of Raleigh. Got myself into music at a young age and became an instrumentalist. Grew up and got a degree in Audio Production and Design. Now, I"m expanding my business into Karaoke.

Who doesn't love a good karaoke night? I could use some help to bring more karaoke to the people who want it most. There can never be enough. I have bars lined up waiting for me.

What We Need & What You Get

I need $5000 to buy karaoke sound packs to have a variety of songs available. A good karaoke DJ has at least 10,000 songs.

I have all the equipment I need. All that's left are the songs and to create the books. If I don't achieve my entire goal, I will get as many songs as I possibly can.

Other Ways You Can Help

 I know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks Guys!!!

story:
HELLO I'm Conrad!

HELLO! My name is Conrad. I'm an indie pop/rock singer/songwriter. Some of you may know me from a few years ago when I released my "Takeoff" EP. It included my singles, like "Namedropper", "Romeo" and ballad "Safe Here Now". I was blessed to get radio play in a lot of the west coast markets, in which "Namedropper" was the number 1 song on one of those station for a full month. "Romeo" followed and received even more radio exposure. 

As things calmed down from the release of this EP. I found myself without a label, without management, and unsure if I was even good enough to be a recording artist. Although at first this was heartbreaking, it was actually a blessing in disguise. I have spent the past two years experiencing life, listening to others stories, and experiences. I got the opportunity to be there for my supporters in their dark times, and learn with them, and from them. I found myself both personally and musically.

After all of this it became clear that my music wasn't meant to be just music, and it's not about me. It is a catalyst to opening doors to peoples hearts, and let them know life is going to be okay and that they have a purpose. I want my music, and my life to be dedicated to reminding my generation and the generations to come, that they have the power to do great things for our world.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

A few years ago I started an album, but it was placed on hold. I would like to finish that album with the songs I have written the past few years from the lessons I've learned. I would like to then take the music and travel around to schools, malls, and other venues throwing concerts/inspirational talks inspiring my generation to come together and fight for our world. We face so many struggles these days and it is up to my generation to change what is wrong. I believe we need to stop separating ourselves from each other, and start coming together again, because together great things happen, and obstacles are destroyed. We celebrate our freedoms, but forget those that fought for them. We base our lives on "things",  and forget what's truely irreplacable. We give beauty power, and it distracts us from what matters. We need to remember what life is really about.

I am asking for any help you may be able to give me in my effort to complete what I believe is my purpose. I am setting the bar high at 10k. This will help me not only record the songs I have written, but also take me to schools, malls, etc to spread the message to my generation. I honestly don't know if I can reach this goal, but I figure it's worth a shot. With your help, we can do amazing things!

IndieGoGo allows us to keep the funds even if we don't reach our goal. In the event I don't reach the goal, I will take the lemons, and make the best dang lemonade I can make with your generous contributions. 

In the event I exceed my goal, I will put all of those funds into taking my outreach tour to as many places as I can, and to as many youth as I can. It's all about spreading the message that it is up to us to change the world. 

If You Cant Donate...

I understand not everyone has the means to contribute, and that's okay!!! 

Taking a few minutes to post about my campaign on your Facebook, twitter, etc would be amazing also! Maybe you can't contribute at this time, but maybe your post will reach someone else that can. Any support means the world to me! THANK YOU!

story:
ME and THIS ALBUM

Since moving to Nashville in 2010 it has been my #1 goal to produce some of the best music I could possibly write and record! The reason behind this goal has always been the same; to be able to give you, my fans, my heart in musical form. 

During the past year or so I have grown both emotionally and mentally as a musician, writer, and overall human-being. I have rediscovered both my musical roots and myself as an artist/musician in general. In early January my team and I started working on a new single titled "Let Me In", and on March 3rd we released it via iTunes, Bandcamp, and just about digital platform! In a little less than a week it hit 1000 plays on Soundclound; it hit 2000 plays the next week. It is now close to 3000 plays. All I can say is thank you SO much!

I'm both thrilled and excited to announce my plans for a new Zach Ummer EP.

THIS ALBUM

In the last year or so I have written a number of songs; each one dealing with their own share of heartbreak, emotional healing and overall self discovery. The time I have put into each one of them scares me every time I think about it! These songs are pieces of me. They are raw, honest, and straight from my heart to yours. 

During the last few years I have been inspired by many styles of music, but the one thing that they all have in common is the way they were recorded; to tape using analog equipment. I believe this is the best way to present these songs to you.

ANALOG?: Today, many bands use a digital interface and computer to record their albums. I want to make it the old school way. I want it to sound warm and full of emotion and grit; think about how Taylor Swift's "1989" sounds and then compare it to Fleetwood Mac's "Rumours". 

I want to make a record that sounds just as amazing as "Rumours"! 

What We Need & What You Get
Every contribution of $5 or more to this project will serve as a pre-order for the album itself. I truly want YOU to have this music! Every contribution made will get you an immediate copy of "Let Me In"!
For this album to succeed it needs to sound right; this means I need to hire the right people/musicians, record it in the most appropriate studio, and use the right equipment (vintage mics, guitars, amps, drums) to achieve the sounds we need. 
THIS ALL COSTS MONEY! 
Allow me to be as transparent as possible (where your money is going):
Album = 6 Songs (including "Let Me In"):

  • 2 days of studio time at Fry Pharmacy Recording — $800
  • 5 songs with 7 fantastic musicians — $1900
  • Tracking 5 songs with an audio engineer — $1140
  • Edits and mixing — $1100
  • Album Mastering — $350
  • Album CD pressing and distribution — $1000-$1300
  • Merch and countless string breakage — $250-$400 


    • In addition to all this expensive stuff, there are a whole bunch of other give aways that cost $0.00; things that I will be making using my graphic design skills, musical things that nobody but me has heard, and personal things from me to you!

    Risks & Challenges

    Obviously, like all great projects worth doing, there are some risks and some challenges. It takes a lot for me to do this campaign. I paid my own money to record the video for it! $7000 is an extremely large amount of money, but look at it this way: 

    If 1000 people all decided to donate 7 dollars, we could start working on this album. If 500 people all decided to donate $14 we would hit the goal as well! 

    Though $7000 is our goal, the more money we raise, the more we can do for you!

    NO MONEY, BUT WANT TO HELP

    SHARE! SHARE! SHARE! That is the most important thing you can do (even if you choose not to contribute) to help this project come to life; the more people that see this campaign the better! Without you guys this music would never exist publicly! It would stay in my head and never escape the craziness that is my brain; help me set this music free!

story:
Short Summary

The Maryland State Boychoir is in our 28th season.  Founded in 1987 by Frank Cimino, the Boychoir has grown from 14 choristers to 150 strong.  The choirs of the MSB present over 100 performances each season and tour throughout the state of Maryland, the USA, and abroad.  Recent performance and tour highlights have included performances at The Meyerhoff Symphony Hall (Baltimore), The Kennedy Center (Washington DC), The Kimmel Center (Philadelphia), as well as performances in Belgium, Bermuda, Canada, France, Germany, Iceland, Netherlands, and Puerto Rico (US Territory). 

The Maryland State Boychoir (Tour Choir) has been chosen to perform two performances in Salt Lake City, Utah at the bi-annual American Choral Director's Association National Conference.  The MSB was selected from an applicant pool of choirs from throughout the nation and abroad.  The Maryland State Boychoir was the ONLY boychoir to be invited to perform at this event!  An invitation to perform at this prestigious conference is a coveted one and some have suggested that a "sporting equivalent" would be a youth baseball team making it to the "Little League World Series."  

Our tour to Utah was not a part of our original plans for the 2014-2015 season.  Even so, an invitation of this nature is not one to turn down and our choristers, parents, staff, and board of directors are all VERY PROUD of this accomplishment that our young students have achieved.  

What We Need & What You Get

In order to fully fund our trip to Sal Lake City, Utah, the Boychoir needs to raise $40,000.00.  This figure includes airfare for 45 choristers and adult chaperones, housing, meals, ground transportation, gratuities, and sight-seeing/educational opportunities.  

All donations $50.00 and above will receive unique PERKS.  These include MSB promo items, concert tickets, recordings, private wine & cheese parties, and a personalized dinner part and performance by choristers from the Maryland State Boychoir. 

The Impact

Your gift to this campaign will ensure our choristers' full participation in this event and will help the MSB to not incur any "debt" in fulfilling this momentous invitation.

Throughout our 28 year history, The Maryland State Boychoir has proven to be an innovator and leader in the world of choral music,  Our establishment of a Center for the Arts, our commissioning of new music, our extensive performance schedule, and our travels to famous and unexpected places, has lead to our prominent place in the local and national arts scene.  

This performance opportunity will further enhance the reputation that you have helped us to grow and build over the years.

Risks & Challenges

Accepting this invitation is, no doubt, a RISK.  It requires special fundraising, students to miss school days, and a "risk factor" that is found when performing for distinguished conductors from throughout the world.  We believe that the MSB is ready for the challenge and we hope that you agree that our mission and sound is "ready to go public"!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps you are unable to contribute at this time...might you consider sharing our campaign with someone who is able to do so?  Please help us to spread the word of the great work that the Maryland State Boychoir is doing.  As we travel, we ask for your well wishes, prayers, and encouragement!

We are so very grateful and humbled by your partnership in the work of the Maryland State Boychoir and offer our sincere gratitude and love for all that you do!

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of young people from a small town in Bosnia & Herzegovina where nothing ever happens. In order to change that we have decided to organize a small electronic music festival.
We wish to gather as many people as we can to share a great experience.
This won't include only people from our town or even country but people from all over the Balkans and if possible Europe.
Since there wasn't anything similar in this part of Bosnia for a long time,this would be a huge deal. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our minimum goal is 4000 dollars. The funding goes to the acquiring of the necessary permits for the location of the festival,renting of the stage,musical equipment,fees for the musicians as well as the security for the festival.
Our exact budget will be updated as we find out the exact prices for everything.
If the goal is suppressed,all the extra money will go to acquiring more stage acts.
If the goal is not met we will still try to organize the festival,albeit on a smaller scale. 

The Impact

HOLY CRAP PEOPLE ! Do you have any idea how much this would mean to all of us living here?  
Nothing ever happens here, so at the least this would wake a sleepy town up, at the best we could have another Woodstock.
We plan on bringing DJ's from all over the Balkans
The experience would have a huge impact on the whole region. 

Risks & Challenges

Our main problem would be the weather. Since it would be an open air festival, rain could cause us huge headaches. Apart from that there should be no bigger problems.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to donate we would be very grateful if you could spread the message to people who could be interested.

Come on people help some poor Slavs out!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt: Short Summary Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:  Introduce yourself and your background. Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you. Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.  Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?   What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:  Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.  Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited! Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.    The Impact Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:  Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world. Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one). Make it real for people and build trust.    Risks & Challenges  People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.  Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles. Describe your plan for solving these challenges.    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello,

Thanks for watching our video. And if you haven't yet, here's the rundown. We're Drakeville! We are four guys dedicated to creating awesome music, and it's our goal to make this our career. To do that, our next step is to record an EP that can be distributed to fans, bands, venues, and labels. We want to put our best foot forward, and we believe that recording at Silver Bullet Studios, under the guidance of Misery Signals' Greg Thomas, is the best way we can go about that. 

As many people know (or can guess), pursuing music is an expensive endeavor. Recording an album can be very costly, but it is well worth the money spent to help with promoting a band to a wider audience. That's where you come in! 

Recording, mixing, and mastering our EP will cost roughly $2500. However, our expenses won't end there. We would like to offer various incentives to help entice you to contribute to our cause. You can select one of the five perks on the right side of the page. Each perk level includes the items listed at the price points below it as well. 

When we factor in the number of physical copies of our CD, t-shirts, and posters that we'll need to provide (and the associated shipping costs), we estimate our expenses will rise to $3500. 

Although our highest perk rings in at $250, we certainly won't prevent you from donating more than that amount! There is no limit! And if you would like to donate without receiving an item, you can select a dollar amount (preset or custom) directly above the pink “Contribute Now” button to the right of our video. 

$3500 is our goal, and we believe it to be attainable. We are confident that the final product will be worth every dollar invested. Whether you donate $5, $50, or $500, all of your support will be greatly appreciated! And in the end, if we exceed our goal, every extra dollar will be spent making sure that this EP grants us the maximum exposure possible.

Thanks for your time, and we hope you'll be a part of our future!

Drakeville

story:
NASHVILLE IS RUBBING OFF ON US!

We have been musicians together since we met in college in 1997. After years of being in rock bands, we've recently been writing and performing a more country sound.  Our rock influenced country style is mixed with heavy vocal harmonies and unforgettable hooks. Both originally from Mississippi, we create songs inspired by our connection to deep southern roots and the life experience those roots produce.  With your help, we hope to put an EP out very soon!  
There are so many amazing studios and musicians to work with in this great town, and we want to get it right.  Unfortunately, it's pretty costly!  Here's what the money will go towards:

  • Studio time
  • Engineer fees
  • Additional musicians
  • Licensing fees, copyrighting, legal documents
  • CD art, printing, pressing, etc.
  • Mixing & Mastering
  • iTunes, Spotify, Pandora, etc. registration fees

Pre-purchase the cd to help us make this happen!  We also have some other great perks if you wanna help out a little more.  We GREATLY appreciate any help you can give!  Also, please help us get the word out!  Share with your family and friends on Facebook, Twitter, email, etc.  THANK YOU!  THANK YOU!  THANK YOU!

Lots of Love,

Andrea & Jason

OXFORD FALL

story:
Hello Friends,

Thank you so much for all who have supported me so far.  We are coming down to the end of the Campaign and I appreciate all your help.  I will be flying to Ireland on May 10 and will shoot the video in County Cavan, Ireland on May 12 and 14.  The flight will be on American Airlines and I have been offered accommodation from my friend and performer Andreas Durkin and The Crover House Hotel outside of Ballyjamesduff, Cavan.   Thanks to Joanne Hayes and Ger Finn of the Cavan County Council, we will shoot in at The Cavan Burran Park.  It's one of God's great creations!  We will also shoot some of the indoor footage and more outdoor footage at Crover House courtesy of Connie O'Reilly.  On May 13, I will be back in the Studio working with Johnathan Owens in Granard, Co Longford on 3 or 4 new tracks for the new CD.  We are full steam ahead. 

For those that don't know me, for the past several years I have enjoyed a great career in Irish Music that has taken me from the Catskill Mountains to Carnegie Hall.  I have also a great passion for Country Music.  There is a Country & Irish Music craze on the rise and I want to be part of it.  I wrote this song "On the Eighth Day" with an old friend John Alexander and my drummer Jimmy Kelly.  I figured what better thing for God to create after he rested on the 7th Day after creating the world!  As you listen to the recording you'll hear how we brought Country and Irish together!

I have to now is create a video of this song .   Videos can be extremely expensive to make.  It has to really hit the mark to capture the viewer.  It has become an essential part of promotion for both the recording artist, the song and the album. 

Most of you that have my recordings know that I always release top recordings productions with the finest musicians.  Unfortunately their have been many changes in the Music business where their is no longer any profit for artist like myself in making recordings.  People are now downloading music for 99 cents or streaming it for free.  Recording has become a promotional tool to help keep the artists out there.   We do sell some CDs at the gigs but not nearly enough to recuperate the cost of making an album and the videos related.
I want to make each and everyone of you apart of this journey and will keep you up to speed on our progress as we go along.  When it's finished, I will furnish you with the new CD and will enclose a personal thank you to each and everyone of you.  
The recording is getting a lot of play on programs all over Ireland and here in the States.  In fact it was the "Pick of the Week" on Elite Country Music Radio. 
If I don't expect to reach this $50,000 goal, I will finance the rest of the money on my own.  I know that times are difficult for people.  I felt a little strange about doing this campaign but as I spoke with other performers like myself, they said it's worth reaching out to our fans that want to hear our music and want to come see us perform.  It's important to me to put out the best quality possible.  I don't expect anyone with financial difficulty to donate.  Those that know me, I do a lot of charity work for no fee and donate CDs to many organizations for raffles and so on.  If you are in good financial shape and you love my music, I'd appreciate your help.   For all those that know me well they know that once I start something I finish it!  My goal is to have The Eighth Day video up on YouTube by mid June and the CD finished by September.
Even a donation of $1 to $10 will make you part of this awesome journey.  Please don't hesitate to email me your support at andycooney@aol.com.  I'd love to hear from you.

story:
Who Am I?

I am Appointed. First and foremost, I am the "called out" servant of GOD with a heart for the LORD and His people. As a Pastor and Christian Recording Artist I have a passion for touching lives for His Glory through His Word and through music. My desire is not only to touch lives through His Word and music but to meet the observable needs of people, such as feeding the homeless, clothing the poor visiting the sick.

Through this ministry, Appointed Music Ministries, we impacts lives for His Glory and we are growing beyond the resources that we have at hand and are looking to you to act as a donor/sponsor to help us keep pace with the expansion of our work



Where are the Funds Going?

The funds will be used to do things like:

  • Ministry expenses
  • Traveling expenses (huge because of our heart to do an Africa Crusade)
  • Album recording expenses
  • TV/Radio production expenses
  • Sunday in the Park (community outreach event)


The Impact

Win, Win, Win. You win because you are sharing in spreading the gospel message, The people win because they are helped. Appointed music wins because we get to continue to spread the gospel message across the country and around the world.

Risks & Challenges

If there be any risk or challenges at all, it will be that you dear reader will not help with the work. I truly trust that GOD will supply according to His Vast riches. I am committed to the cause of Christ, I will endure until the end no matter what. What we do is effective, even if just "one" life that is transformed, it is all so worth it. We trust Him an trust that His Activity will be done

I am walking by faith, just as I have done all these years.

The plan is to keep continue to trust that the Lord has a Plan.

If You Can't Give

then please, give what you can. A prayer, a word of encouragement, a share of this campaign on your social media sites, e-mails, word of mouth. Technology has made it too easy to be helpful. Clicking the share button will aid us in raising the money we need to keep this ministry moving for His Glory.

story:
Short Summary

Opera Forza, a budding opera company in northern NJ, is dedicated to bringing high-quality, grand operatic productions to the area. Founded by Charles Schneider and Amanda Lee, Opera Forza hopes to give talented local opera singers an opportunity to perform in these productions, while contributing to the musical growth of the area. 

Opera Forza also strives to make grand opera available to the everyone, and the only way to keep ticket prices low is by receiving support from outside contributors. Any amount will help make an impact on the quality and frequency of these productions.

What We Need & What You Get

To mount our next operatic production, we need to raise $10,000.00 

  • This helps fund the orchestra, conductor, singers, costumes, and other artistic staff and supplies to make for a thrilling operatic experience.
  • Contributors who donate $1500.00 or more will participate in a "meet & greet" cocktail hour with the performers of our next production. 
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, the performance will be reduced to a piano concert production or abridged version with chamber ensemble.

The Impact

Grand opera is not a dying art form. Small, local opera companies like Opera Forza are thriving, choosing to focus solely on the artistic value of their productions. Our motto, "An ear to the past, an eye to the future" places emphasis on the golden age of opera, when singing and acting were the most important aspect, without a need for multi-million dollar sets and costumes. We hope to return to these ideals, renewing a love and appreciation for an art form that speaks to our most fundamental and visceral emotions as human beings.

Opera Forza made its debut last August with a performance of Madama Butterfly. On a shoestring budge, the company was able to deliver an exciting and moving performance that left the audience asking for more. There IS a demand for this art form in Northern NJ. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, or if you would like to be more involved, there are several other ways you can help.

  • Get the word out! Indiegogo has a "share" button for Facebook, Twitter, or email. Share with everyone you know!
  • Volunteer! We always need help with administration, whether it's folding/handing out programs, distributing flyers, or ushering at a performance.
  • Sing! Play! Are you a singer or an instrumentalist? Whether an amateur or professional, we want to hear you! There is always room in the chorus or orchestra, and we hold auditions for lead roles on an appointment basis. Email director@operaforza.com for more information.
