story: I am embarking on my first solo project and would love to have you parter with me in getting it complete by helping to fund the finishing of the project.
story_txt: I am embarking on my first solo project and would love to have you parter with me in getting it complete by helping to fund the finishing of the project.

story:
Short summary

I am Oganalp Canatan, creator of the power-progressive metal project Maegi and singer of the bands Dreamtone and Dreamtone & Iris Mavraki's Neverland. For over a decade, I have been active in metal music scene. With my bands, I released 8 studio albums and singles and had the chance to tour Europe, share the stage with names like Blind Guardian, Dream Theater, Anathema, Opeth and more. And I had the chance to work with talented musicians from different bands like Hansi Kürsch (of Blind Guardian), Tim Ripper Owens (of ex. Judas Priest and Iced Earth), Jon Oliva (of Savatage, JoP and Trans Siberian Orchestra) and many more.


I am not a touring artist and album sales are never enough to compensate the album expenses, set aside make a living. In the past, I was able to juggle my finances, even if at a bare minimum, and produce albums on my own by doing everything on my own (from design to accounting, engineering to playing and singing, sending packages to PR). However, because of economic instability of my country - I live in Turkey - against Euro and USD currencies, it became impossible to sustain this balance even if I do everything on my own. Therefore, I am in need of your help to be able to complete the second Maegi album; Tales from the King's Court.


Where does the money go?

Here is a short list of expenses and why they are needed to be able to complete the project.

  • The average cost of recording an album in a good studio environment takes around 5.000 USD. This includes studio rates, session player expenses and equipment. I am willing to work with a rather well known drummer for progressive metal fans and to be able to achieve this, I need to be able to pay the studio.
  • About 2.000 USD is needed for an album with 11 tracks to be  mastered with quality. I am hoping to work with Sterling Sound NY as I did in the past in order to be able to present you the best possible outcome.
  • And another 3.000 USD is needed to be able to manufacture the albums, including the legal paperwork and expenses regarding the pressing of the CDs as well as the booklets and artwork.
  • A certain amount from these sums (around 15 - 20%) will be deducted as tax and campaign expenses of IndieGoGo.

I will also try and add as much as I can to the pool and raise the necessary sums.

What if you exceed these amounts as income?

Here are some tiers to be added if we exceed the necessary amounts. These expenses are rough (but educated) estimates.

- 12.000 USD -> better mixing with an industry known sound engineer.

- 16.000 USD -> a music video for one of the songs of you, the listeners' pick!

- 25.000 USD -> a big choir company added to the album

- 35.000 USD -> a vinyl version of the album
If things go way uber and we manage to raise even more, I am sure we can find an artistic way to best spend these funds like a 3rd Maegi album or more production values, etc.

Why your help matters more than worlds?

I was involved in music all my life and I always wanted to present people my music as an album they can listen to and discover long after its production date. Nowadays, it is mostly about making home-made music videos and going online. I respect that, but it is not who I am. I want to create an album, a story or stories to tell you and share them with you. With your help, this can happen.

I work as a graphical designer and the money I make is not even enough to keep the house afloat if we didn't work together with my SO. In the past, I was able to produce my albums with some careful financial planning and lots, LOTS of hardwork. The planning and hard working traits are still there, but since our currency lost almost 40% of its value against USD in the last few years, it is no longer an option to fight everything on my own. Together, we can win this battle.

For those who are not familiar with my name, here are some artists who appeared on my previous albums as guests, helping me tell my stories;
- Hansi Kürsch (Blind Guardian)
- Chris Boltendahl (Grave Digger)
- Tim Ripper Owens (ex. Judas Priest, ex. Iced Earth)
- Zak Stevens (Savatage, Circle II Circle)
- Jon Oliva (Savatage, Jon Oliva's Pain, Trans Siberian Orchestra)
- Jerry Outlaw (ex. Jon Oliva's Pain, Bogus Pomp)
- Tom Englund (Evergrey)
- Mike Baker (Shadow Gallery)
- Gary Wehrkamp (Shadow Gallery)
- Edu Falaschi (ex. Angra)
- Urban breed (ex. Tad Morose, Serious Black)

I was also a member of AFM Records family with my band Dreamtone & Iris Mavraki's Neverland. As a musician, with my bands, I had the privilege of sharing stage with Opeth, Dream Theater, Blind Guardian, Anathema, Evergrey, Haggard, UDO, Megadeth, Destruction, Jon Oliva's Pain and more.

Album guests

Maegi’s Skies Fall had guests. I would be happy to feature new names with the second disc but I am leaving this option outside of this campaign as the appearance of a guest is highly dependent on the artists involved rather than me and it may affect the production calendar. For example, when we were working with Hansi Kürsch (Blind Guardian) for the first time back in 2007, he had to postpone his recordings six times due to various reasons (even a tornado hit the studio he was recording once!). Therefore, I am willing to reserve this “aspect” of the album as a possible surprise. There may be guests or I may be the only artist performing the album. In any case, I will try and present you the very best. (Hint: if we can pull this off, there are some names I am already talking to ;) )

Risks & challenges

The album production will be completed no matter what as I am a seasoned producer and artist with already 8 releases under my belt and as a musician who had worked with metal music’s important names in the past, near to other contributions on different artists’ albums. I am also an endorsed Steinberg artist. The aim of this campaign is to collect the funds necessary forehand to be able to create the artistic freedom rather than doing more accounting than recording.

The majority of the recordings will be done in my own home studio, therefore the accessibility and production time will be as productive as possible. The album artwork is already being done by Yiğit Köroğlu, who also did the cover arts for Maegi's first album and my first book.  Certain preliminary dialogues with other studios for the “better mixing option” milestone was already underway long before this campaign and as I stated earlier, I already have one hell of a drummer to work with if things go well. Therefore, this album is happening.

The only risk is that, people may not like my music and there is nothing I can do about it as it is a matter of taste. However, as this is neither Maegi’s nor my first album, the listeners can have an insight about how the album will sound. There are also demo-session videos available to better judge the process and I will upload more following the campaign.

Oh, it is a possibility that I may be ran over by a car or killed by some freak accident. If that is the case, well, thank you for reading this wall of text and supporting my dream =).


Release Date

This may be a challenge with lots of production values added. However, the last time for Maegi’s first album and the collector’s edition box (with a novella as well), without any funds raised, I was able to release the album with two months delay, which was announced way forehand as a possibility due to the calendar hitting the holiday season and certain third party organizations and services were unavailable due to holidays (like the Ministry of Culture's Copyright department, which is responsible for authorizing the necessary legal certificate of printing an audio CD)


You cannot contribute financially but want to help?

You can share the campaign, tell people about it. Share its videos, news, music and reach out to new listeners that I cannot. This is not a piggy bank campaign, we are making an album together and every effor counts!

Short summary I am Oganalp Canatan, creator of the power-progressive metal project Maegi and singer of the bands Dreamtone and Dreamtone & Iris Mavraki's Neverland. For over a decade, I have been active in metal music scene. With my bands, I released 8 studio albums and singles and had the chance to tour Europe, share the stage with names like Blind Guardian, Dream Theater, Anathema, Opeth and more. And I had the chance to work with talented musicians from different bands like Hansi Kürsch (of Blind Guardian), Tim Ripper Owens (of ex. Judas Priest and Iced Earth), Jon Oliva (of Savatage, JoP and Trans Siberian Orchestra) and many more.

I am not a touring artist and album sales are never enough to compensate the album expenses, set aside make a living. In the past, I was able to juggle my finances, even if at a bare minimum, and produce albums on my own by doing everything on my own (from design to accounting, engineering to playing and singing, sending packages to PR). However, because of economic instability of my country - I live in Turkey - against Euro and USD currencies, it became impossible to sustain this balance even if I do everything on my own. Therefore, I am in need of your help to be able to complete the second Maegi album; Tales from the King's Court.
   Where does the money go? Here is a short list of expenses and why they are needed to be able to complete the project.  The average cost of recording an album in a good studio environment takes around 5.000 USD. This includes studio rates, session player expenses and equipment. I am willing to work with a rather well known drummer for progressive metal fans and to be able to achieve this, I need to be able to pay the studio.
About 2.000 USD is needed for an album with 11 tracks to be  mastered with quality. I am hoping to work with Sterling Sound NY as I did in the past in order to be able to present you the best possible outcome.
And another 3.000 USD is needed to be able to manufacture the albums, including the legal paperwork and expenses regarding the pressing of the CDs as well as the booklets and artwork.
A certain amount from these sums (around 15 - 20%) will be deducted as tax and campaign expenses of IndieGoGo.


I will also try and add as much as I can to the pool and raise the necessary sums.


What if you exceed these amounts as income?Here are some tiers to be added if we exceed the necessary amounts. These expenses are rough (but educated) estimates.

- 12.000 USD -> better mixing with an industry
known sound engineer.
- 16.000 USD -> a music video for one of the
songs of you, the listeners' pick!
- 25.000 USD -> a big choir company added to
the album- 35.000 USD -> a vinyl version of the album
If things go way uber and we manage to raise even more, I am sure we can find an artistic way to best spend these funds like a 3rd Maegi album or more production values, etc.
   Why your help matters more than worlds?
I was involved in music all my life and I always wanted to present people my music as an album they can listen to and discover long after its production date. Nowadays, it is mostly about making home-made music videos and going online. I respect that, but it is not who I am. I want to create an album, a story or stories to tell you and share them with you. With your help, this can happen.

I work as a graphical designer and the money I make is not even enough to keep the house afloat if we didn't work together with my SO. In the past, I was able to produce my albums with some careful financial planning and lots, LOTS of hardwork. The planning and hard working traits are still there, but since our currency lost almost 40% of its value against USD in the last few years, it is no longer an option to fight everything on my own. Together, we can win this battle.

For those who are not familiar with my name, here are some artists who appeared on my previous albums as guests, helping me tell my stories;
- Hansi Kürsch (Blind Guardian)- Chris Boltendahl (Grave Digger)- Tim Ripper Owens (ex. Judas Priest, ex. Iced Earth)- Zak Stevens (Savatage, Circle II Circle)- Jon Oliva (Savatage, Jon Oliva's Pain, Trans Siberian Orchestra)- Jerry Outlaw (ex. Jon Oliva's Pain, Bogus Pomp)- Tom Englund (Evergrey)- Mike Baker (Shadow Gallery)- Gary Wehrkamp (Shadow Gallery)- Edu Falaschi (ex. Angra)- Urban breed (ex. Tad Morose, Serious Black)

I was also a member of AFM Records family with my band Dreamtone & Iris Mavraki's Neverland. As a musician, with my bands, I had the privilege of sharing stage with Opeth, Dream Theater, Blind Guardian, Anathema, Evergrey, Haggard, UDO, Megadeth, Destruction, Jon Oliva's Pain and more.


Album guestsMaegi’s
Skies Fall had guests. I would be happy to feature new names with the second
disc but I am leaving this option outside of this campaign as the appearance of
a guest is highly dependent on the artists involved rather than me and it may
affect the production calendar. For example, when we were working with Hansi
Kürsch (Blind Guardian) for the first time back in 2007, he had to postpone his
recordings six times due to various reasons (even a tornado hit the studio he
was recording once!). Therefore, I am willing to reserve this “aspect” of the
album as a possible surprise. There may be guests or I may be the only artist
performing the album. In any case, I will try and present you the very best. (Hint: if we can pull this off, there are some names I am already talking to ;) )

   Risks & challenges  
The album production will be completed no matter what as I
am a seasoned producer and artist with already 8 releases under my belt and as
a musician who had worked with metal music’s important names in the past, near
to other contributions on different artists’ albums. I am also an endorsed Steinberg artist. The aim of this campaign
is to collect the funds necessary forehand to be able to create the artistic
freedom rather than doing more accounting than recording. 
The majority of the recordings will be done in my own home
studio, therefore the accessibility and production time will be as productive
as possible. The album artwork is already being done by Yiğit Köroğlu, who also did the cover arts for Maegi's first album and my first book.  Certain preliminary dialogues with other studios for the
“better mixing option” milestone was already underway long before this campaign and as I stated earlier, I already have one hell of a drummer to work with if things go well. Therefore, this album is
happening.
The only risk is that, people may not like my music and
there is nothing I can do about it as it is a matter of taste. However, as this
is neither Maegi’s nor my first album, the listeners can have an insight about
how the album will sound. There are also demo-session videos available to better
judge the process and I will upload more following the campaign.
Oh, it is a possibility that I may be ran over by a car or killed by some freak accident. If that is the case, well, thank you for reading this wall of text and supporting my dream =).


Release Date
This may be a challenge with lots of production values
added. However, the last time for Maegi’s first album and the collector’s
edition box (with a novella as well), without any funds raised, I was able to
release the album with two months delay, which was announced way forehand as a
possibility due to the calendar hitting the holiday season and certain third
party organizations and services were unavailable due to holidays (like the Ministry of Culture's Copyright department, which is responsible for authorizing the necessary legal certificate of printing an audio CD)
   You cannot contribute financially but want to help? You can share the campaign, tell people about it. Share its videos, news, music and reach out to new listeners that I cannot. This is not a piggy bank campaign, we are making an album together and every effor counts!

story:
The Album

Back in 2012 Boss Moxi set out to the hills of Maleny QLD to write and record demos for an album. 2 years later after performing the tracks live throughout our hometown of Brisbane, taking the tracks on tour  through New South Wales and Victoria we secured a producer and began recording at Bedlam Records in April of 2014. For 10 months we worked closely with producer, Steve Kempnich in turning our concepts in a full 14 track album.

Our album is now complete! We've spent an insane amount of time and effort creating what we are so proud of and now we need your help in the mastering, pressing and release of our creation to the world. Simply put - we need to find 700 dedicated fans to donate $10 each to make our creation come to life.


First Single off the album - Song of Joan


Where The Money Goes & What You  Get

Mastering, Printing & Pressing - $2,000

We need as much as we can get. Printing bulk CDs and Vinyls is not particularly easy and cheap. We need to master the tracks then print enough CDs to gift all you generous contributors, service and distribute the album to radio stations and press companies all over the globe. Owning and listening to the 14 track album on Vinyl is a dream of ours and when you hear the album will most probably be a dream shared by us and yourself. 

Release & Promotion - $3,000

For the most successful outcome we need to spend good money on promoting the album to reviewers, publications and music blogs all over the world. In this game of an industry we call music we need to play the right cards to ensure our creation is heard by as many people as possible, paying for separate press campaigns in Australia, U.K and the U.S. 

Merchandise & Final Tour - $2,000

After all this is paid for we want to take the album on an East-Coast tour which is currently being booked. Even though one of our members is now studying in America we're willing to re-band and rehearse with close friends and bring the album live to Queensland, New South Wales and Victoria in April of this year. Along with album merchandise it will be a least we can do to thank all of the contributors nation wide for their willing support.

What's in it for you?

Apart from the album itself, there's plenty of merchandise and personal incentives to thank each and every contributor. This campaign is basically a glorified pre-order of the album. We're not asking you to help us record the album, that hard work is done, we just want you to own it, listen to it and show as me people as you want. We'll come drink beers with you, jam and write music with you and for the right amount we'll even tattoo ourselves for you... Just get involved. 

Second Single off the album - Nymphomaniac


The Impact

It is our first and potentially final release from the band. All this depends on the success of the album. We've been a band since leaving school in 2009 and some of us are now pursuing different paths in life. The success of this album will bring us together, give us a stronghold for a promising future and begin the reality of what was always simply an immensely enjoyable form of expression of us four, Sophie, Dan, Ollie and Brayden. 

With your help you can not save but begin Boss Moxi's future as a band.

Risks & Challenges

Ideally we want to reach our set budget - that is for the success of this album. However, regardless of how much we manage to raise we're still going to release the album to our fans. As we've already paid for our album covers we'll sacrifice the global distribution and extensive press campaigns to make sure hard copies are distributed, Vinyls are printed and everything we've promised is given to contributors and further sold to our fans. At the end of the day we just want to hold this album in our hands, finished and printed, stick it in our non existent CD player and turn it the fuck up.

Other Ways You Can Help

We need as much support on this as possible. Whether or not you contribute money to our campaign you can help by sharing it on social media, telling your hairy mates about it or hassling mum & dad to put forward a donation to your favourite band. The more people talking about this the better and the more chance of us reaching our goal. Any help will be awesomely appreciate a met with the inevitable release of Boss Moxi's 14 track debut album.

Price Low-down

$1,000 - Mastering 14 tracks
$300 - 1000 Individual Cd's Burnt and Printed
$1,700 - 100 Limited Edition Vinyls
$1,000 - Australian Press & Radio Distribution 
$1,000 - United States Radio Distribution 
$1,000 - UK Radio Distribution
$1,300 - East-Coast Tour Domestic Flights
$700 - East-Coast Tour Accommodation

story:
Hello and Thank You! 

Listen to my music HERE:

http://www.soundcloud.com/jamonry

  • My life's dream has always been to be a recording and performing musical artist.
  • Writing and playing music is my passion and purpose. I am here to raise funds for a professionally engineered and mastered album of 12 perfected songs written by me. I have spent countless hours of blood, sweat, and tears orchestrating songs that I believe are great.
  • I have written countless songs and dream of the day I can perform and hear them as they should be heard.
  • This is the beginning of what could change my life. My success will alter the course of many other lives. THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP!

My Transparency

  • This campaign's goal is $15,000. Each track (of 10) will cost $1500. ALL of the proceeds will go to the production, engineering, distribution, mastering, and marketing of the record. 
  • There are some sexy perks for each and every donation!!! 
  • EVERY LITTLE BIT HELPS and if my entire campaign goal isn't reached ALL of your donations will still be utilized for my new record and in reaching my goal. Guaranteed.

The Impact

Everyone loves music. It is the Universal Language after all. I truly believe in mine and the impact it will have on whomever listens.

  • I have been honored to have high level interest from the music industry from Columbia Records to Roy Thomas Baker. 
  • WITH YOUR HELP, These are viable people and companies I can work with once I have my music orchestrated and produced as great as I know it can be! 
  • This record WILL put my foot in the door. 

Challenges

The greatest challenge is having a product that a producer or manger will appreciate and take seriously. Without the funds, a GREAT sounding album is not possible.

  • I will continue to face challenges and obstacles along this path to my dream. However, that's what has made me stronger and even more convicted.  I've come so far and overcome so many challenges that I can visualize my dream's realities more than ever.
  • I will NOT give up! 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if a donation isn't possible for you, please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign. Share on Facebook, tweet it, etc. 
  • Everyone and anyone can help being consumer marketers!!!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.  Ry.

story:
FUNDRAISING PROJECT FOR STRAWBERRY JAM

Will you please support our music and art space?

I. What is Strawberry Jam?

Strawberry Jam is a group of motivated teens who are creating a safe, artistic space to call our own—where we can play, write, record and make music videos, and be artistic in our free time.  

With the help of some parents, we've rented a space in a former mill filled with artists and musicians.   (See photos of our space here: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/fundraiser-f...)

Our space is drug and alcohol (and cell phone!) free.  We are passionate about music and art.


II. Why do we need your support?

Our goal is to create a self-sustainable business model.   We want to rent our space to music teachers, bands, and recording artists to earn our rent. 

Our parents will help up with the building part, but we need to raise the money for the materials and equipment to get started. 

So, Strawberry Jam is raising funds online to make it happen!

Here are some things we need:  a piano; simple sound booths; soundproofing; a decent laptop with recording software; microphones & stands; cords & amps; a video camera & stand; & a drum kit.   Our fundraising goal is $5000.  We will happily accept equipment donations, as well. 

We've put in A LOT of work, painting, building, and pooling our instruments (visit the "Gallery" link for photos and videos!). Now we are asking for help to take it to the next step...


 III. Why should you help? Because—science!

Studies show that kids involved in after-school and extracurricular activities are far less likely to engage in risky behavior.  Also, kids who play musical instruments and are involved in art do better in school,  have more concentration, and have heightened self-esteem.  

Places like Strawberry Jam just don't exist for us--so we're creating it ourselves. Strawberry Jam is a creative space by and for teens!

We are kids who are passionate about music and art, trying to create a safe, self-sustainable place to spend our time creatively and productively.   Every penny you donate will go into sustaining the space.  Please support our project.   

We thank you so much for your help!

LISTEN to a recording of one of our teen artists, Bella Dempsey @ https://soundcloud.com/strawberry-jam-6/skinny-love


                                                                  

                                                                   Resources

Brown, Laura Lewis. "The Benefits of Music Education."  PBS Parents. http://www.pbs.org/parents/education/music-arts/the-benefits-of-music-education/

"Can Involvement In Extra-curricular Activities Help Prevent Juvenile Delinquency?" Science Daily. March 23, 2008. 
http://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2008/03/080321174211.htm

Ruppert, Sandra. "How the Arts Benefit Student Achievement." Critical Evidence. 2006.  http://www.nasaa-arts.org/Publications/critical-evidence.pdf

"The Importance of Music." Music Empowers.
  http://www.musicempowersfoundation.org/why-music

story:
Passion and creativity are what truly drive societies, without these two main building blocks a community cannot evolve. Over the years, the feel of community has dwindled as metropolitan areas grow, day by day we lose the tight knit family feel that once existed in towns across America to the seclusion of the city. Do you know your neighbors name, what they do or how long they have lived in the area? 

We do. With a population of 436 it’s difficult not to know your neighbors, we count on each other to make things happen, we are like bothers and sisters, fathers and sons, mothers and daughters and at times quarrel like family but that’s what makes our town so intriguing. We are a small community, interested in building stronger bonds with each other and surrounding areas, sharing our heritage, encouraging creativity and passion in all avenues of life. And we need your support!

My name is Angela Bernhardt and I live in the fabulous town of Morrison, Colorado. My husband and I moved to here a few years ago, we were blessed with the opportunity to take over a business, located in the heart of our downtown, and turn it to a thriving center-point of our community.

 Last year, we formed the Morrison Event and Promotion Committee, a group geared towards helping bringing our community together while promoting our historical town, which predates the State of Colorado.  Morrison is rich in culture and history, and is home to one of the oldest masonry  structure in the State, Cliff House Lodge built by George Morrison, town founder, from 1864-1873. Morrison is also home to the discovery of the Stegosaurus and Apatosaurus, as well as the country’s most persevered Civilian Conservation Corps (CCC) Camp, and neighbor to the world famous Red Rocks Amphitheatre. 

Last year we hosted our first annual Morrison Alley Fest, a free to the public event designed to bring businesses and residents closer together. Residents, business owners and law enforcement agencies volunteered their time to help organize and run the event. Our historical downtown area is restricted on space so we decided to utilized our alley ways, thus the name Alley Fest. Our local businesses opened their back doors and 30 vendors joined in the festivities. We had five local bands play on the main stage and three in secondary playing area near our carnival games. 

This year’s Alley Fest will be bigger and better. The event will take place Saturday, May 2nd from 10am to 10pm.  We have expanded our festival grounds to encompass our community’s retirement center. Our kids carnival & interactive play area, art walk and second music stage will fill the center’s lawn allowing our elderly resident the ability to participate in the activities.  The town’s businesses are getting more involved by hosting musical acts in their establishments, increase the exposure of local musically talented individuals. 

Our event’s goal is to promote local musicians and artist in a family friendly, festival setting while increasing awareness of the importance of community. With the attendance tally over 2,500 last year and the abundance of positive feed back we received about on the event, we anticipate a substantial increase in numbers thus the need to expand our festival grounds. With the expansion of event parameters, there has been concern about our ability to pull off another seamless event, but with our dedication and passion towards our endeavors, we will be able to do just that. 

This year’s excitement about Alley Fest has increased the numbers of community members that have joined our efforts in making this event one of the most successful endeavors the town will ever witness. Over the past few months the community has come together to help construct carnival games, art installations, inactive gaming areas, and handmade carnival prizes. Our community has designated every Sunday as a craft day where the town actively participates in making these projects come to life. Through these weekly events our town is fortifying closer relationships with one another and setting an example for the younger generations about the importance of camaraderie.  

Hosting an event of this magnitude is no small undertaking and requires as much financial support as man power. With this being a free event built to support the community and local businesses we are asking for financial assistance from those with the means. Any contribution to this whether it be $1, $100 or $1000 makes a difference. Morrison Alley Fest would not be able to grow without the dedication of our residents and friends, support from volunteers, financial donations and sponsorship from neighboring community areas. 

An event of this size costs around $25,000 and hundreds of man hours to produce. We are actively soliciting sponsorship from those that have donated in the past  as well as reaching out to new prospects in hopes to build a lasting relationship that benefits everyone. With a donation to our cause you will be helping the growth four community and guaranteed the success of this event for many years to come. 

Whether we raise our goal amount or not this event will take place, there is no turning back for us now. We have started the ball rolling on this project and the only option is to see it through. Money raised will help pay for the utilities used throughout the event, rental of shuttle vans and golf carts to transport patrons to and from parking area to festival grounds, stages, lighting, sound systems, video/photographer and musical talent.

 Our event also supports and donates a portion of the proceeds to the school in town Red Rocks Elementary, Morrison Natural History Museum as well as to other non-profit organization that get involved. If we exceed our goal amount the excess money will be used to fund next year’s 3rd Annual Alley Fest. Alley Fest is an event that will continue to bring enjoyment and will strengthen our community for years to come. We hope you will get involved. Please help us make a difference and dreams come true, we cannot do this without support.
story_txt:
Passion and creativity are what truly drive societies, without these two main building blocks a community cannot evolve. Over the years, the feel of community has dwindled as metropolitan areas grow, day by day we lose the tight knit family feel that once existed in towns across America to the seclusion of the city. Do you know your neighbors name, what they do or how long they have lived in the area? We do. With a population of 436 it’s difficult not to know your neighbors, we count on each other to make things happen, we are like bothers and sisters, fathers and sons, mothers and daughters and at times quarrel like family but that’s what makes our town so intriguing. We are a small community, interested in building stronger bonds with each other and surrounding areas, sharing our heritage, encouraging creativity and passion in all avenues of life. And we need your support!

My name is Angela Bernhardt and I live in the fabulous town of Morrison, Colorado. My husband and I moved to here a few years ago, we were blessed with the opportunity to take over a business, located in the heart of our downtown, and turn it to a thriving center-point of our community. Last year, we formed the Morrison Event and Promotion Committee, a group geared towards helping bringing our community together while promoting our historical town, which predates the State of Colorado.  Morrison is rich in culture and history, and is home to one of the oldest masonry  structure in the State, Cliff House Lodge built by George Morrison, town founder, from 1864-1873. Morrison is also home to the discovery of the Stegosaurus and Apatosaurus, as well as the country’s most persevered Civilian Conservation Corps (CCC) Camp, and neighbor to the world famous Red Rocks Amphitheatre. 

Last year we hosted our first annual Morrison Alley Fest, a free to the public event designed to bring businesses and residents closer together. Residents, business owners and law enforcement agencies volunteered their time to help organize and run the event. Our historical downtown area is restricted on space so we decided to utilized our alley ways, thus the name Alley Fest. Our local businesses opened their back doors and 30 vendors joined in the festivities. We had five local bands play on the main stage and three in secondary playing area near our carnival games. 

This year’s Alley Fest will be bigger and better. The event will take place Saturday, May 2nd from 10am to 10pm.  We have expanded our festival grounds to encompass our community’s retirement center. Our kids carnival & interactive play area, art walk and second music stage will fill the center’s lawn allowing our elderly resident the ability to participate in the activities.  The town’s businesses are getting more involved by hosting musical acts in their establishments, increase the exposure of local musically talented individuals. 

Our event’s goal is to promote local musicians and artist in a family friendly, festival setting while increasing awareness of the importance of community. With the attendance tally over 2,500 last year and the abundance of positive feed back we received about on the event, we anticipate a substantial increase in numbers thus the need to expand our festival grounds. With the expansion of event parameters, there has been concern about our ability to pull off another seamless event, but with our dedication and passion towards our endeavors, we will be able to do just that. 

This year’s excitement about Alley Fest has increased the numbers of community members that have joined our efforts in making this event one of the most successful endeavors the town will ever witness. Over the past few months the community has come together to help construct carnival games, art installations, inactive gaming areas, and handmade carnival prizes. Our community has designated every Sunday as a craft day where the town actively participates in making these projects come to life. Through these weekly events our town is fortifying closer relationships with one another and setting an example for the younger generations about the importance of camaraderie.  

Hosting an event of this magnitude is no small undertaking and requires as much financial support as man power. With this being a free event built to support the community and local businesses we are asking for financial assistance from those with the means. Any contribution to this whether it be $1, $100 or $1000 makes a difference. Morrison Alley Fest would not be able to grow without the dedication of our residents and friends, support from volunteers, financial donations and sponsorship from neighboring community areas. An event of this size costs around $25,000 and hundreds of man hours to produce. We are actively soliciting sponsorship from those that have donated in the past  as well as reaching out to new prospects in hopes to build a lasting relationship that benefits everyone. With a donation to our cause you will be helping the growth four community and guaranteed the success of this event for many years to come. 

Whether we raise our goal amount or not this event will take place, there is no turning back for us now. We have started the ball rolling on this project and the only option is to see it through. Money raised will help pay for the utilities used throughout the event, rental of shuttle vans and golf carts to transport patrons to and from parking area to festival grounds, stages, lighting, sound systems, video/photographer and musical talent. Our event also supports and donates a portion of the proceeds to the school in town Red Rocks Elementary, Morrison Natural History Museum as well as to other non-profit organization that get involved. If we exceed our goal amount the excess money will be used to fund next year’s 3rd Annual Alley Fest. Alley Fest is an event that will continue to bring enjoyment and will strengthen our community for years to come. We hope you will get involved. Please help us make a difference and dreams come true, we cannot do this without support.

story:
Fundraiser for The Don Darlings 

"Electronic Man/Quicksand" Limited Edition 7"

 Colored Vinyl Single  and 2015 European Tour


Howdy folks!

Welcome to the weird and wonderful world of The Don Darlings. I am the Reverend (otherwise known as D.L. Collum) and I am the singer. Although I have lived in Sweden for an unspecified amount of time, I was born and raised in Texas. We originally formed in Gothenburg, Sweden in 2007 as a country-punk-folk band and boots have strayed down strange paths since then. 

We will soon finish the next step on our musical journey and want you to join us! We would like to ask for your help to get this music out to you and others like you who enjoy good music with heart and soul. We don’t make music to get rich, we do it to make people feel something strong. Now, a little introduction...

                 

Who is/was Don Darling?

About ten years ago, I was driving through the Texas Hill Country on my way from Austin out into the wild. By the side of the highway, stood a large shed that had "Snake Pit" painted in large letters. My curiosity could not be contained and I pulled into the driveway. For a brief moment, I thought I had been transported to an alternate universe based on "From Dusk till Dawn" when an angry dog approached the car. 

Then a man of at least 80 years came out with his cane. He proudly showed me the "Snake Pit" and introduced the names, as well as temperaments, of the five rattlers of various sizes. With a gleaming light in his eye, he explained that he enjoyed educating passers-by on the beauty of Texas wildlife. He then presented me with his card and said any contributions would be kindly appreciated. If ever there was an interesting character on this earth, it was certainly this stately old gentleman named Don Darling.

I never thought I could sing but couldn't help but sing along to every word of "American Recordings"by Johnny Cash. One day a few years after meeting Mr. Darling, some like-minded Scandinavian friends of mine were kind enough to take me on a musical adventure where Gothic Southern Americana meets Scandinavian Extraordinariness.

Where we were and where we are

After playing extensively in Sweden and Europe, we have released three recordings (Two LPs/CDs and one EP, all available on iTunes, Spotify and other sites). We no longer consider ourselves a country-punk-folk band but those roots still permeate our live shows. Reviews of our live shows and recordings have compared us to a strange mixed drink of Nick Cave, Tom Waits, Johnny Cash and Leonard Cohen with a bit of Mark Lanegan on the side. If you’re wonderin' what kind of head we inhabit, that would describe it pretty well.

Now we are ready to release a new limited edition colored vinyl single along with planning a new European tour and want you to be part of it!

How can you be part of it?

You can make this happen by contributing to our project and get a copy of the single, a t-shirt, previous recordings, a show at your favorite venue and other cool stuff! Check out the list of perks and help us make it happen!

If you can’t contribute with funds but want to help, just send it on to friends and family. If nothing else, we hope you get to hear our music, see you out on the road and give you a great night of good music. Nice to meet y’all.

All the best and see or hear ya!

                     

The Don Darlings:

Reverend Collum, Johan Conse, Martin G. Olsson, Per Romwall and Tony Martinsson

Why we want to ask you for help

·  Studio Session Fees

·  Producer Fees

·  Engineering Fees

·  Cost for the final Mix

·  Cost for the final Master

·  Printing of Limited Edition (500 copies) Colored Vinyl 7” new single of

A-side: Electronic Man and B-side: Quicksand

(Two colors – Pink and Purple, you can choose which color you want whenever you pledge towards this perk.)

·  Marketing & PR

·  Travel Expenses

story:
The Prez Show is a platform used to showcase underground and indie musicians across the nation. The Prez Show was created in the Summer of 2012 by Michael “VeeAye” Crandle II. We created the platform to bring awareness to up and coming hip-hop artists.

Michael the show creator began to work on the online website http://theprezshowlive.com. Growing the audience from a Pittsburgh based hip-hop blog into a substantial online residence for artist all over. From Miami to Canada artists, producers, record companies and tastemakers begin to send music via email. We are attempting to convert a school bus into a full-fledge Tour bus and documenting our music travels.


What We Need 

In order for the journey to happen we want to acquire a School Bus. Yes! A yellow cheese bus to convert into a full fledge tour bus. We plan to remove all the seats, input hardwood floors, wrap the bus in vinyl casing with The Prez Show Logo and (or) sponsors logos. Inside the bus will have two pull out beds, a couch, a table for the podcast, a space for eating, and a restroom. The bus means that we won’t have to worry about hotel cost or lodging. The money we raise will go into buying and renovating the school bus to fit our needs. We want to connect the world with the festival craze. 


What You Get

We’re not here to take and not provide. We are willing and able to give out specialty perks you won’t find anywhere else. From Social Media Shout outs to snazzy T-Shirts and Small business logo placement to gift book bags packed with The Prez Show merchandise (Buttons, promo cards, wristbands, stickers, etc..). We will keep all our funders in the loop with a newsletter and YouTube video updates. 



The Impact

Music Festivals have become extremely popular over the past 5 years. Due to the social media coverage a lot of older festivals have been revived and newer ones have gained a following. Festivals like Coachella & SXSW have become among the most popular of their genre. We want to share the festival experience with people who are not in the know. Especially the festivals that do not get the press like the major festivals. In addition to spreading the information, we will conduct interviews with artists, vendors, and the festival-goers. 

Risks & Challenges

This is a first of its kind but our mission is undoubtedly achievable. We have found the bus that we want to purchase. It is priced at $3,500 and renovations are totaling $5,000. The Yellow Cheese bus project is not going to be a push over. We are putting all our time and effort into making this a reality. Our support system is set in place and we are ready to pursue our dream. It merely starts here but doesn't end here. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Money is only one way of helping NOT the only! In order for us to get where we need to go we need people helping us campaign. Share our campaign with your social network. Every time you share you are donating essentially. Word of mouth as well talking to people about the campaign is another great way. Follow us on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook and Soundcloud: @ThePrezShow. If you are a copy & paste professional like us you can use the sample FaceBook post/Tweet to get the show started:

Join Me in supporting @ThePrezShow in purchasing & converting a School Bus into a Tour Bus!! #ThePrezsuitOfDopeness

story:
Be inspired, Inspire others! 

Ladder To The Moon, a special project of The Art Of Jazz,  is a presentation of music and media that features a premier performance of original compositions, arrangements and improvisations that  express shapes, colors and emotions inspired by the art of Georgia O’Keeffe.

Georgia O'Keeffe played a pivotal role in the development of American modernism and its relationship to European avante garde movements of the early twentieth century. Producing a substantial body of work over seven decades, she sought to capture the emotion and power of objects through abstracting the natural world. Her art and her character continue to inspire people everywhere!

"When you take a flower in your hand and really look at it, it's your world for the moment. I want to give that world to someone else." Georgia O'Keeffe.

The primary goal of The Ladder To The Moon Project is to create and present an engaging and inspiring experience of art for the purpose of supporting both visual art and music. The project began in July of 2104 and the premiere program of Ladder To The  Moon will be presented at The Colorado Springs Fine Arts Center July 9, 2015. Our aim is to conduct additional presentations for museums and galleries to use in community building.

Ladder To The Moon is a project of The Art Of Jazz. You are invited to engage, enjoy and share art. Be inspired and inspire others. Here are more project details. 

Ladder To The Moon

The Project

Develop and deploy a live music and media program inspired by the art of Georgia O’Keeffe. 

Purpose

The purpose of the Ladder To The Moon project is to attract new communities and audiences to engage and enjoy art. We will do this by producing a unique entertainment experience program to:

  • Build expanded community for art galleries.
  • Develop a broader audience for jazz music.
  • Provide associated art appreciation education.

Scope

This project will:

  • Compose new music inspired by the art of Georgia O’Keeffe.
  • Arrange selected existing music inspired by the art of Georgia O’Keeffe.
  • Perform an initial concert of these compositions, arrangements at Colorado Springs FAC.
  • Create a media presentation integrated with the live music performance. 
  • Make the program available for presentation for museums and galleries.
  • Record and distribute an album of the music. (A future project, separately funded)
Objectives

Phase 1

  • Compose and/or arrange 12 music pieces for performance.
  • Select and contract musicians.
  • Create a media presentation.
  • Rehearse the performance.
  • Present the program at Colorado Springs Fine Arts Center July 9, 2015.
Phase 2 (A future project to be separately funded and launched at a later date.)

    • Record an album of the music from - Ladder To The Moon. 

The Music

There is a vivid theme of possibility and inspiration in the music.

American modernist Georgia O’Keeffe sometimes painted her experience of the shapes, colors and emotions of the music that she heard. Ladder To The Moon features a premier performance of original compositions, arrangements and improvisations that  express shapes, colors and emotions inspired by the art of Georgia O’Keeffe.

A Blend Of Styles

The music program is a blend of styles, infused with jazz. You may hear some things that sound classical while other parts may be Latin music, rock or folk music. The presentation will also feature individual and collective improvisation. 

Augmented by Technology

We will use digital effects that enable us to include a variety of tones and timbres including: The sounds of vibraphone or marimba, grand piano, acoustic guitar or bass and jazz guitar and more.

Compositions & Arrangements

The original compositions express the experience of being with Georgia O’Keefe’s art and being in the locations she depicted and where her art was created. 

Milestones

  • July 2014 - Project Launched
  • August 2014 – Research begins
  • September 2014 – First “Sketches” of music drafted
  • October 2014 – Project development continues
  • March 2015 – First composition complete
  • April 2014
  • Agreement with FAC for first performance
  • Research trip to O’Keefe’s Home
  • Musicians contracted
  • Consultants contracted
  • First arrangement completed
  • May 2015 – Crowdfunding project begins


    • People

    Project Leader: Joseph Liberti, CEO The Art Of Jazz, an organization supporting jazz since 2011. TAOJ  enjoys non-profit status through a Fiscal Sponsorship provided by Fractured Atlas. Joseph Liberti is the primary developer of the program and will also compose, arrange and perform music and co-develop the media program.

    Collaborator: Tara Thomas Executive Director Bemis School of Art. Bemis will present the program July 9, 2015 at FAC. Tara Thomas will co-develop the media presentation.

story:
Summary

Hey. My name is Elric, and I am currently the sole member of a prog-metal project seeking to join with other musicians to produce an album inspired by Dream Theater, Being, Cloudkicker, and several other great bands ranging from death metal to black metal and almost everywhere inbetween. I recently relocated back to New Orleans, and as you can imagine, a lot of my time and money was spent on the move; that leaves me with close to no money left to get my album recorded! As you can imagine, this sucks pretty hard! This campaign's chief goal is to assist me in purchasing advertisements, pressing discs, some basic-necessity recording equipment, rent while I work on the album, and a copy of Reason to get me on my way to producing this album properly. I'm not looking to make it huge, and I don't care if I make money; I just want to get my music out there and for people to listen to it!

What I Need & What You Get

$3000 will be quite enough to achieve my goal; I know what equipment I need, I know where and what I'll be advertising, and I know where I'll go with the recording process following this campaign. What I need most of all, however, is for everyone who reads this page to spread this campaign and to donate!

If you're a donator to this project, no matter the amount, you will get a free copy of the album digitally and a signed disc in jewel-case mailed to you directly if you would like one once it's complete. Donate $20 or more and you get all backing tracks isolated to make your own mix! Donate at least $30 and you get complete tabs and sheet music for the entire record in addition to all isolated tracks. Donate $50 or more and your name and message will go in the album sleeve, and you get everything from the other tiers! Make sure you leave your email when you donate, or some other way I can contact you!

Risks

As you can imagine, writing music is not a concrete process. It takes time, but more importantly, it takes creativity and finesse; as such, I cannot give a concrete release date for this project until later during production. However, I can offer the utmost transparency throughout the development of this album and I can promise that the most important people of all -- the fans -- will know my process and know where their money is going every step of the way. If you follow this campaign page and the band Facebook page, you'll never be out of the loop!

If You Can't Donate...

...Then that's fine, too! If you would like to help me but you can't help me with money, please don't forget to share this campaign with your friends and anyone else you think may be interested! The value of word-of-mouth advertising is not lost on me, nor should it be lost on you; don't be afraid to let people know about this project!
story_txt:
Summary Hey. My name is Elric, and I am currently the sole member of a prog-metal project seeking to join with other musicians to produce an album inspired by Dream Theater, Being, Cloudkicker, and several other great bands ranging from death metal to black metal and almost everywhere inbetween. I recently relocated back to New Orleans, and as you can imagine, a lot of my time and money was spent on the move; that leaves me with close to no money left to get my album recorded! As you can imagine, this sucks pretty hard! This campaign's chief goal is to assist me in purchasing advertisements, pressing discs, some basic-necessity recording equipment, rent while I work on the album, and a copy of Reason to get me on my way to producing this album properly. I'm not looking to make it huge, and I don't care if I make money; I just want to get my music out there and for people to listen to it!   What I Need & What You Get $3000 will be quite enough to achieve my goal; I know what equipment I need, I know where and what I'll be advertising, and I know where I'll go with the recording process following this campaign. What I need most of all, however, is for everyone who reads this page to spread this campaign and to donate!
If you're a donator to this project, no matter the amount, you will get a free copy of the album digitally and a signed disc in jewel-case mailed to you directly if you would like one once it's complete. Donate $20 or more and you get all backing tracks isolated to make your own mix! Donate at least $30 and you get complete tabs and sheet music for the entire record in addition to all isolated tracks. Donate $50 or more and your name and message will go in the album sleeve, and you get everything from the other tiers! Make sure you leave your email when you donate, or some other way I can contact you!

    Risks As you can imagine, writing music is not a concrete process. It takes time, but more importantly, it takes creativity and finesse; as such, I cannot give a concrete release date for this project until later during production. However, I can offer the utmost transparency throughout the development of this album and I can promise that the most important people of all -- the fans -- will know my process and know where their money is going every step of the way. If you follow this campaign page and the band Facebook page, you'll never be out of the loop!
    If You Can't Donate... ...Then that's fine, too! If you would like to help me but you can't help me with money, please don't forget to share this campaign with your friends and anyone else you think may be interested! The value of word-of-mouth advertising is not lost on me, nor should it be lost on you; don't be afraid to let people know about this project!

story:
"If I love you, beware." With these words, the spellbinding Carmen lures Don Jose from his passionless life as a border guard and into a dark underworld of lust, crime, and betrayal. Will his childhood sweetheart, the loyal Micaela, be able to save him from his obsession? Or will she, too, succumb to the intrigue of the unknown? Bizet's classic opera is stripped down to its core in this fresh, visceral, and evocative chamber production by The Secret Opera at the historic Dante Hall Theater in Atlantic City, NJ. Performances are July 31 at 8pm and August 1 at 2pm.

What We Need

Your contribution will help us pay our chamber musicians, cast, and creative team, rental fees, cover costume and set design, and transportation from New York to Atlantic City. As a young start-up opera company, we are used to making great things happen on a shoestring budget. With your help, we can create something truly spectacular! 

The Impact

Now in its second season, The Secret Opera continues its mission to present thought-provoking and socially relevant readings of new and classic vocal works. Carmen represents our largest production to date, as well as a foray into a new opera-hungry audience in Atlantic City. We believe that this production will be an amazing contribution to the local cultural scene. As always, we aim to foster open dialogue and positive change by highlighting current issues in our performances. We're willing to bet you haven't seen a Carmen quite like this... 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, we can use your help in other ways! Please consider hosting a benefit concert or fundraiser, hosting artists in your home (for those who live near Atlantic City), donating props, costume pieces, or printed materials, or simply getting the word out about The Secret Opera and our upcoming performances. Please contact us if you would like to help in any of these ways - we would love to involve you in this production!

Thank you for supporting the future of opera!

The Secret Opera Team

story:
SCROLL DOWN FOR ENGLISH VERSION

¡Hola! Somos David Lemus y David Chinchilla. Ambos de Guatemala.

Pedimos su ayuda para comprar nuestros boletos aéreos de la Ciudad de Guatemala a Bonn, Alemania, donde estaremos realizando una serie de conciertos durante el mes de Agosto, 2015.

En Guatemala no hay mucho apoyo hacia el arte, por lo que el camino ha sido difícil y largo. Hoy podemos decir orgullosamente, que a pesar de todo, nuestra vida entera la dedicamos a la música. Tocamos en más de 5 proyectos cada uno, escribimos y enseñamos música y sonido para vivir.

UNA GRAN OPORTUNIDAD

Hemos sido invitados a interpretar nuestra música en Bonn. ¡Estas son muy buenas noticias para nosotros! Desafortunadamente nuestros ingresos como músicos, hacen este viaje muy costoso para financiarlo solos.

Los boletos aéreos por el momento están a $1,000 cada uno, también necesitamos costear el transporte local durante nuestra estadía. Este viaje representa un gran paso adelante en nuestra carrera musical. Por favor, ¡Ayúdanos a volverlo realidad!

¡AYÚDANOS A CAMBIAR LA HISTORIA MUSICAL GUATEMALTECA!

Creemos fuertemente, que el arte es lo que nuestro país necesita para mejorar. Queremos mostrarle a nuestros compatriotas que se puede vivir de lo que uno ama y ,más importante, de algo tan bello como la música, lo cual puede inspirarte a ser una mejor persona y por ende, construir una mejor sociedad.

Este viaje puede ayudarnos a inspirar a otras personas a perseguir sus sueños, incluso cuando el camino es empinado. Estamos intentando hacer una afirmación grande en nuestra sociedad.

SIEMPRE RECIBES LO QUE DAS

¡Tenemos beneficios únicos para ti! Revisa nuestros artículos disponibles y decide cual es tu favorito. Hemos logrado ofrecerte envío gratuito a todo el mundo, por favor asegúrate de agregar tu dirección de envío y correo electrónico en los artículos requeridos para poder contactarte.

Si no te encuentras en una posición para ayudarnos económicamente, por favor comparte esta campaña con tus amigos. Esto siempre nos ayuda y ¡Te lo agradecemos grandemente!


ENGLISH VERSION

Hi! We are David Lemus and David Chinchilla. Both of us from Guatemala. 

We ask for your help to purchase our flight tickets from Guatemala City to Bonn Germany where we will perform at a series of shows during August 2015. 

There is not much support for arts here in Guatemala so the path's been rough. Today we can proudly say that, regardless of the circumstances, our whole life is completely dedicated to music. We play in over 5 different projects each, write, arrange and teach music and audio for a living.

A BIG OPPORTUNITY

We have been invited to play our music in Bonn. This is great news for us! Unfortunately our musician earnings make this trip very expensive for us to cost by ourselves.

 Flight tickets are right now $1000 each, we also need to pay for local transportation during our stay.  This trip represents a big step up in our musical careers! Please help us make this come true!!!

HELP US CHANGE GUATEMALAN MUSIC HISTORY!!

We strongly believe that art is what our country needs to improve. We want to show our fellow countrymen that you can actually make a decent living from something that you love and (most important) something as beautiful as music which can inspire you to become a better person and hence build a better society.  

This trip can help us inspire other people to go after their dreams, even when the road is steep. We are trying to make a bigger statement to our society!! 

YOU ALWAYS GET WHAT YOU GIVE

We have some really unique perks for you!! Please check on the available ones to decide which one is your favourite. We've managed to offer worldwide free shipping, please make sure to add your shipping address and email address where requested so that we can reach you. 

If you are not in a position that allows you to financially help us right now, please share this with your friends. This will always help us and we will really appreciate it!!


BENEFICIOS DISPONIBLES / AVAILABLE PERKS


¡Nuestra Música!

¡La razón principal de nuestra campaña! Compartiremos contigo la música de nuestro proyecto en común Filoxera. Este proyecto se basa en música que escribimos y producimos en la Ciudad de Guatemala, Bossa Trix es nuestro próximo sencillo. ¡Sé el primero en escucharlo! Te enviaremos un código de descarga de esta canción para que la tengas anticipadamente.

Our Music!

The main reason of this campaign! We will share with you the music of our mutual project Filoxera.  This project is based on music that we write and produce in Guatemala City, Bossa Trix is our upcoming single. Listen to it first!!! We will send you an early bird download code for this song. 


Palabras desde el Camino

¡Te mantendremos personalmente actualizado de nuestro viaje! Te enviaremos una nota escrita a mano de algún lugar aleatorio durante nuestro viaje.

Words from the Road

We will keep you personally updated during our trip! We will send you a handwritten ¨thank you¨ note from a random location during our journey!


Brigadeiros

Descubre el sabor que nos dio nuestro nombre! Brigadeiros son unas trufas celestiales de chocolate y cajeta, un postre tradicional hecho en Brasil. Una vez pruebes los Brigadeiros te enamorarás de ellos, al igual que nosotros.

Disponibles únicamente para Guatemala, por ser un artículo perecedero*

Brigadeiros

Discover the flavour that gave us our name. Brigadeiros are heavenly caramel and dark cocoa truffles, a traditional treat made in Brazil. Once you taste Brigadeiros you will fall in love with them, just like we did.

photo by Mayra Chiachia on flickr


Taza de Edición Limitada

¡Disfruta tu café matutino sabiendo que ayudaste a dos músicos guatemaltecos a seguir sus sueños! Esto motivará a cualquier persona a tener un buen día de trabajo.

Limited Edition Mug

Enjoy your morning coffee knowing that you helped two fellow Guatemalan musician pursuing their dreams! This will cheer anybody up for a good day of work!


El Mundialmente Famoso Café Guatemalteco

¡Combina tu nueva taza de edición limitada con nuestro café mundialmente famoso! Descubre el sabor de nuestra tierra mientras apoyas a la causa
World Famous Guatemalan Coffee
Combine your coffee mug with our world famous local coffee! Discover the taste of our land while supporting the cause!


Instrumento Musical Folclórico y Único

El Tun es un instrumento mesoamericano de percusión. Es utilizado en diferentes danzas como el Rabinal Achi. Comparte con nosotros la pasión por la música con esta única pieza de herencia guatemalteca.

Unique Folkloric Musical Instrument

The ¨Tun¨ instrument is a mesoamerican percussion instrument . It is use in different dances such as the ¨Rabinal Achi¨. Share with us the passion for music with this unique piece of Guatemalan heritage. 


Concierto Privado

¡Muchas gracias por tu contribución a nuestra causa! Tocaremos para ti en tu evento privado en Alemania. Por favor contáctanos antes de hacer la donación para poder coordinar los detalles de nuestra reunión.

**También tenemos este beneficio disponible para Guatemala. 

Private Concert

Thank you so much for contributing to our cause!! We will play for you at your private event in Germany!! Please contact us before making the donation so that we can arrange the details for our meeting!!
** This perk is also available for Guatemala.


Muchísimas gracias por tu tiempo y ayuda!
Atentamente,
David y David

Thank you so much for all your help!!!
Sincerely, 
David and David

story:
A Peace of Mind for Sonia


Thank you everyone for joining the "Peace of Mind for Sonia" campaign. We'd like to introduce ourselves. We are Jorge Cuamacas and Laura Spada; currently living within the outskirts of Toronto, Canada. We decided to commence this campaign page in memory of our sister-in law; Sonia Mena, who tragically passed away on Saturday June 13, 2015.  She was only 38 years of age when she lost her battle to aggressive Brain Cancer; leaving behind her husband and two children.  She would have celebrated her 39th birthday on July 21. 

Sonia's troubles began on Saturday February 21, 2015. While doing laundry on the terrace of where she lived, she abruptly developed severe head pain - so intense that it caused her to collapse to the floor, having her landlord to thankfully find her in time. As they noticed that her skin colour was gradually changing and was flushed since her fall, they immediately rushed her to Emergency and was put under observation; while awaiting her CT Scan(s) as well as other tests to come back; in hopes to receive only some subtle news... However, this was not the case.

Sonia was initially diagnosed with Encephalitis AutoImmune (inflammation of the brain). Eventually she had been released from the hospital and was prescribed specific medications to reduce the swelling of the brain, amongst other treatments of relief; including lots of rest - no movement, no bodily stress whatsoever.   

As her weeks went on, her body began to suffer severe convulsions; seizures which caused her to lose feeling; initially, in her right arm and right leg. It was difficult for her to smile and to speak. Her convulsions were causing her muscles to contort.

Progressively, her health was worsening; having all her limbs grow numb. Her family decided to visit other doctors, including neurologists. These several doctors that she had visited had then prescribed  her additional medication, while at the same time: they too had found it difficult to fully determine what was going on with Sonia and her condition. 

After weeks of consuming up to seven types of drugs per day; the family became desperate as they saw her health going downhill. She was eating very little; only a few spoons of soup within 3 days, and had also carried symptoms of nausea and difficulty breathing. In despair, the family had then sent her to a Naturopath; an American doctor who's facility was based in Riobamba, Ecuador (six hours away from her home town; Ibarra). He had checked her out, and realized that she was intoxicated from all the mediation she had been taking. He urged her to stop taking the drugs. But the worst was yet to come ... The Naturopath assured Sonia was suffering from severe brain cancer, and decided to delicately disclose the news to her loved ones, without letting her know. He expressed deep sympathy; unsure as to how much longer she had to live... 

She retuned to Ibarra where she passed the last couple of days of her life in her home; lying in bed - right by her loved ones. Her head pains were getting worse. By this time, she developed full speech impediment. The family finally decided to bring her back to the hospital in Ibarra; where they then transferred her to the main facility in Quito; Ecuador's capital city. She remained in hospital for only a day or two; where during that time she was transferred to ICU (intensive care unit). Eventually her brain lost all strength, and collapsed. She became brain-dead. Her doctor immediately put her on life support; but only for a short period of time.  The doctor had gathered the family, and wistfully recommended to 'let her go' so that at least she will no longer be suffering and could rest in peace.  The chance to surviving through life support was very small, and even if she were to survive - it would feel unfair and almost "egotistical" to see her lying there in a bed like a vegetable, only for the sake of still seeing her present; rather than alive. The family; as much as it pained them to decide this, had let her go, and about an hour after removing the life support; she let go at 3:00 in the afternoon. 

Since Saturday afternoon, days have turned dark and gloomy for the Cuamacas family. It has been an extremely difficult experience losing such a young and beautiful family member ... and in this way - for no last words could have been spoken by Sonia; remember, she has lost all speech ability by the end. 

Months back and forth of several hospital and clinic visitations has now left her family's life savings run low ... There was no health care program to support her. Her family now endures the pain of overwhelming hospital expenses; even her own funeral arrangements ... 
... But the greatest pain they now endure is having lost her... 

You Can Help.  
You can share love and hope by giving her family some relief from the anxiety they now face.

OUR GOAL: Minimum One Thousand Dollars ($1,000).   

Give them your gift of slowly getting back on their feet and grieve with ease ... 

We are sincerely wishing that by the time her birthday arrives (July 21) we can generate enough contributions here and give her family a head start, and heal into a brighter tomorrow. 
  

Help make a change... 

Give Today.

R.I.P. Sonia; our beautiful and lovely Sister-In-Law; you shall be dearly missed. Your family loves you very much.

The family finally decided to bring her back to the hospital in Ibarra; where they then transferred her to the main facility in Quito; Ecuador's capital city. She remained in hospital for only a day or two; where during that time she was transferred to ICU (intensive care unit). Eventually her brain lost all strength, and collapsed. She became brain-dead. Her doctor immediately put her on life support; but only for a short period of time.  The doctor had gathered the family, and wistfully recommended to 'let her go' so that at least she will no longer be suffering and could rest in peace.  The chance to surviving through life support was very small, and even if she were to survive - it would feel unfair and almost "egotistical" to see her lying there in a bed like a vegetable, only for the sake of still seeing her present; rather than alive. The family; as much as it pained them to decide this, had let her go, and about an hour after removing the life support; she let go at 3:00 in the afternoon. Since Saturday afternoon, days have turned dark and gloomy for the Cuamacas family. It has been an extremely difficult experience losing such a young and beautiful family member ... and in this way - for no last words could have been spoken by Sonia; remember, she has lost all speech ability by the end. Months back and forth of several hospital and clinic visitations has now left her family's life savings run low ... There was no health care program to support her. Her family now endures the pain of overwhelming hospital expenses; even her own funeral arrangements ... ... But the greatest pain they now endure is having lost her... 
You Can Help.  
You can share love and hope by giving her family some relief from the anxiety they now face.OUR GOAL: Minimum One Thousand Dollars ($1,000).   Give them your gift of slowly getting back on their feet and grieve with ease ... We are sincerely wishing that by the time her birthday arrives (July 21) we can generate enough contributions here and give her family a head start, and heal into a brighter tomorrow.   Help make a change... Give Today.
R.I.P. Sonia; our beautiful and lovely Sister-In-Law; you shall be dearly missed. Your family loves you very much.

story:
Short Summary

Ever since I asked for a guitar at age 3, music has been a passion of mine.  For a good portion of the last decade this passion has been embodied by AM Exchange. There here have been different phases and iterations, highs and lows, but at the end of the day, it has always been a vehicle for my personal expression, a way of trying to make sense of the world and a means of trying to share my insights and emotions with music fans.

So far, 2015 has been an amazing year!  I've had the opportunity to work with some incredibly talented people, released two singles and a music video, and received some good press along the way.  

I am grateful for everything that's happened so far, but it didn't happen on its own.  I have financed the recording sessions, video production and promotion of AM Exchange's new EP with personal money and credit cards.  To take it to the next level I am turning to friends, family and fans for support to help finance the upfront costs of record and merchandise production that will be an essential revenue stream while on the road .  As many of you may know, I'm terrible at asking for help, but I've put my pride away, I'm here,  I'm asking.

What We Need & What You Get

AM Exchange will have the opportunity to go on a 22-date national tour as a 3-piece this summer to promote the new Intentions EP.  (The EP is recorded and mixed and is currently being mastered...it's almost done). From Los Angeles to Atlanta, Charlotte to New York, Cleveland to Seattle, Portland to San Francisco and a whole lot in between, it is incredibly exciting and inspiring.  So much hotel furniture just waiting to be glued to the ceiling ;)

While touring is essential for independent artists today, there are also a lot of expensive upfront costs. We'll be playing small clubs and they'll pay us, but with the cost of gas and travel, it's nothing to write home about.  One of the best ways for independent artists to stay afloat  on the road is to sell merchandise...and that's where you come in.

I'm asking for $5000 to cover the upfront cost of merchandise production. In exchange, you'll be able to pick from a variety of perks, have  access to exclusive content and receive  undying love.

Here are the production estimates:
Vinyl                        $2250
T-Shirts                  $1000
CDs                          $1000
Posters                   $300
Key chains             $200
Koozies                   $150
Stickers                  $100
TOTAL                 $5000

If this campaign is fortunate enough to go over its fundraising goal, the additional money will go towards the van rental, gas and lodging.

The Impact

AM Exchange is currently engaged in a national press and radio campaign and by playing shows in many of these same targeted markets,  we have the ability to reach a lot more potential fans and gain substantial national (and potentially international) exposure.

Music is something I'm deeply passionate about and I believe it's important.  Being a musician may not be as important as being a teacher, a nurse or a firefighter, but I do think what we do has a positive impact.  While our contributions may be intangible at times, I feel they can still have an important influence.

There can be an underlying arrogance when a musical artists asks you to listen,  to buy, to contribute. However, most of the time, we just want to be able to do what we do and  excel at it. Writing, recording and performing  music is one of the few things that I'm halfway decent at. At the end of the day, I just want to do a good job.

At the beginning of 2015, I developed and set out on a specific  18-month strategy  and I have worked at it relentlessly, literally every single day of this year.  (Ok, except for New Years Day... I was hungover New Years Day, give me a break.)   The PR and radio campaigns kicked off in April  and already, in 2 months, there has been significant media and radio traction.   With this EP release and tour, I'm excited to see where we can take this.


Risks & Challenges

This tour will be anything but glamorous.  It will be three sweaty musicians slumming it across the country in a van, sleeping on floors and staying in hostels.  It will be raw, it will be real, it will be very rock'n'roll... but, don't get me wrong, it will be fucking awesome.  That being said, there's always the risk that it won't have as big of an impact as planned. But I promise you this, we're going to play our asses off at every show, in every city.

The music business is one of the most competitive, ruthless and fickle industries around, but I'm not going to let that stop me from giving it a proper shot. I'm not going to let the fear of failure stop me from making sure  I give it everything I have.  Music will always be a part of my life, but with recent developments, I'm at a point where (with the proper strategy, tenacity and support) I can maybe, just maybe, potentially do this for a living.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't spare anything, I understand, trust me, I know what it's like.  However, you can still help by sharing this campaign on social media,  email or by word of mouth with people that might be interested in contributing.

You know, that rich uncle that always invites himself to Thanksgiving or the investment banker that talks on his Bluetooth in the grocery store, that's right, the one that takes up two parking spots with his Porsche. Do me a favor,  try to convince them to give me some of their money :)

The Indiegogo share tools make it quick and simple. Every little bit helps and every action is greatly appreciated! Thank you for taking the time to check out this campaign. Please don't hesitate to contact me with any questions, comments and/or concerns. 

Wishing you all the best!

Sincerely,

Daniel Jacobs
AM Exchange
www.amexchangemusic.com
amexchangeproductions@gmail.com
