story:
WHO IS BEHIND FESTIVAL CATHOLIC ?

  • My name is Noemia Marie Juste, leader of a group named Daughters and Sons of Our Lady of divine graces, which apostolate is focused on how to help youth to discover and grow in brotherhood through the virtue of purity here in Cameroon (Central Africa) http://festicatho.blogspot.com/

WHY DO YOU HELP US ?

  • Our group want to organize this year in august a 5 days Festival to sensibilize youth people to deal with faith and love in their dayly situation.
  • About 1500 people will be in the event.
  • We want you to sustain us financially to support music, light and podium logistic for the gospel and adoration concert which will take place along the event, to make people being touched by the power of God' love throught songs !
  • So we need 7,500 USD to pay music tools and players, to pay light system, to prepare the different teams for song, and provide electricity generator in the site.
  • We already have 800 USD and we are sure that if you help us, we will reach the 7,500 USD budget.

     

             


WHEN WILL IT TAKE PLACE ?

  • FESTIVAL CATHOLIC will take place from 3rd to 7th August 2015 in Cameroon's politic capital, YAOUNDE.
  • Here in Cameroon, youth constitute the largest part of religious activities, but the means they use for evangelisation are in a rudimentary materia. we want them experience the use of modern technology especially in praise music. At the end of day, the message of faith and love can be embrace by them.
  • Surely, we are facing difficulties as the clergy who is dubitative on the implement of our projet, they consider it as a big advertising party which will absorb to much money. Also, this kind of event and how it will be implemented is in its 3rd edition in the country's capital (Yaounde) and we are stressing!
  • We will try to gain their confidence by giving them opportunity to be principal speakers of central parts of the events.

        


  • Please, if you believe in purity, love and faith for peaceful societies in Africa, just do the right action for us.
  • Use this Indiegogo plateform to make people interested follow us and contribute !

story:
Short Summary

The intention behind The Kali Collective is to provide yoga to all groups of people and promote so much more than just the physical practice. Steph and Jenny stand behind the values that yoga has to offer such as self love, self inquiry, truth, integrity, balance and commitment. One of the most important aspects of yoga the The Kali Collective will support is Community. We are dedicated to creating a space for all yogi’s to come together regardless of age, social group, income or physical ability. Community will be encouraged by offering donation classes, creating partnerships with local businesses and charities and allowing access to yoga for people with mental and physical disabilities.

Our vision and intention is to create a welcoming, accepting space for every single student. Our students deserve to feel comfortable and at home the moment they walk into our studio. 

What We Need & What You Get

Raising money through this campaign will allow us to:

- provide affordable yoga classes

- provide 'the gift of yoga' to chosen causes in the local community

- create a welcoming, accepting environment where even those visiting for the first time feel part of the family

- provide the yoga teachers of the UK with an affordable space to further their own community's education and experience through training, workshops and events.

- have high quality, non slip yoga mats available for every student

- have all props needed to assist every body in their practice

What you will get in return are a variety of yoga based goodies ranging from an online class, to tote bags, to drop in passes. We want our exchange to be rewarding to you, so all our goodies come from a place of love, passion and excitement. 

The Impact

By combining forces with each other, the community and you, we are confident we can create something spectacular to serve the greater good.

Risks & Challenges

Anything that is big, audacious, or has the chance to impact the world, is risky and scary. We however, are not afraid of this challenge. We know risks may arise. Steph may miss Canada, Jenny may get sick of Steph. Anything can happen. But we are 100% prepared to tackle any challenges that arise. By doing years of self development, getting unbelievably clear about the intention behind our business and having open and honest communication with each other, we are confident there will always be a solution.

Our only realistic challenge we forsee, is having low attendance or awareness. Our solution to this is something we have already factored into our business plan. As well as our classes, we will have a small retail space selling products we use and believe in, we will host workshops and the studio will be available for rent.

Our vision for this studio is that it is a collective space, contributing towards empowering our community. One of our biggest commitments is education. Our workshops and events we will be rooted in the teachings of living yoga, taking your yoga from just a physical mat based practice to an everyday opportunity for growth.

This studio is built on love and passion for contributing to the greater good. With that intention so clear and strong, as long as we have smart business sense, we know that we will always be supported on this path.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially? We could still use your help!

What we need as we start up is exposure and recommendations. By simply "liking" our page and posts we can help spread the word even further. Anything from speaking to friends, emailing people who may be interested in contributing or joining our studio, or helping us spread the word through social media, we can always use your help.

story:
PLEASE include your email in your funding!


Short Summary

Hi! We are a band from Costa Rica called RAIN (yes, some Spanglish taste). We have many influences, but we try to center our genre as some kind of rock/folk/indie/worship/alternative (you'll like it). We have played together for almost 4 years now, and we have enjoyed this journey like never before.

You know, every band dreams with recording an album and with crowds singing their songs. We are working hard for this to happen for us, but we try to go further. We are messengers, our music shares hope, love, second opportunities.

We have already recorded 8 songs (from our own wallets), but we still need to mix, master, and distribute the album. Our campaign's objective is to raise $2500 for this purpose. You can be part of this dream!

What We Need & What You Get

Every cent we raise will be directly used in the post-production of the songs. Each one of them need to be mixed (for all instruments to sound complementary with each other), masterized (audio processing), and distributed (like a nice album art and the printing of the discs). We already recorded, mixed, and mastered our first single called "Te encontraré".
If you back us with $5, you will receive a link to download the single. If you back us with $10 or more, you will receive a link to download the single and a link to download the entire album once it is available. Every dollar counts!

The Impact

We are normal people with fears and troubles, but with stronger will and confidence. We have a mission. We have a message to share. We don't want to be some other band out there. This world needs to know there is still love, hope, forgiveness. We want to encourage and show every person we meet that dreams can still come true. 

Risks & Challenges

A starting musician struggles with money, you know. Up to date, we have worked hard to get our own instruments, transportation to concerts, and start up the album recording. But since we are one step away from what we dreamed being kids, there is a voice inside our heads that keeps us believing in this life project.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if you can't help us with money. You can help us spread this campaign and spread our work (like us on Facebook and Instagram!). You can also use Indiegogo's share tools. You can be a big part of this!
Facebook page
Instagram page
Pura vida!

story:
Short Summary

Zebregasus (Zeh - BRAY - gah - suss)

You know what a pegasus is, right?  This is like that, but it's a zebra.

As I say in the video, I am a classically trained composer looking to break into the world of electronic music.  I've done a lot of work on my PC, but I do not have access to the hardware and software I need in order to produce professional-level sound.  I have the skills and the experience - I just need a little bit of money.

What We Need & What You Get

-The equipment I'm looking at is going to cost me about $3000.  This will include a computer that wasn't built in 2008 (i.e. the one I'm typing this on right now), a controller, a microphone, and studio software. 

-I promised $300 to my artist.  She has already created one great piece for me and is working on a second.  She said she was happy to do it for free but I have to pay her because she's so talented.

-The rest of that money goes to fulfilling perks and paying various fees (credit card transfer fees, PayPal fees, Indiegogo fees, and so on).

-What can I do if I exceed my goal?  Buy better equipment.  Take time off of work to work even harder on the album.  Basically, more money means a better album.

-What can I do if I do not meet my goal?  Well, after I fulfill perks and my fees, I will spend what's left on whatever equipment I can and work tirelessly toward releasing the best album I can that budget.

The Impact

Well, I deliver pizzas for a living.  It's not fun, it's dangerous, and people are often quite mean for no good reason.  It's not the worst job in the world, but I want to do more with my life.  I'd rather stop stressing out over bad tips and start stressing out over album sales.  The success of this project can also help me launch myself into the upper echelon of the music scene.  This fundraising goal is not about one album, it's about my entire music career.  I want to write a wide variety of music in hopes of being featured in video games, apps, movies, and more.  This album is the first step to make so much more happen.

Risks & Challenges

My biggest risk is that the album will not do well and it will crush me.  But if that happens, I still have all the equipment and can try again.  I will always try again.

My biggest challenge is simply finding the time to make the music.  Between work and school, I suppose I'll have a few nights where I don't sleep too much.  But if it's for my artistic vision, I will find a way to get by like I have in the past.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word.  PLEASE, spread the word.  Copy and paste this URL and send it so someone you think will be interested.  It'll take 10 seconds and mean a whole lot to me and my future.  Follow me on Twitter.  Subscribe to me on YouTube.  Pet your dog for me.  Give your cat a kiss on the nose.  Tickle your babies' toes.  Tell them all you did it for Zebregasus.

You know what a pegasus is, right?  This is like that, but it's a zebra.
As I say in the video, I am a classically trained composer looking to break into the world of electronic music.  I've done a lot of work on my PC, but I do not have access to the hardware and software I need in order to produce professional-level sound.  I have the skills and the experience - I just need a little bit of money.   What We Need & What You Get -The equipment I'm looking at is going to cost me about $3000.  This will include a computer that wasn't built in 2008 (i.e. the one I'm typing this on right now), a controller, a microphone, and studio software. 
-I promised $300 to my artist.  She has already created one great piece for me and is working on a second.  She said she was happy to do it for free but I have to pay her because she's so talented.
-The rest of that money goes to fulfilling perks and paying various fees (credit card transfer fees, PayPal fees, Indiegogo fees, and so on).
-What can I do if I exceed my goal?  Buy better equipment.  Take time off of work to work even harder on the album.  Basically, more money means a better album.
-What can I do if I do not meet my goal?  Well, after I fulfill perks and my fees, I will spend what's left on whatever equipment I can and work tirelessly toward releasing the best album I can that budget.
    The Impact Well, I deliver pizzas for a living.  It's not fun, it's dangerous, and people are often quite mean for no good reason.  It's not the worst job in the world, but I want to do more with my life.  I'd rather stop stressing out over bad tips and start stressing out over album sales.  The success of this project can also help me launch myself into the upper echelon of the music scene.  This fundraising goal is not about one album, it's about my entire music career.  I want to write a wide variety of music in hopes of being featured in video games, apps, movies, and more.  This album is the first step to make so much more happen.
    Risks & Challenges My biggest risk is that the album will not do well and it will crush me.  But if that happens, I still have all the equipment and can try again.  I will always try again.
My biggest challenge is simply finding the time to make the music.  Between work and school, I suppose I'll have a few nights where I don't sleep too much.  But if it's for my artistic vision, I will find a way to get by like I have in the past.
    Other Ways You Can Help Spread the word.  PLEASE, spread the word.  Copy and paste this URL and send it so someone you think will be interested.  It'll take 10 seconds and mean a whole lot to me and my future.  Follow me on Twitter.  Subscribe to me on YouTube.  Pet your dog for me.  Give your cat a kiss on the nose.  Tickle your babies' toes.  Tell them all you did it for Zebregasus.

story:
What are we doing?

Port Arthur needs your help! We want to go on tour this August and we can't do it without you.

Earlier this year we released our first full-length album, "Everything's Incredible," to much acclaim. We want to take it on the road and share it with like-minded audiences in cities such as Richmond, Asheville, Chicago, and New York! You can listen to it at portarthur.bandcamp.com.

Who are we?

Port Arthur is a seven-piece folk-rock band from Philadelphia, PA. Fronted by singer-songwriter Luke Shefski, Port Arthur combines the best musicians from Temple University's Boyer School of Music with the DIY attitude of Philly's indie scene. Our sound is a genre-bending mix of folk, jazz, rock 'n' roll and old-time razzle-dazzle.

(Photo by Ian Watson)

What do we need?

Unfortunately, touring is complicated for even a small band. We will be going full-band for this trip, which means we'll be shipping out with seven sweaty people and all of our musical equipment in an old van. Needless to say, logistics will be complicated, and any little bit of funding will go a long way. $2500 is a modest amount for a tour of this scale, and will cover transportation costs, food, tour-related merch, as well as an emergency fund.

Why do we need it?

More than just helping a bunch of music students travel the country, you will be helping us play a small part in bringing the musical communities of this huge country a little closer together. Each city has its own music, its own style, its own scene, and the connections made on tour by independent musicians are invaluable to our community. We want to make sure we're prepared and able to deliver a powerful, inspiring performance every night we're on tour.

(Video by Ian Watson)

What do you get?

Beyond this, we will be making a digital recording of each gig and compiling the best of the best material to create a full-length live album. We will also, of course, be taking pictures along the way and we plan to make a photobooklet of our favorite memories from the tour. Both of these will be available exclusively to campaign contributors. We are also willing to play for you! See the Perks for more details.

There is no upper limit on the amount of money we can raise on this campaign so, should we receive more than $2500, it will go towards more really cool stuff for you - maybe even a new album!

If you aren't able to donate, feel free to share this page and help promote our tour and our music. Thank you so much!!

story:
We have put together with the help of Forfeit Productions, a two week tour that we will embark on starting July 13th. With your help, we will make this happen and perform in all of these cities while making friends and meeting other musicians. 

The funding we receive from our friends and family will be put towards:
  • Gas
  • Food
  • misc. vehicle expenses/upkeep
and making sure we don't get stranded in the middle of Iowa.

Please please please, help us spread the word and spread the love through this medium. Music is our passion and our future careers and we would like to ride this out as far as it will take us. 
Thank you for your time, and much love to all of you,
NeoRomantics

story:
Story and Background

Thank you so much for checking out my Campaign! Hopefully you were able to watch my video and get a general idea of this project! The story below will give a little more detail and info so please be sure to take a read!

My name is Ben and I’m a songwriter continuing on a path I started when I was young. This campaign is a way for you to be apart of something I love and am very excited about.  I am beyond grateful for your contributions and consideration for the project!

There is nothing in my life I am more passionate about than the art of music. More than anything I want to express my heart and mind through these songs and share it with anyone who is willing to listen.  As stated in the video, I spent night after night writing this album in my bedroom for several months. I would go to work, come home, and sit on my floor for the majority of the night writing until my neighbor below would bang on the ceiling with her broom. The inspiration for the songs came from all sorts of different places. Stories, dreams, emotions, it’s all in there. Over the past few years I’ve learned to strongly believe that pursuing something you love, regardless of the sacrifice, is far more important than having the ability but not making the effort due to fear of failure or unsatisfactory. It took a lot for me to tell the lies in my head to shut up so I could pursue this, and often times it’s still a battle, but our minds contain to much creativity to go to waste and this project is me sharing with you what its in my heart and mind. Once again thank you for your love and support for this project and my music.

Why 7,000?

I was trying to come up with a safe amount that wasn’t too low, but also wasn’t unreachable. Within this amount ill be able to acquire all the needs for the record including studio time, mixing, mastering, artwork, and the printing/packaging.

What If you don’t meet your goal?

Since the campaign is done through Indiegogo, which allows for any funds raised to be kept, ill know how much is needed to continue with the project and begin planning what my next steps will be.

Why a full album instead of an EP?

There could still be an EP, but right now I’m trying to think big picture and strive for something on a larger scale. I have the music for a full album, which is motivating me to do that instead of the EP, but I also want people to have the option of more songs to listen to if they enjoy the music.

Can we trust you with our money?

Yes. Something will become of it, whether that’s the full record, an EP, or just a single (all dependent on the amount of funds raised).  Too much work has gone into the project for it to be for anything else.

I want to donate but I just can’t right now, what can I do?

Social media is a very large part of promoting these days so making some noise about it would be very beneficial, especially if you’re sharing it to people who can donate! You can also direct people to certain pages for future news and updates about the project, music, shows, etc. like my Instagram page (@benpeverall) , Facebook page (Ben Peverall Music)

story:
My sister and I were raised like wildflowers, left loose to drink rain or tears, to turn sunlight into nourishment for ourselves. In the mud of the Tennessee River, we grew to blossom and fought off threats with our thorns.

Of course, one of us always had more thorns than blossoms.

We're the Girls from Ruby Falls. We have a full score of stories to tell you; songs we sang to the moon and the ghosts in the woods. Some of them are about love, of course, both the kind you regret and the kind you mourn. Some of them are about our daddy and his whiskey; our mama and her weeping heart. Some of them are about blood.

We’d like to sing them to you, like we used to sing them to the ghosts...


Our Plan & Perks For You!

Iris and I want to record our songs and have our history bound and printed. To that end, we’ve collected the finest fiddlers and mandolin pickers and buskers we can find, and a damn fine engineer to record us all. We’ve also gone back through our archives and found all the old photographs and scraps of lace and strands of pearls to show you, from all those years ago. We're fitting up a traveling show, to wend our way through the backroads, singing our pretty tragedy for all of you in juke joints and barrooms.

Help us tell you our story. We’ve been waiting such a long time.

The nitty gritty: we need to raise funds to pay for studio time and an engineer; to pay instrumentalists for rehearsal and recording session time; to produce a physical CD; to host and distribute digital downloads; to produce and print an illustrated companion storybook to our live performance, and to pay for PR costs associated with the launch of our tour. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Thanks so much for reading. If you'd rather not contribute financially or simply aren't able (we understand financial times are tough), we'd love it if you'd  help us spread the word!

Here's a sneaky peek of some of the songs we're working on...


and little rehearsal snippet for y'all...

story:
The Project

In Spring of 2015, Joy Shannon and the Beauty Marks released an album called "Mo Anam Cara" which follows the ancient Celtic calendar, with a song for every seasonal holiday. Now, with the filmmaking and design team who brought you the Beauty Marks' music video "Midsummer Witchhunt", we are creating a 4 song music video, spanning the entire seasonal arc of the album "Mo Anam Cara". In essence, we will be creating a short film, which illustrates the 4 major season and Celtic pagan holidays, with the songs "Imbolc: Invocation to Brighid", "The Fires of Beltaine", "Mabon: Airmid Bring Back the Dead" and "Midwinter Ghost".

What We Need & What You Get

We are fundraising for $1200 to pay for camera rental and a cinematographer's time to shoot these 4 videos over the course of about a week. Additional expenses include costuming for our performers, paying our fabulous makeup and hair designer Monique Paredes her very reasonable day rate, and food for the cast and crew during our shooting days.

What you will get in return for your generous support are various perks including special edition T-shirts, posters, music releases and, ultimately, a DVD of the Joy Shannon and the Beauty Marks music video collection. Plus, there will be a live film viewing and music performance by the band in the LA area when the videos are complete.

The Impact

This is the biggest music video project we have tackled yet! While we have done many single song music videos for many of our albums, the Beauty Marks have never done a 4-song music video! Though, because Joy has made short films in her past, as well as director Matt Kollar has created feature films and TV-series, the duo felt inspired to push past the scope of their previous music video projects.

This album "Mo Anam Cara" is such a special album, which details the entire year cycle of the ancient Celtic calendar, so it felt fitting to honor this album with more than a single music video, but rather 4 videos which blend together, mirroring the cycle of the year itself. Successfully executing this concept will make this a very impactful short film/music video piece.

Risks & Challenges

Truly the biggest hurdle is the scope of this project, being 4 music videos in one. Yet, Matt Kollar and Joy Shannon, along with their creative team, have experience working together on smaller, complicated film projects already, so it feels like nothing they can't handle!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, come help out on set! We can always use an extra set of hands during our filming, which is set to be in December 2015 and January 2016. Send us a message if you're interested!

story:
Who is LOCAL?

LOCAL is a Colombo based alternative/indie Rock Band, which was formed about a year back.  

Members: 
  • Guitar/ Vocals - Harsha Aravinda
  • Drums - Greg Pallegama 
  • Keyboards/ Vocals - Summa Perera
  • Bass/ Vocals - Thilina Blyz
Recently we released couple of Singles that was done with the aid of friends. Have a listen to 
Tharuke: https://soundcloud.com/thilina-blyz/thilina-blyz-tharuke
Janaki: https://soundcloud.com/thilina-blyz/janaki-by-local

What You Get 

What you will be getting is Music, Culture and Life. Simply that is it!!!

In a country such as Sri Lanka where main stream music is superstar based media products, LOCAL music will give you something worthwhile to listen to, enjoy and think about. It's not just music, it's food for your soul.

What We Need

With a growing fan base, we want to record and launch our debut album, which will be named as "THARUKE".  For this we would require a sum of 2100$. 

We will be compiling 10 songs,

  • Tharuke: already recorded
  • Janaki: already recorded
  • Biyanowanna Sondhuriya
  • Patalila: Demo - https://soundcloud.com/harsha-aravinda/patalila-new-guide
  • Bodawenna Sithuwam: Live recording - https://soundcloud.com/harsha-aravinda/bondawenna-at-cult-nov-11
  • Mata Hithena Dea Gana
  • Sondhuru Dhadabima
  • Man Kohoma Kiyannada Oyaata: demo: https://soundcloud.com/thilina-blyz/thilina-blyz?in=thilina-blyz/sets/set-1
  • Enna
  • Piyaba Yannam
Recording cost for one song will be around 215$, We will be recording 8 of the above songs. With the remainder we hope to launch the album with album ART and some promotional photos and videos. All songs will be FREE and distributed via cyber space.

The Impact

We hope to bring Art and Culture to the center of the Sri Lankan community. And to spread our music across to a global audience.

And that's all there is to it.

story: I have been described by Clyde Stubblefield as The Princess of Soul and i plan on keeping this title ! I come from a small town in Quebec just outside of Ottawa. I started singing at age 12 and immediately knew my calling. I am fortunate enough to have friends and family around me who are supporting and nurturing of my passion. I believe that music is something to be cherished and shared with the world. My plan is to release my 2nd album This January starting with a single. I have worked really hard at this point and i was fortunate enough to work with some incredibly talented musicians. Now that the new album is ready to be released we are looking for funding to market the project.  I will be hiring Publicists and having to fund world wide marketing agencies. We are reaching out to industry professionals on both coasts, in New York City and Los Angles. This funding will allow us to hire the best in the business. I want people to know even though i have worked very hard making the album this is the most crucial step in having a successful release. My plan is to reach $10,000. Even if you haven't any financial support for the project I would appreciate your support by sharing, following or liking any of my social media pages. My plan is to give Cd's, various merchandise, song downloads & Live Performances for contributions. I have always believed being a singer has been  part of a bigger picture. I would like to thank everyone who is contributing to this project. When we reach our goal these publicists will make it possible for me to play my music in the states with the original musicians off the album. Some of these musicians are Clyde Stubblefield (James Brown's Drummer), Mae Koen (Aretha Franklin back up singer) Shay Jones ( Chaka Kahn & Nine inch nails back up singer), Grammy award nominated Billy Branch harmonica, Champagne James Robertson Guitarist (well known for playing with Lindi Ortega). We have overcome most of the hurdles having produced the album. Luckily i had Neal Sundet & Jack Letourneau as my producers who have been standing by me all the way. Now our last hurdle is to successfully promote the album. Thanks for reading about my funding campaign even if you cant contribute please share this with your friends family's and co workers !

When we reach our goal these publicists will make it possible for me to play my music in the states with the original musicians off the album. Some of these musicians are Clyde Stubblefield (James Brown's Drummer), Mae Koen (Aretha Franklin back up singer) Shay Jones ( Chaka Kahn & Nine inch nails back up singer), Grammy award nominated Billy Branch harmonica, Champagne James Robertson Guitarist (well known for playing with Lindi Ortega). We have overcome most of the hurdles having produced the album. Luckily i had Neal Sundet & Jack Letourneau as my producers who have been standing by me all the way. Now our last hurdle is to successfully promote the album. Thanks for reading about my funding campaign even if you cant contribute please share this with your friends family's and co workers !

story:
The Revolution will not be televised....the Revolution will be live!

Pebble to Pearl is an original funk rock band in the DC Metro area. For those of you who have seen us in action, know it's a unforgettable performance. We want to share that experience from the stage with your ears in what we like to call an 'eargasm". 

This EP is based off of real life experience, that you as our fans can relate to. Love, Loss, Power, Passion, even Anger and Betrayal; all emotions we have experienced at one point in our lives. 

We need your help to get there! Funding is always a struggle with "starving" artists. To make our EP we need to fund at least $5000. These donations will go towards studio time, promotions, branding, replication and copyrighting.  We are pulling out all our favors, and going for broke to make this the best album it can be. From hiring top producers, musicians and writers, to assist us in this endeavor, to rentals of the top equipment. 

We will be giving back to those that help us. Autographed EP's and T-shirts, even your name in the credits, are just a few of what we offer as a Thank You for the support. 

Long Awaited and Overdue

For those of you who know us, and have been there from the beginning, we know you are excited to see this to fruition. This EP is long awaited and overdue, and we simply can not contain our creativity any longer.  While we have a few songs on online, even a video on YouTube, we want to give you more.  We have had our ups and downs as any project does, and you have stuck by us.  We can't thank you enough for it.


No Moola, No Problem!!!

We understand not everyone can donate their funds to cause, but you can still help. 

*Spread the word about our project. 

*Share on your social media pages or email the links to friends and family.  

Word of mouth is our best friend and the biggest promoter of all.  We know we can do it with your help.  You make all the difference!!!

story:
Yikes!  It’s really hard to "find a quiet place to record!"  It seems a simple enough task, right?   But if you listen, really listen, you'll notice that finding an oasis of silence free of construction noises, planes, trains, cars, sirens, leaf blowers, kids, beeps, hums, loud neighbors, barking dogs and of course, rain, can by nearly impossible. 


And building a home studio is not always that easy. Or affordable. 

We get it, and we want to help you. 


Who are we?  We’re the Seattle Voice Institute. We are teachers who care about training healthy and dynamic voices.  We are also voice performers who care about nurturing Seattle’s voice-over community.  We’re also moms to two five year-olds... and we need your help.  Destruction of our old office in Belltown is looming, and our new office is under construction in a very large, very raw warehouse space that we’ll be sharing with Tiffany Talent, Jodi Rothfield Casting, and Mighty Tripod Productions.  


The good news is that our new space has a room that is ideal for a brand new recording studio!  And that’s good news for you, because we want to make the space available to you for your own auditions and projects.  

We’re asking you to join with us in making this a beautiful, comfortable, affordable and professional place to record.  For every $100 you donate, you get 20 hours (!) in the studio booked in 30-minute to four-hour increments per day if you donate before Dec. 31st, 2015.  (That's only $5 per hour!!!)   After Dec. 31st, you can still donate, and you'll get 10 hours for $100.  This is for our basic set-up where you can either bring your own recording equipment or use our laptop with user-friendly Audacity recording software. 

USB mics available to you include:

  • Blue Yeti
  • Blue Spark
  • Blue Snowball

You’ll also get priority booking in the studio for 2016 and a HUGE discount to use the room after you use your first 20 hours at only $10 an hour in 2016.  This means that in 2016 you can book additional hours in the studio for just $10 an hour in 2016.   

If you need an audio engineer or want to use really fancy high-end equipment, we will have that available to you at an additional cost—while always thinking about the best way to keep it affordable for you. Again, just to reiterate- your $100 is for 20 hours (during 2016) with a Blue Yeti, a laptop and Audacity recording software.  You can bring in our own equipment too.

And it’s worth mentioning that this could be a pretty amazing present for you or the person in your life who loves voiceover.  Maybe someone needs voiceover for their small business or audiobook?  It would be amazing to interview an elderly loved one. Do you know someone who needs VO for their short film, a radio play, or school project?  Please join us and let’s create an audio oasis in the community for voiceover.


Who we are.


Gin Hammond Voice Specialist/Co-Founder

Classes include:  Voiceover Toolbox Workshop, Accent Reduction, Dialect Coaching, Demo Reel Production, Audition Prep, Voiceover Coaching.

Gin Hammond received her MFA from the A.R.T. at Harvard University/Moscow Art Theater. She is an Associate Teacher of Fitzmaurice Voicework®, which she has taught in London, Cambridge, and Vancouver, British Columbia.  Gin has also instructed at Cornish College of the Arts, as well as at the Freehold Theater Lab Studio. She has taught public speaking at Freehold, privately, and also for corporate clients including Boeing. Hammond’s voice can be heard on commercials, audiobooks, and a variety of video games including Undead Labs: State of Decay, DotA 2, Aion, Halo 3 ODST. Directing credits include The Westerbork Serenade, (a Footlight Award winner which toured to the Netherlands), as well as Subprime! Inside the Heart of the Mortgage Meltdown, a Seattle Weekly “Pick of the Week.” She received a Helen Hayes Award for Outstanding Lead Actress for her performance in The Syringa Tree, and has performed in Russia, Germany, Ireland, Scotland and England.




Shana Pennington-Baird Vocal Instructor, Director/Co-Founder

Classes:  Audition Prep, Acting for Singers, Private Singing Lessons, Public Speaking, Audiobook Narration, Editing, Home Studio Set Up.

Shana Pennington-Baird has been working in the Pacific Northwest theatre scene for twenty years. In addition to acting, Shana has produced concert series, managed large and small theatre festivals and summer camps, and planned events for small and large non-profits. After receiving a BFA in Theatre from Stephens College, she toured with the Missoula Children’s Theatre and settled in Seattle. A long-time veteran of Cabaret Productions, Shana is best known for her ability to quickly learn parody lyrics and perform on the fly. Shana’s voice can be heard in recent Mountain Credit Union commercials, on the Seattle Channel, video games and audiobooks on Amazon.com and Audible.com. Shana has worked with the Bathhouse Theatre, 5th Ave Musical Theatre, Oregon Cabaret, Seattle Shakespeare Company, Civic Light Opera, ACT Theatre, Icicle Creek Theatre Festival, Okoboji Summer Theatre, and Book-It Repertory.


What we need. 

We need $8,000 to cover our non-recoupable construction costs which include:

  • Building materials 
  • Construction & manual labor costs
  • Design Engineer
  • Structural Engineer 
  • Contractor


What you get.

What you get for $100:

  • 20 hours in the recording studio booked in 30-minute increments (or more- up to 4 hours in one day) if you donate before Dec. 31st, 2015. Then 10 hours if you donate after Dec. 31st, 2015.
  • Priority booking in the studio for 2016 and a HUGE discount to use the room after you use your first 20 hours.  $10 an hour to rent the room later on in 2016.
  • Access to a laptop with Audacity
  • Access to a variety of USB microphones

 If you need an audio engineer or want to use really fancy high-end equipment, we will have that available to you for additional fees—while always thinking about the best way to keep it affordable for you. Again, just to reiterate- your $100 is for 20 hours in the space with a Blue Yeti, a laptop and Audacity in 2016.  You can bring in our own equipment too.


The impact.

Contributing to this studio not only helps us create a space where it will be a joy to learn and teach, but it also provides many struggling voice-over talents in the area, (many of whom have to wait until after midnight to record in their hot-and-airless-make-shift-moving-blanket recording “studios”), with a beautiful, comfortable, affordable and professional place to record.  Someplace where they can breathe freely and let their talent shine through!  Thank goodness.


Risks & challenges.

We are fully aware that we may not reach our full goal in which case we will seek alternate funding in the form of small business loans. Either way, the Seattle Voice Institute will have a studio of some kind, (hopefully of the best kind)!  Rewards/Perks will still be fulfilled regardless of having reached the full goal or not. We are hopeful in sharing our vision with you and appreciative of the help we've received so far.


Other ways you can help.

Even if you can't help financially, you can spread the word about the Seattle Voice Institute.  In addition to voice-over coaching, we also offer expertise in the realms of public speaking, singing, accents/dialects, transgender voice, vocal health, and voice coaching for everyday life.


Credits & thank yous.

Giant thanks to Bob at Tiffany Talent, Jody Rosenfield,  and David S. Hogan and Angela diMarco of Mighty Tripod Productions for letting us share this amazing new space in Georgetown.

Huge thanks to Ben Baird for the insane amount of help in the studio design/and building process. Huge thanks to our beloved students for their enthusiasm, and to everyone else who has helped us this far.

story:
Why Studio Blue?

My wife and I need your help launching our own home-based recording studio, Studio Blue Media. Sounds pretty run-of-the-mill, right? Why should you help us? We're both disabled and trying to provide for our 7 year old son who has been diagnosed with Asperger's Syndrome (autism).

Our goal is to create a home studio where we can record commercials, audiobooks, and other various voice overs. Seems pretty simple, yes?

My wife, despite having the ultra-rare Autoimmune Encephalitis (which causes her immune system to attack her brain), and me with Bipolar Disorder, are not a bunch of sad sacks content with the cards life has dealt us. Our goal is to create a profitable home business that will allow us to provide for our family, do things like pay rent, and home school our autistic 7 year old son... and make awesome recordings.

We just need help acquiring tools... and that's where you come in.

What We Need

Honestly, audio tools can be pricey, and when it comes to audio equipment the old adage is true: you get what you pay for. If you buy a $50 mic, you sound like you're talking into a tin can. And if your studio isn't properly soundproofed then your recordings will be filled with the annoying barking dog next door, cars passing on the street, or simply the sounds of your family walking around the house.

We've done extensive research and created a list of equipment that will allow us to make professional grade recordings right in our own home. These include a Focusrite Scarlett 2i2 USB interface, Symetrix 528E vocal processor, and a Neumann TLM 103 microphone.

What You Get

Perks, baby! We aren't just looking for a free hand out, we're willing to work for it. Here are just some of the cool perks we're offering in exchange for your generosity:

  • Your name included in a custom video on our site (http://StudioBlueVoiceOver.com).
  • We will record a custom message for your voicemail, phone system, or ringtones.
  • Custom Christmas videos! Write up a short message for your friends and family and provide us with a few photos and we will create a personalized Christmas Video Card you can send to everyone!
  • We will voice for your business commercial or video.
  • Audiobooks? Yeah. We got that. Want one?
  • Custom Studio Blue t-shirts (only a limited number will be produced).
  • Stickers! Who doesn't love stickers?
  • How about a studio grade microphone in a hardshell case with a hand-written thank you note? Yeah, we got that too.
  • And we have so many more!


Risks & Challenges

We currently have a small recording booth built into the closet of our master bedroom. It's not much, the equipment has been pieced together over the last several years (some was even donated to us), my voice processor is on the verge of death--it was partially refurbished when it came to me--it's quirky, and the closet is lined with moving blankets, but it's allowed us to start building our voice over business.

  • In the past six months we've done commercial work, videos, animated explainers, and even full-length audiobooks... but our makeshift closet booth just isn't cutting it. The quality we're capable of is sadly lacking and it's keeping us from acquiring clients.
  • And the honest truth is that the voice over industry has changed drastically in the past ten years. The method of acquisition and delivery has changed. What used to be done exclusively at high end studios in Hollywood can now be done at home.
  • With Pay-to-Play sites any John Q. Public with delusions of grandeur can pay a monthly subscription fee, jack a cheap microphone to their computer and audition for, and record, voice overs. That doesn't mean they're good, have any voice training, or the tools they need... it just means they can.
  • We know this won't be easy, but with my wife's 10 years of sales and promotions experience, and my 15 years of radio, commercial production, and digital production and SEO experience, we know we can make our studio successful.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know everyone isn't in a position to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • Word of mouth is one of our most powerful promotional tools. Help us get the word out about Studio Blue! The more people who see our Indigogo campaign, the better our chances are.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out!

Thank you!

story:
My dear ones, 

Thank you for visiting this page!  I am so thankful for your support and love.  

The Basics:

  • Beginning in January 2016, I'll be traveling to communities around the country to play house concerts of my original music.  I hope to sing with, gather stories from, and share life with the people I meet in my travels.  I want to offer my music, to offer myself to serve in the communities I visit, and to offer my ears to listen to the stories of those I meet.
  • I will also participate in some formal projects:  a peacemaking delegation with Christian Peacemaker Teams, a songwriting retreat through the Glen Workshop, and several other conferences and gatherings throughout the year. 
  • This journey is my own project, and I hope to be filled by it.  I hope for times of contemplation and renewing, as this season is something of a sabbatical for me.  I also hope to offer friendship, service, and my music to those I visit.  
  • I am so excited about this opportunity!  I need your support to make this idea into a reality.  Please read the details and money sections below to learn how you can help.

The Details:

  • I am going to be traveling by bus, train, and plane.  I plan to take at least 7 months visiting communities and friends across the Southeast, East Coast, and Southwest.  (I'd also love to make it out to the West Coast, probably in the second half of the year.)  I hope to visit around 40 communities in 2016.  
  • I'll be traveling and offering my music for the bulk of this journey.  My favorite way to share music is in living rooms, and I am so excited to put together a tour of house concerts.  There is something mystical about getting folks to sing together in the space of a home.  In exchange for the hospitality my friends will show me, I can offer a concert and my willingness to work.  I want to sing my songs with you, I want to hear your stories, I want to meet your elders, I want to see your projects, and I want to learn from your experiences.
  • One of my earliest stops is to participate in the Christian Peacemaker Teams' Borderlands Delegation (based in Tucson, AZ).  I will have the opportunity to see firsthand some of the tension and fallout of the system which our country uses to regulate its southern borders.  I will hear stories from migrants, local residents, activists, and law enforcement personnel.  I have never participated in a peacemaking delegation like this, so I am excited to spend 10 days living and learning with peacemakers and locals.  
  • One of the last stops I have planned is a writing workshop in Santa Fe, NM.  The Glen Workshop is put on by the Image Journal, a literary journal that focuses on Christian mysticism and the arts.  Two of my musical heroes, Karin Bergquist and Linford Detweiler (better known as Over the Rhine), are the teachers for the week-long songwriting seminar at this workshop.  I am absolutely thrilled (...almost giddy...) to be participating in this workshop in August.  After 7 months of travel, I'm sure I will be ready for a retreat and some tools to synthesize my experiences and tour stories.  

The Money:

  • Will you donate to help offset my trip costs, estimated at $6000 - $8000 for the entire year?
  • I have already invested about $1000 in pre-trip expenses.  Much of that cost covered recording and producing my forthcoming album 'becoming home'. 
  • 50% of my projected expenses are travel-related: bus, plane, and train tickets, and gas money for kind souls who drive me from place to place.
  • The other big expenses are for experiences - $800 for participation in the Christian Peacemaker Teams delegation, approx. $1000 for participation in the Glen Workshop, and $700 for conference fees, entry fees for state and national parks, and the occasional ticket to attend a concert.
  • The rest of the money I'll use for food, and to repay my hosts for their hospitality.
  •  I also need to buy a backpack to carry my load.
  • You'll notice I'm only asking for $5,000, but I've listed more expenses than that in this description.  I'm setting out on faith that provision will come.  I have saved up a little money to get me started on this project, and I will be investing all of it into this tour.  I'll be setting out a tip jar at some of my shows on the road, and I am also hoping that people will choose to purchase my album 'becoming home' when it is released online.
  • If I don't raise the full amount listed here, don't worry!  I will travel and tour for as long as I can until the money (or my fortitude) runs out.

Why am I doing this?

  • My goal is to gather and share stories, to build connections between spiritual communities in many places, and to sing with friends wherever I go.
  • In 2014, I took a month-long tour of communities and had a wonderful experience sharing music and traveling.  This upcoming tour will put into play the wisdom I gained on my first tour.
  • I aim to be deeply present wherever I travel.  I love playing house shows and un-amplified music because it draws people toward each other, toward a quiet thing, in a space of welcome.  I want to be a person of welcome wherever I go, and I look forward to being welcomed by the communities I visit.

Other Ways You Can Help:

You may not be in a position to donate money, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • If you don't have a donation in you, please check out my music website:  www.monicalaytham.bandcamp.com.  You can listen to my singles and the forthcoming album 'becoming home' for free via online streaming, and you can download the songs to keep forever if you like them!  If you like what you hear (or if you don't, but you like me...), please share my music with your friends.
  • If you know somebody I should be connecting with (musicians, people who love to host house shows, community arts organizations, storytellers, churches or spiritual communities, co-ops, or your nifty aunt who makes great latkes), shoot me a message.  Your network is a resource and a gift to me!
  • If you like the sound of this project and would like to host me for a visit and a concert, please do get in touch!
  • Track my tour progress on my band website or my music facebook page (Monica Laytham Music) and spread the word about my journey to your friends in faraway places.

Love and deep peace to you all,

-Monica
story_txt:
My dear ones, 
Thank you for visiting this page!  I am so thankful for your support and love.  
The Basics:
 Beginning in January 2016, I'll be traveling to communities around the country to play house concerts of my original music.  I hope to sing with, gather stories from, and share life with the people I meet in my travels.  I want to offer my music, to offer myself to serve in the communities I visit, and to offer my ears to listen to the stories of those I meet.
I will also participate in some formal projects:  a peacemaking delegation with Christian Peacemaker Teams, a songwriting retreat through the Glen Workshop, and several other conferences and gatherings throughout the year.  This journey is my own project, and I hope to be filled by it.  I hope for times of contemplation and renewing, as this season is something of a sabbatical for me.  I also hope to offer friendship, service, and my music to those I visit.  
I am so excited about this opportunity!  I need your support to make this idea into a reality.  Please read the details and money sections below to learn how you can help.
   The Details: 
I am going to be traveling by bus, train, and plane.  I plan to take at least 7 months visiting communities and friends across the Southeast, East Coast, and Southwest.  (I'd also love to make it out to the West Coast, probably in the second half of the year.)  I hope to visit around 40 communities in 2016.  
I'll be traveling and offering my music for the bulk of this journey.  My favorite way to share music is in living rooms, and I am so excited to put together a tour of house concerts.  There is something mystical about getting folks to sing together in the space of a home.  In exchange for the hospitality my friends will show me, I can offer a concert and my willingness to work.  I want to sing my songs with you, I want to hear your stories, I want to meet your elders, I want to see your projects, and I want to learn from your experiences.
One of my earliest stops is to participate in the Christian Peacemaker Teams' Borderlands Delegation (based in Tucson, AZ).  I will have the opportunity to see firsthand some of the tension and fallout of the system which our country uses to regulate its southern borders.  I will hear stories from migrants, local residents, activists, and law enforcement personnel.  I have never participated in a peacemaking delegation like this, so I am excited to spend 10 days living and learning with peacemakers and locals.  

One of the last stops I have planned is a writing workshop in Santa Fe, NM.  The Glen Workshop is put on by the Image Journal, a literary journal that focuses on Christian mysticism and the arts.  Two of my musical heroes, Karin Bergquist and Linford Detweiler (better known as Over the Rhine), are the teachers for the week-long songwriting seminar at this workshop.  I am absolutely thrilled (...almost giddy...) to be participating in this workshop in August.  After 7 months of travel, I'm sure I will be ready for a retreat and some tools to synthesize my experiences and tour stories.  

The Money:

Will you donate to help offset my trip costs, estimated at $6000 - $8000 for the entire year?
I have already invested about $1000 in pre-trip expenses.  Much of that cost covered recording and producing my forthcoming album 'becoming home'. 
50% of my projected expenses are travel-related: bus, plane, and train tickets, and gas money for kind souls who drive me from place to place.
The other big expenses are for experiences - $800 for participation in the Christian Peacemaker Teams delegation, approx. $1000 for participation in the Glen Workshop, and $700 for conference fees, entry fees for state and national parks, and the occasional ticket to attend a concert.

The rest of the money I'll use for food, and to repay my hosts for their hospitality.
 I also need to buy a backpack to carry my load.
You'll notice I'm only asking for $5,000, but I've listed more expenses than that in this description.  I'm setting out on faith that provision will come.  I have saved up a little money to get me started on this project, and I will be investing all of it into this tour.  I'll be setting out a tip jar at some of my shows on the road, and I am also hoping that people will choose to purchase my album 'becoming home' when it is released online. If I don't raise the full amount listed here, don't worry!  I will travel and tour for as long as I can until the money (or my fortitude) runs out.    Why am I doing this?  My goal is to gather and share stories, to build connections between spiritual communities in many places, and to sing with friends wherever I go. In 2014, I took a month-long tour of communities and had a wonderful experience sharing music and traveling.  This upcoming tour will put into play the wisdom I gained on my first tour. I aim to be deeply present wherever I travel.  I love playing house shows and un-amplified music because it draws people toward each other, toward a quiet thing, in a space of welcome.  I want to be a person of welcome wherever I go, and I look forward to being welcomed by the communities I visit.


    Other Ways You Can Help: You may not be in a position to donate money, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  If you don't have a donation in you, please check out my music website:  www.monicalaytham.bandcamp.com.  You can listen to my singles and the forthcoming album 'becoming home' for free via online streaming, and you can download the songs to keep forever if you like them!  If you like what you hear (or if you don't, but you like me...), please share my music with your friends. If you know somebody I should be connecting with (musicians, people who love to host house shows, community arts organizations, storytellers, churches or spiritual communities, co-ops, or your nifty aunt who makes great latkes), shoot me a message.  Your network is a resource and a gift to me!
If you like the sound of this project and would like to host me for a visit and a concert, please do get in touch!
Track my tour progress on my band website or my music facebook page (Monica Laytham Music) and spread the word about my journey to your friends in faraway places.   Love and deep peace to you all,-Monica

story:
Girls Rock! Phoenix

GR!PHX is a  nonprofit organization that encourages girls to RISE UP and ROCK OUT! We want girls to feel empowered, strong, and fearless. And we do that by handing them instruments and turning up their amps. Our one-day camp was a HUGE success, and this summer we’re putting on our first ever week-long camp! Over the course of one week, campers will learn an instrument, join a band, write an original song, and play a show for the community. And we need your help!

 You Can Support GR!PHX in Two Ways:

  1. Make a monetary donation here and choose from one of our rad perks as a thank you!  Or...
  2. Donate an instrument to us! We can use guitars, basses, drum kits, keyboards, microphones, PAs, amps, and cables in working condition, and all instrument donations are tax deductible. If you have something you want to send our way, EMAIL girlsrockphx@gmail.com.


THANK YOU

                   for Supporting the GRRRLS of the Desert!

story:
------ UPDATE -----

I have had some people ask why I asked for $40,000 for my Indiegogo. That's a lot of money right? Sure it is.

The reality is that this is not even a the full cost of what it will actually cost me to record, release, promote, and print merchandise for this project. The recording cost of Razorwire was $10,000. For this record I asked $25,000 so that I could take more than 5 days this time to record and pay my team members what they rightfully deserve. All of the other cost were the same as this budget and were self funded. Shocking? It is to me too.

The campaign ends in 30 days and I hope at this point I can make it to $10,000 for the Indiegogo Campaign so that at the minimum I can record a great record. It will force everyone to make sacrifices and will require me to trust and pray that labels will step in and release this record so that I can get the record out to the world without self funding the entire cost, but I will give you a great record none the less.

So let break it down. What does it take to release a record internationally as an independent artist in all of Europe and the United States?

Recording Cost - $25,000 (actual quotes I have received)
Album Art - $500
Photos (hair, makeup, location, and clothes) - $500
CD printing and pressing - $1,500
Tee-shirts (including design) - $800 
Vinyl - $800
Posters - $200
Publicity Worldwide (including the printing of 1,000 promotional CDs and shipping for these CDs) - $10,000
Radio Publicity Worldwide - $3,000
Release Tour Upfront cost - $3,000
Music video - $5,000

TOTAL = $50,300

Thank you for your support and thank you so much to all of you out there that have donated and participated. You are as big a part of this record as I am.

STORY

Two years after the release of my first full length album, Razor Wire, I have finally finished writing for my second record. I have played hundreds of shows all over the world the past couple years and I have met so many loving a gracious people along the way. Many of the new songs are about those experiences.

In 2014, when Razor Wire came out, I was an independent artist. Now in 2016 and I am still independent and this is why I am doing a pledge campaign : to keep the music alive and making this record. I am grateful that nowadays, there are options for us musicians  to humbly ask for help and offer you perks while doing so.

This is where you get to be a part of this project! Without a label, I rely on you for support in order to provide the capital to record and print this new full length record. And for it to happen, I will ask for you to share this project. Broadcast it to the world so we can get meet the goal. Your help is more important than you can imagine in the process of making this record. In fact you are critical. 

In return you get to brag for receiving the record before anyone else and perhaps having your name on the credits or even on all my tour swag! So thank you for everything, even sharing this link will be tremendously helpful.

I love you all. Let's do this!

Where the Money Goes

  • Recording costs, including studio rental and engineering fees
  • Audio mastering
  • CD and vinyl replication
  • Radio publicity campaign
  • Press campaign and tour publicity
  • Music videos
  • Graphic design/photography
  • Indiegogo fees

story:
Podcast

After presenting at SXSW in Austin, Canadian Music Week in Toronto, Katowice Culture Institute in Poland, and many events in Columbus, Ohio, How To Build A Music City is launching a podcast to share information about how cities are supporting music scenes.

Problem This Solves

It can be difficult to dig through studies, presentations, and reports about the social, cultural, and economic impact of music. This podcast will be listener accessible.

  • Cost - Free to stream.
  • Accessibility - Listen from anywhere.
  • Transparency - Questions will be answered or used in interviews.
  • Involvement - Be apart of the journey (see perks).
  • Learning - It's tricky to understand why and how cities are supporting music scenes, why businesses and government are getting involved, and what all of that means to musicians, jobs, and cities across the US. Each episode will be moderated with these sticking points in mind.

Features

  • 30-60 minute podcast episodes.
  • Key people in music, arts, tourism, business, and city government.
  • Key organizations that are supporting the growth of music and cities.

Launch:

  • $2,000 in support - We'll launch with a focus on Columbus, Ohio.
  • $5,000 in support - The Millennial Trains Project has invited us to join the journey and expand interviews into 5 cities across the US.
  • $6,500 in support - We'll expand to 10 cities across the US.

Your Support

Launch in Columbus, Ohio:

  • $2000, Podcast Equipment -- I'm doing all the mobile recording and edits. I need a couple GoPro's, good mics, and great converters.
Expansion:
  • $800, Fuel Expense -- I plan drive about 3,000 miles.
  • $900, Staying Alive -- Food, water, occasional AirBnB. The journey will last about 30 days or more, all around the US.
  • $300, Music Bed -- Licensing music from local musicians to use in podcast intros and sponsor segments.
  • $2500, National Marketing -- We can reach people all around the world. I'll stay cost savvy with web, email, and social marketing. International partners are standing by.

Let's Connect

  • Meet up, make friends, see shows, hang along the way.
  • Add me on Facebook and share this IndieGogo!

story:
The Transcribers aims to create a digital library of "popular music", which in this context means songs that have a definitive version, rather than having a notated score which is performed spontaneously. 

 Using MIDI data, we want to generate all sorts of useful visualizations and representations of modern music. There is a lot to be unearthed and learned in music that some consider fleeting and basic. To demonstrate the fruitfulness of such analysis, please visit www.thebookofthug.com. Having MIDI data of all this music would help keep it alive, so to say, and recorded in history. The following two videos show basic examples of representation and visualization we plan to use.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MuJyGqgi2u0

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZsTG9ZK4dnc

There is very little risk involved here. Once we get the ball rolling, the site should be self-sustaining. I have excluded the link from this project solely because I haven't purchased domain yet, but will one as soon as I get enough funding!

---

About me:

I am currently studying Music and Physics at Swarthmore College, PA. My extensive study of music theory, history, and composition in the Classical music domain has given me the tools to understand, analyze, and communicate my ideas about music. 

However, I'm tired of listening to the same instruments play the same notes all the time, and firmly believe that certain modern artists do amazing things we as listeners feel, but don't necessarily understand. I recently did an analysis of Young Thug (www.thebookofthug.com), in which I unearthed a startling amount of theory and compositional techniques, and how they relate to lyrical content. This has inspired me to do further analysis, and attempt to spread the tools and ideas to interested others.

story:
Hi! My name is Chelbie Laurel Birdwell. I am a singer and a songwriter. I am recording a new album this spring in Nashville. This campaign will help to partially fund the album. I have had a couple of songs cut by independent artists and I have also had a few licensing deals for film and tv. My goal, other than just to make music, is to have a cut by a major label artist. To do that, I have to keep recording and pitching new music. 

This is an opportunity to help me reach my goal and receive something in return. It’s basically like shopping for my talents. There is something for every fan from $10-$2000. Every contribution will receive a public thank you on my Facebook page.

Thank you for your willingness to support independent artists and local music! Please remember to share this page with your family, friends, and co-workers!

story:
We are your Symphony PEI.

Time to Play Your Part!

The Prince Edward Island Symphony has brought quality orchestral music to our province for nearly 50 years.  Four times a year our orchestra brings together sixty or more musicians including professionals, students, music teachers, business people and community members for an exciting 'concert weekend' to rehearse and perform a program of classical music that is appealing to a wide audience.

There's nothing quite like the power, majesty and grace of a live symphony orchestra, and the PEI Symphony is the Island's own. 

Now, we are asking for your support.  Delivering quality performances takes many volunteer hours, dedicated staff, hard-working musicians, and yes, money too! Like all other orchestras across Canada, ticket sales to concerts alone can never cover the total cost of keeping an orchestra operating.

Please help us keep the music playing.  Our community needs the PEISO, and the PEISO needs your support.  Just as each individual musician plays their part in an orchestra, we are asking YOU to play a part to help secure the future of our great orchestra. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise a minimum of $7,500 to help us reduce our operational debt. 

We certainly appreciate the generous support of the Canada Council of the Arts, the Prince Edward Island Department of Tourism and Culture, and the City of Charlottetown, and also to our key sponsors including The Joan & Regis Duffy Foundation, Provincial Credit Union,  Enjoy PEI, Maritime Electric, Hyndman Insurance, The Confederation Centre for the Arts, the Buzz, the Best Value hotels, Kwik Kopy, R. Birt & Associates, and Harvest Wholesale.  

Even with their support, we need your help.  Every donation, any size helps us keep the music playing!

As a thank you for supporting our orchestra, we have a fun range of unique perks available, from a handwritten card from a musician,  an opportunity to play, or a sponsorship - there is a way for everyone to play a part!

But the biggest gift you will receive is the wonderful feeling of knowing you have helped your PEI Symphony to keep the music playing. We’re not kidding, you are part of our team and just as important to us as that violinist or amazing oboe soloist. So please give generously and tell your friends!


Our Impact

Our orchestra has a huge impact on our community here in Prince Edward Island, and is itself a music community with a wide variety of individuals who either perform or appreciate quality orchestral music, and the joy of working hard together to create a beautiful live performance.  

As a full symphony orchestra, the PEISO supports our cultural identity in Prince Edward Island and the greater Charlottetown area, at a level that’s commensurate with our status as a province and capital, and the birthplace of Confederation in Canada.  

  • Cultural events such as our concerts engage and attract professionals, businesses and educated audiences to our Island and our economy.
  • Our audiences experience the incredible power and beauty of live orchestral music four times a season.
  • Our $170K annual budget is primarily used to purchase supplies and services right here in PEI, reinvesting in our local economy.
  • Four times per year we book twenty five hotel rooms for a full weekend for our travelling musicians.
  • Every concert attracts off-island tourism.
  • Charlottetown restaurants are busy during each of our four concert weekends.
  • Professional PEI musicians have the opportunity to perform with a full orchestra.
  • Young PEI student musicians have the opportunity to perform with an orchestra, as regular members and/or soloists.
  • Islanders experience talented guest soloists and our guest soloists experience the orchestra and our Island community.
  • Established PEI solo artists and groups have an opportunity to perform with a full live orchestra.
  • Island popular music artists and groups can have their music arranged for orchestra for other engagements outside of PEI.

Other ways to Help

The best way to support our orchestra is to come to as many of our concerts as you can!   Season Tickets are available for purchase - please check www.peisymphony.com for details, or call 902-892-4333.

Listen, perform, share. Get excited about classical music - and play your part!
story_txt:
We are your Symphony PEI.Time to Play Your Part!The Prince Edward Island Symphony has brought quality orchestral music to our province for nearly 50 years.  Four times a year our orchestra brings together sixty or more musicians including professionals, students, music teachers, business people and community members for an exciting 'concert weekend' to rehearse and perform a program of classical music that is appealing to a wide audience.There's nothing quite like the power, majesty and grace of a live symphony orchestra, and the PEI Symphony is the Island's own. Now, we are asking for your support.  Delivering quality performances takes many volunteer hours, dedicated staff, hard-working musicians, and yes, money too! Like all other orchestras across Canada, ticket sales to concerts alone can never cover the total cost of keeping an orchestra operating.Please help us keep the music playing.  Our community needs the PEISO, and the PEISO needs your support.  Just as each individual musician plays their part in an orchestra, we are asking YOU to play a part to help secure the future of our great orchestra. What We Need & What You GetWe are aiming to raise a minimum of $7,500 to help us reduce our operational debt. We certainly appreciate the generous support of the Canada Council of the Arts, the Prince Edward Island Department of Tourism and Culture, and the City of Charlottetown, and also to our key sponsors including The Joan & Regis Duffy Foundation, Provincial Credit Union,  Enjoy PEI, Maritime Electric, Hyndman Insurance, The Confederation Centre for the Arts, the Buzz, the Best Value hotels, Kwik Kopy, R. Birt & Associates, and Harvest Wholesale.  Even with their support, we need your help.  Every donation, any size helps us keep the music playing!As a thank you for supporting our orchestra, we have a fun range of unique perks available, from a handwritten card from a musician,  an opportunity to play, or a sponsorship - there is a way for everyone to play a part!But the biggest gift you will receive is the wonderful feeling of knowing you have helped your PEI Symphony to keep the music playing. We’re not kidding, you are part of our team and just as important to us as that violinist or amazing oboe soloist. So please give generously and tell your friends!Our ImpactOur orchestra has a huge impact on our community here in Prince Edward Island, and is itself a music community with a wide variety of individuals who either perform or appreciate quality orchestral music, and the joy of working hard together to create a beautiful live performance.  As a full symphony orchestra, the PEISO supports our cultural identity in Prince Edward Island and the greater Charlottetown area, at a level that’s commensurate with our status as a province and capital, and the birthplace of Confederation in Canada.  
Cultural events such as our concerts engage and attract professionals, businesses and educated audiences to our Island and our economy.
Our audiences experience the incredible power and beauty of live orchestral music four times a season.
Our $170K annual budget is primarily used to purchase supplies and services right here in PEI, reinvesting in our local economy.
Four times per year we book twenty five hotel rooms for a full weekend for our travelling musicians.
Every concert attracts off-island tourism.
Charlottetown restaurants are busy during each of our four concert weekends.
Professional PEI musicians have the opportunity to perform with a full orchestra.
Young PEI student musicians have the opportunity to perform with an orchestra, as regular members and/or soloists.
Islanders experience talented guest soloists and our guest soloists experience the orchestra and our Island community.
Established PEI solo artists and groups have an opportunity to perform with a full live orchestra.
Island popular music artists and groups can have their music arranged for orchestra for other engagements outside of PEI.
Other ways to HelpThe best way to support our orchestra is to come to as many of our concerts as you can!   Season Tickets are available for purchase - please check www.peisymphony.com for details, or call 902-892-4333.Listen, perform, share. Get excited about classical music - and play your part!

story:
Defenders Of The Hate LP

It has been fifteen years since the original "Defenders of the Hate" 7" was released, nine years since the comp CD, and five years since the passing of my good friend Seth Putnam.  The original plan was to develop a compilation LP celebrating his life to be released this year.  But, in order to accomplish what I want from it, it is going to a lot more time and effort than I had planned.  So to kick off what I hope to be a series of Seth Putnam related releases, we decided to reissue this classic album on full-length vinyl with the express permission of Seth’s estate.

Become a Defender

The "Defenders of the Hate" LP will feature all the songs that were on the compact disc version. 500 copies on standard black will be released for retail. 200 copies will be on pink vinyl available to those choosing to contribute with that perk, and customers who purchase a copy through the MTS webstore.

In addition to the color vinyl, perks will be offered for "Defenders of the Hate" t-shirts and patches.  And as a special contribution package, MTS is offering a limited copy of the album on red vinyl.  This version will only be limited to those who participate.  If only 9 people contribute, it will be limited to 9 copies.  Each of these red vinyl copies will be hand-numbered and personalized to the contributors.  Any remaining copies not claimed will be destroyed in a drunken rampage.

The release is ready to go.  Mastering and artwork is done, we are now arranging the funding for manufacturing the vinyl, shirts, and patches.  Our goal is roughly $5,000 to cover all costs. Future profits will be used for band compensations and future AxCx  and Seth Putnam related releases.

The Plan

The "Defenders of the Hate" LP will feature all the songs that were on the compact disc version.  500 copies on standard black will be released for retail. 200 copies will be on pink vinyl available to those choosing to contribute with that perk, and customers who purchase a copy through the MTS webstore.

In addition to the color vinyl, perks will be offered for "Defenders of the Hate" t-shirts and patches.  And as a special contribution package, MTS is offering a limited copy of the album on red vinyl.  This version will only be limited to those who participate. If only 9 people contribute, it will be limited to 9 copies.  Each of these red vinyl copies will be hand-numbered and personalized to the contributors.  Any remaining copies not claimed will be destroyed in a drunken rampage.

The release is ready to go.  Mastering and artwork is done, we are now arranging the funding for manufacturing the vinyl, shirts, and patches.  Our goal is roughly $5,000 to cover all costs.  Future profits will be used for band compensations and future AxCx  and Seth Putnam related releases.

The risks?

If you do not contribute now, you might miss out, and you'll be sorry.

Spread the noise

Can't contribute financially?  There are other ways to help.  Link us on Facebook, Twitter, or other social media things you fancy.  Make flyers about the campaign and hang them up in your favorite gay bar.  All help is appreciated!
