story:
Bass Saxophone

The Moanin' Frogs are a unique ensemble using the full range of saxophones from soprano to the rare BASS saxophone. 

HOWEVER we currently do not own our own Bass saxophone and this is greatly impacting the group in terms of the performances we can take and the quality of the music we can create.

Unless we can purchase our own bass saxophone soon the Moanin' Frogs are in danger of going extinct!

To date we have graciously been borrowing the bass saxophone from the University of Michigan, as well as other basses when we travel, but we cannot continue to do this as we are an independent professional ensemble and cannot always find a bass to use wherever we go.  Additionally the bass that we have been borrowing is in poor playing condition, making it difficult to play with the musical precision that the group is capable of. 

By purchasing a new bass saxophone, such as a Selmer Series II, we will be able to ensure the continued success of the group, allowing us to perform and record the highest quality of music wherever we go, for years to come. 

A new Selmer Bass Saxophone will cost us close to $20,000! With an additional $1,000-3,000 for a high quality case suitable for traveling on planes.


Our funding goal is only for $10,000, so where will we come up with the additional money?

We only set a $10,000 goal because that seems more manageable to meet than a $20,000 goal. So please still donate even if we hit our $10,000 goal!

Any remaining costs we don't raise, we will have to self fund.  We plan do do this by using our earnings from recent and upcoming performance fees as well as likely starting a payment plan with a dealer to pay for our bass saxophone, which we will gradually pay off over time with the group's earnings. 

After this campaign, it would be nice to keep the amount we have to self fund to a minimum, or totally eliminate it.  There are so many other projects and expenses that we can use our money on to benefit the group. These include: our debut CD project (to be released in October), commissions for new arrangements, photoshoots, management fees, travel, performer fees,  copyright fees, promotion, costumes, supplies and administrative fees, future recording and video projects, and much more. 


Rewards for Funders

We have many great incentives available so be sure to check them all out! They include items such as: our new CD, posters, creating and performing an arrangement of your choice for you, having us perform for you, or make school visits, having your name engraved on our new bass saxophone, and more!

All funders will be recognized with their name on our website, listed as donors!

"The Moanin’ Frogs are completely unique—I’ve never seen or heard anything even remotely like these guys. So much fun to watch and listen to, so musical…and they play so amazingly well together, as if controlled by one central brain. It’s astonishing. I was completely blown away."

 – Dave Koz, nine-time GRAMMY®–nominated Smooth Jazz Saxophonist


"The Moanin Frogs is the perfect blend of expertise, charm and entertainment...their skill and programming keep smiling audiences on the edge of their seats..."

Timothy McAllister, International Saxophone Soloist, GRAMMY® winner.



Thank You For Your Support!

Please feel free to find us on Facebook, Youtube, Instagram and Twitter

story:
This is one of those things you only dream of, and two years ago I recorded my first tune("I couldn't see"), and realized that this (music) is what I want to do. 

I started off playing and singing tunes like Corinne Bailey Rae's "Like a star" in my living room, and then I joined the local music scene, performing at open mics, in a band, and eventually on big platforms for organizations, and shows like Daytime Ottawa. 

Music to me is about creating something honest and genuine, and being an independent artist has also given me the time and space to learn and grow into the artist I've worked towards. It's been a tough ride, but the ongoing support and faith from my family of musicians and friends has inspired and pushed me, and now I'm hoping to share my music with the rest of the world.

For this reason, I would like to invite you to be a part of this growth project - and to help me record and finish my debut EP . Producing this EP, plus a music video, will give me something with which to share and showcase my craftsmanship, and gain opportunities to perform at festivals and other events. 

You can be involved in this campaign in two ways. By either spreading the word through word of mouth and social media, or by making a donation. And in exchange for your help, you'll receive a gift (like having your name in the credits, getting a copy of the EP before anyone else, getting a thank-you call from me, etc).

Your help is very crucial in making this recording happen, and at the end of it all we'll all be singing and celebrating the release together! 

So "what are you waiting for"? Go ahead and join the campaign.

Thank you!

Where the funds go:

- Recording fees, including studio time and engineering (with mastering)

- Music video

- Publicity campaign & promotion(online & offline)

- Indiegogo fees

- Musician fees

- Graphic design & photography

Where can I follow you?

www.karenmonie.com

http://www.numberonemusic.com/karenmonie

https://www.instagram.com/karenmoniemusic/

https://www.reverbnation.com/karenmonie?profile_view_source=header_icon_nav

story:
We are so grateful for 21 years of your support! Come celebrate with us at our “Coming of Age CD Release Party” for our newest CD Quiet Waters: An Evening with the Big Band at Quiet Waters Park on Saturday February 6th at 5pm in the Blue Heron Room. The event is for all ages, with a meet and greet beginning at 5pm, and dinner with the band starting at 5:30pm. Dinner will be catered by Guilianova’s in Westminster, and will be a Soul Food Extravaganza! The event will also be a donation drive for Fisher House, an organization that provides free or low cost housing for families of veterans receiving medical care in the area. Please see the list below for items in need at the Fisher House you can bring to donate to help out this amazing organization.

  If you are unable to attend the event on February 6th, you can still be a part of our 21st year celebration! Purchase your Quiet Waters: An Evening with the Big Band CD here! CD’s will be mailed out as soon as you purchase it!

Items in need at the Fisher House:
Grocery store gift cards such as Target, Giant, & Safeway
Juices, yogurt, cheese sticks, packaged lunch meats
Tuna fish lunch packs and microwaveable meals
Coffee/Kureig Coffee Singles
Tupperware containers
Knife sets
Liquid detergent for HE washers
Tide Pods detergent for HE washers
Fabric softener sheets for the dryer
Soft Scrub
Dawn Liquid dish soap / Cascade dishwasher all-in-one tablets
Paper Towels, Kleenex Hand Towels and bath tissue
Pledge multi-purpose cleaner, Lysol spray, Endust
Stainless Steel Wipes
Leather wipes
White cotton blankets for beds
Queen & Full Size mattress pads
Journals
Travel coffee mugs /Sports Bottles
Restaurant gift cards
Stamps

story:
The state of things

It's been over a year and a half since we were last in the studio, and we are now ready to record our third album.  The album is already written, we have engineers lined up ready to record, mix and master, except we are doing one thing differently this time: We are doing this entirely independently without a record label.
This will be game-changing for us, and you the fans, as we will now own our own music, and consequently, be able to afford to tour substantially more.
We need your help to make this album a reality!

What we need from you

Without a label, many bands can't afford to front recording or touring or even exist. Initially we weren't sure if we wanted to switch labels and repeat the same process we've done, but after reviewing the numbers and possibilites, realized that this is not an insane amount of money to ask for, and that the end result will be a record done exactly how WE want it with no external influence pushing us in any direction, and a record that WE OWN, so we can actually make money doing something we love, and put it straight back into our live show.
   
Here is a breakdown of where money will be alloted:

Studio Time

8000

Mixing

5000

Mastering

1250

Auxiliary Musicians

500

Equipment rental

1000

Advertising/Promotion

2000

Artwork

1500

Per diem

3000

Equipment maintenance

1000

Travel/Lodging expenses

1750

indiegogo cut 4% (from 25000)

-1000

paypal cut

-1250

Net total

22750

What You Get

Every perk listed includes either a digital or physical copy of the album, so when you donate, not only do you allow us to make the record, you'll actually have something to show for it at the end of the process.
We are also offering a bunch of unique items, including Parker's very own guitar, handwritten lyric books, and many items that are tied directly to the making of and recording of this album.
No matter what you are able to donate, you'll be rewarded for your generosity. No matter big or small, any contribution is a massive help, and we will be eternally grateful.

This is it

This campaign is absolutely crucial to us being active this year.  Without this campaign, we'd have to take an even greater amount of time off from recording, or even playing music at all, and our future touring plans for this year would have to be on hold.

We know from our travels all over the world that our fans are incredible and want this new music as much as we do, and we are confident that we can hit our goal and put out the most crushingly melodic, musical album of our careers thus far.
Rest assured that any money raised past our goal will go directly toward the betterment of the band, keeping us on the road, or covering the massive upfront costs that have been keeping us from Europe these past two years.

Donating to the cause is as easy as signing into PayPal as a Guest or setting up an account. We will be updating this page as often as possible with images of perk prizes, behind the scenes footage, rehearsal and recording shots, as well as finished product updates. Staying in touch will offer you the full benefits of being on our team.

Give What You Can 

If you are like us, (broke as hell musicians) or just like the millions of people who only have enough money to survive, we could still use your help. We will not turn down any amount of money no matter how big or small, but even if you can't part with a dollar, we could use the reach of your social media footprint.

We've gained a ton of fans over these years of touring and doing what we do, and we need your help to make this work. If you could share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or wherever you dwell on the internet, we could really reach a ton of new fans and have a chance to reconnect with old ones.

This is the future of Starkill and it's in your hands. Our music and our live show is all we have to offer, and we want to give you our best. We are honored to have you on board and can't wait to see how this project pans out. Thank you so much for the help.
We will be in touch. HAIL SATAN AND EAT PIZZA

This is the future of Starkill and
it's in your hands. Our music and our live show is all we have to offer, and we
want to give you our best. We are honored to have you on board and can't wait
to see how this project pans out. Thank you so much for the help. 
We will be in touch. HAIL SATAN AND EAT PIZZA

story:
FR:

Audiotrauma, née en 2002, entame sa 14eme année d'activisme sonore en faveur des cultures électroniques et digitales déviantes et post-industrielles. Sans aucun sponsors, ni aucun soutien institutionnel, nous avons livré un combat pour défendre une idée de la musique et de l'art en général.
Cela n'a pas toujours été facile mais nous sommes encore debout, motivés et passionnés.
Aujourd'hui encore, et plus que jamais, nous avons besoin de vous pour poursuivre notre quête.
L'argent est le nerf de la guerre...


Malgré l'obsolescence de notre monde et du système économique qui le régit, malgré le sang, les larmes et l'absurdité de l’existence, nos artistes sont plus que jamais créatifs et nous avons besoin de vous pour partager leurs œuvres avec les reste du monde.

Ni idoles, Ni  fans. Juste une communauté de passionnés et d'amoureux de la création.

Nous ne voulons pas faire l’aumône auprès des banques, nous ne voulons pas faire la manche auprès des institutions, et encore moins devenir les sbires d'une marque...alors nous vous invitons à nous rejoindre, nous soutenir et à coproduire avec nous les prochains traumatismes artistiques auxquels nous croyons.

Nous ne vendons pas de la musique, nous la produisons.

Traumatiquement vôtre
 Syco Trauma

Engl:


Born in 2002, Audiotrauma enters its 14th year of sound activism in support of electronic and digital cultures including deviant and post-industrial. Without sponsors, nor any institutional support, we delivered a fight to defend an idea of ​​the music and the art in general.

This has not always been easy but we are still standing, motivated and passionate.

Even today, more than ever, we need your help to continue our quest.

Money is the sinews of war ...

Despite obsolescence of our world and the economic system that governs despite the blood, the tears and the absurdity of existence, our artists are more creative than ever and we have you to share their works with the rest of the world.

No idols, no fans. Audiotrauma is community of enthusiasts and lovers of creation.

We do not want to give alms from banks, we do not want to beg from institutions, let alone become a mark henchmen ... then we invite you to join us, we support and co-produce with we upcoming artistic trauma in which we believe.

We do not sell music, we produce it.

Traumatically yours

 SycoTrauma


2016 AUDIOTRAUMA releases plan:


TERRABEATS CONCEPT (album) SERB

SOLVE (album) Aaimon side project / USA

VERIN (album) Chris Shortt debut album /USA

ALEPH (album) Supersimmetria side project/ ITA

BLOOD OF OTHERS(album) Product side project / USA

AUTOGEN (album) rosewater side project/ LET

NAO (EP) FR

SIGNAL 2 (album) FR

META MEAT (album) phil von+ somekilos / FR

AMESHA SPENTA (album) FR

HOLOGRAM_ (album) FR

HORSKH (album) FR


We propose you different levels of support to help the label to spread the trauma in 2016. In function of your level,  you will receive for your help, different packages including releases and goodies and also an access to a private forum to be close to the production process of the different traumas and exclusive news.

Thank you for your support and welcome to the AUDIOTRAUMA family

story:
Click here for English

CONCEPT DU CONCERT ORBIS

Orbis présente la harpiste Valérie Milot seule sur scène, mais accompagnée virtuellement par plus d'une vingtaine de musiciens. De nouvelles technologies permettent de capter des  éléments invisibles: le spectre sonore, le travail musculaire du corps de la musicienne en réaction avec son instrument et l’interaction de son cerveau face à la musique. Les données récupérées par ces capteurs influencent les jeux de lumières et de projections sur la scène.  Ainsi, basée sur une performance autant physique que musicale, chaque spectacle sera unique.

Les premières représentations du spectacle auront lieu les 26, 27 et 28 mai 2016 à la Cinquième Salle de la Place des Arts de Montréal. Le concert sera ensuite offert en tournée partout dans le monde.

Deux constructions majeures font partie intégrante du spectacle:

Disque de lumière

Cette plate-forme circulaire sur laquelle joue Valérie intègre un système d’éclairages complet sur les faces intérieures et extérieures.

Dôme

Une structure en forme de dôme se dépose sur le disque de lumière à la fin du spectacle. Le tissu semi-transparent dont il est constitué permet d’y projeter des images et des vidéos en plus d’y voir, en filigrane, la performance de Valérie.


Trois chapitres distincts constituent le spectacle Orbis:

Chapitre 1

Relief de la mémoire : Valérie rayonne

Dès le début le spectacle, Valérie éblouit grâce au disque de lumière déposé autour d’elle et son instrument, comme un phare qui illumine la nuit. Frappées par la lumière du disque, des formes disposées autour du disque créent des ombres portées définies.

Chapitre 2

Relief du physique: Valérie se dévoile

Ce passage met l’emphase sur le travail physique et surtout musculaire de l’artiste dans un contexte plus intime, grâce aux lumières internes du disque.

Chapitre 3

Relief de l’âme: Valérie révèle des secrets

Un dôme se dépose sur le disque de lumière. À ce moment, les spectateurs pourront voir en images les émotions de Valérie lorsqu’elle performe. À cet effet, la vidéo projetée sur la surface du dôme sera influencée par des capteurs. 

Image du disque de lumière et du dôme: Timecode Lab
Illustrations: Vincent Myette

QUI EST VALÉRIE MILOT?

Musicienne de vocation, Valérie Milot est une harpiste à la personnalité généreuse et accessible. Toujours en quête de nouveaux défis, elle n'hésite pas à oser de nouvelles expériences qui lui permettent de partager des moments privilégiés avec son public. Cliquez ici pour en apprendre plus!


Découvrez Valérie à travers ses performances musicales et ses clips humoristiques sur sa chaîne YouTube!

Crédit photos: Frédérik Robitaille / Martin Bernier / Timecode Lab


POURQUOI APPUYER UN TEL PROJET?

En appuyant le projet colossal qu'est "Orbis", vous encouragez plus d'une dizaine de créateurs canadiens et participez au développement de concepts scéniques d'avant-garde. Les montants récoltés serviront a créer le concept avec tous les supports techniques nécessaires afin qu'il puisse ensuite partir en tournée au Québec et à l'international.


English



ORBIS CONCERT CONCEPT

Orbis showcases harpist Valérie Milot in solo, but virtually accompanied by more than twenty musicians. New technologies allow to capture invisible elements: sound spectrum, muscular body work of the musician in reaction with her instrument and the interaction of the brain with the music. The data collected by these sensors influence the lightings and projections on the stage. Thus, based on both physical and musical performances, each show will be unique.

The first reprensatations of Orbis will take place at the Cinquième Salle of La Place des Arts in Montreal, May 26, 27 and 28, 2016.

Two major constructions are part of the show:

Radiant disk

This circular platform on which Valérie plays has a complete system of lightings on it's inner and outer faces.

Dome

A domed structure is placed on the lighting disk at the end of the show. It's semi-transparent fabric allows to project images and videos on it, while Valerie performs in it. 

Orbis is made of three distinctive chapters:

Chapter 1

Memory projection: Valerie shines

In the beginning the show, Valerie dazzled through the disk of light around her, like a lighthouse through the night. Struck by the radiant disk, shapes placed around it create defined shadows.

Chapter 2

Physical projection: Valérie reveals herself

This segment emphasizes the muscular work of the artist in a more intimate environment, through the disc's inner lights.

Chapter 3

Soul projection: Valérie reveals her secrets

A dome is placed on the radiant disk. At that time, the audience will see images of Valérie's emotions when she performs. With that in mind, the videos projected on the surface of the dome will be influenced by sensors.

Lighting disk and dome images: Timecode Lab
llustrations: Vincent Myette

WHO IS VALÉRIE MILOT?

Musician by vocation, Valérie Milot is a generous and accessible harpist. Always seeking for new challenges, she proposes new experiences  which allow her to share priviledged moments with her audience. Click here to learn more!


Discover Valerie through her musical performances and funny clips via her YouTube Channel!


WHY SUPPORT THIS PROJECT?

While supporting the ‘Orbis’ colossal project, you encourage more than ten Canadian creators. You also ensure the development of vanguard scenic concepts. The sums collected will allow this original concept to benefit from all the technical support it needs. Then, ‘Orbis’ will be ready to tour Quebec and the world.  

Photo Credits: Frederik Robitaille / Martin Bernier / Timecode Lab

story:
Summary

     My name is Zachary Murdock. I am a singer, poet, and performer based out of Venice, CA and New York City. I've been creating music since I was 11 years old, and have written countless songs – some are inspired by universal themes like love, passion, or heartbreak, others have served to explore my deeper self or meditate on our shared human experience, and most of them make you want to dance with reckless abandon. 

     Throughout my creative journey I've been blessed to collaborate with incredibly talented creators and dream weavers, and my current project, a futuristic soul album entitled, the YOU in me, is no different. I've spent the last 8 months writing with a team of amazing producers and musicians. We are finally nearing the end of that initial phase and eagerly looking forward to the next stage of production, recording and mixing. 

     As the project has taken shape, a lyrical narrative has emerged, one that reflects a path many of us have found ourselves on. A story about discovering ones higher self, while confronting the myriad characters that exist underneath our carefully designed personas. It describes the frustration and terror of accepting yourself, the challenge of finding the phoenix hidden underneath our grief and fear, and dares you to become the person you are meant to be. 

     It's a timeless story told through poetic lyrics, soulful melodies, and genre-bending beats and is being executive produced by Grammy winning composer, Benny Reiner. 

     By donating to this campaign you will help us take the project to an even higher level of sonic quality, as well as portray the story visually through film and artwork, and package a limited physical edition that aesthetically reflects the spirit of the work. The thought of creating a complete, multimedia work fueled by a collective passion and your belief in our vision is a beautiful and inspiring soul rocket that uplifts my entire being. 

TO DOWNLOAD MY LAST PROJECT FOR FREE, CLICK HERE:

https://soundcloud.com/thedreamsofz/sets/for-th...

What We Need & What You Get

OUR GOAL: 

$11,000

WHAT THE MONEY IS FOR: 

$4,000 to record, mix, and master the album. 

$4,000 to film and edit a music video. 

$1,000 to commission the artwork.

$2,000 to print and package a limited physical edition complete with a book of lyrics, artwork, and additional poetry.

The Impact

     the YOU in me carries a powerful message that I believe many people will relate to and find inspiration in. It looks to the future and envisions a time when we are no longer are blinded by colors or stuck at the surface. It is a prayer, a roar, and a symphony of hope, despair and love. 

     As I mentioned, we are well on the way to completing this project, having written most of the album, filmed the first music video, and conceptualized the artwork that will accompany the music. We are by no means waiting for money to bring this dream to life, but are asking for your help giving this fire the oxygen it needs to blaze.  Your contributions will allow us to bring this growing dream to a very real and professional place.

Risks & Challenges

     Anyone that's undertaken the significant effort of creating an entire album knows that the process is susceptible to surprise setbacks and unforeseen obstacles. Throughout my career I have recorded and released nearly a dozen albums (nearly all of them independently), filmed over 25 music videos, and performed around the world. My team and I have perfected the art of making a lot out of a little, gained extensive experience in the studio, and a developed a keen grasp of the creative process. This enables us to anticipate problems and effectively overcome challenges so that your contribution is not wasted.

     Protecting your investment and earning your trust is of the utmost importance to me, and we WILL succeed in our endeavors. 

Other Ways You Can Help

     I know that some people want to support, but just aren't in a position to contribute financially. That's ok! If you'd like to help out in other ways, such as getting the word out please email us at thedreamsofz@gmail.com, and we'll let you know how you can be a part of the team. 

Thank you so very much for your time and financial support. It means everything to me personally, and to the success of this project. 


Campaign video directed by Atif Ekulona

Wild Child video directed by Matthew Charof

story:
HELP US Support the Kawasaki Disease Foundation See the segment EXTRA did on our story. 


Short Summary

My friends, I'm looking for your help to finalize the mixing and mastering of "OPEN YOUR EYES", which is a song I co-wrote posthumously with the late Benjamin Orr. It was from a late 1980s demo slated for the follow up to "The Lace" but remained largely unfinished. In 2011 I was entrusted with the track and spent the next few years honing it. It finally saw the light of day last fall when original Cars member Greg Hawkes and Elliot Easton laid down their magic. Studio drumming legend John "JR" Robinson laid down his parts and co-produced the track with me. The track is to be included on the Kawasaki Disease project, a rare disease my little boy survived. Your donation (with perks) will allow this song to be included and released. I think we made Ben proud. The DHP needs your help paying for the mixing and mastering of the song for release. Without your help the song will sit until we're able to do it.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $500 to finish the mixing and mastering of the song. Please check out the awesome perks we are offering to you for your support and donation.

The Impact

Your contribution helps the Dave Harris Project continue to raise awareness and funding for the Kawasaki Disease Foundation. It's a rare disease my son River survived. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't you can't help:

  • Help us to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Try using the use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
To follow-on from the acclaimed Collocutor debut LP, 'Instead', Tamar (Collocutor) has written 'The Search' and together with her seven piece ensemble and On the Corner Records are currently in the process of finishing the album with the intent of preparing it for release in Autumn 2016. 


Help us bring Collocutor's 'The Search' to life


The goal of this campaign is that with your help we can bring our dream second album to life so that we can build on the momentum and wide reaching support that Collocutor's debut 'Instead' received. Stepping-it-up is of course difficult for such an artistic endeavor, the time of seven professional musicians inhabiting a mostly vintage analogue studio over the course of a week and the subsequent need of a meticulously engineered mix racks up a hefty cost even before On the Corner can move it forward through manufacturing and on to a release campaign.  

To ask for your support, help and involvement we felt it necessary to come up with innovative and uniquely 'Collocutor' packages. We are offering our fans and supporters the chance to join us on this journey by purchasing exclusive mementoes, experiences and limited edition artifacts that we hope you will love.  

In a recent interview with UK Vibe's Michael Edwards, Tamar shed some light on to the new Collocutor album, 'The Search'.

"The album title refers to searching for a better way to exist in the world, but that could be emotional, spiritual or more simply a move to a geographically different place. The last track is called ‘Arrival’ and hopefully suggests something positive for us to aim for in these unsettled times. 
It’s an accidental concept album, the story of a journey. I didn’t start off with the intention of writing an album with a narrative theme, but as the music progressed the compositions naturally fitted together and there seemed to be a continuum between the pieces that developed into this story of a journey with a dark beginning and a hopeful end. 

"Collocutor is an opportunity to explore musically all the cultural connections which are part of being a human being, particularly in the 21st century, in somewhere like London, where you do meet everyone from everywhere. If you’re open-minded you’ll have the opportunity to engage with them and find out which bits of each other’s cultures connect and make sense" – Tamar Osborn


The budget and what your contributions can make happen 

The target of this campaign is around 50% of the project's total cost  (also excluding manufacture of the physical releases).  To cover the cost of recording, mixing and the mastering of 'The Search' we have budgeted as much as we can from our own resources and believe that by offering tangible ways that supporters can contribute in a way that helps us achieve our goal whilst also receiving a perk or package of genuine value. The project is a partnership between Collocutor and On the Corner Records who have together fronted up costs to get things started and will be managing the cost required for manufacture too.  


Help us achieve

The rich sound of 'The Search' could not be possible without the seven immense players, a simple yet homely studio space, a meticulous mix engineer and warm analogue equipment.  By keeping this integrity we're crafting a work of art that will stand up in time, bring you a sense of enjoyment to listeners and hopefully if you're able to support it, will also bring a sense of pride at having contributed to bringing the project to life. We want to build on the global reach that 'Instead' achieved, aim to tour 'The Search' extensively and we hope to become a part of your summer festival experience in 2017 and beyond.


The 'difficult' second album

Tamar (Collocutor) has said that writing the music for 'The Search' was the easy part (not that we believe such modesty), however over the last two years 'Archaic Morning' (Collocutor's debut single) was released and followed shortly by the debut album, 'Instead'. Our goals of having the release on the shelves of Sounds of the Universe, being on Vinyl and getting a play from Gilles Peterson on 6Music were met almost immediately. We didn't expect that over the following months such wide reaching appreciation, from playing London Jazz Festival, Dingwalls and having wonderful things written about the album by Jazzwise, Straight No Chaser, Test Pressing etc we were without doubt quite humbled. 

We have to build on that momentum and do justice to the reputation we've earned, we hope you agree. As mentioned above the hardest part of bringing this artistic vision to life and eventually on shelves, record players and headphones is raising the budget to record and engineer the music in a manner that does it justice. This is the reason we are requesting your help to overcome these challenges in getting our sound heard far and we hope that the perks and exclusives reflect the quality and depth in our live performances and release (both from the Collocutor ensemble and On the Corner). 

A little support can go a long way

If you like what we're doing then we hope that you find a package or perk that appeals to you: if there's not, but you know what you want, then get in touch as we may just be able to provide it. 

We will be adding new packages as we get closer to sending the album off to manufacture and there are developments in the campaign. When we add new perks or the journey moves along we will keep you informed with regular updates and announcements so keep um peeled.

Please share and comment on the campaign across the social media channels or if you know anyone that may dig our sounds and vision remember that everyone is a door and we of course appreciate having the music reach happy ears.

The Indiegogo share tools can be found right here and across all of our social media channels for you to amplify our mission and music (please :)) ! Right you've got this far, you definetly deserve that cuppa.

story:
My name is Danielle Kane and I have been a professional singer, musical theater actress, and vocal instructor for over 35 years. I sing a wide variety of styles including musical theater, cabaret, jazz, pop, rock, folk, opera and inspirational music. From the cathedrals in Europe and theaters to cabaret clubs and recording studios, I have been blessed to be able to perform and live my message through music for my entire adult life.

Deeper Still

The title of my campaign is inspired by the song Deeper Still by Beth Nielsen Chapman. The song reminds us that wherever life takes us-- through sorrows, fears and dreams-- “...you will always have what you gave to love.”

This is a heartfelt evolution, building on my first album, Pure Imagination, and my other inspirational recordings. Deeper Still will be just that – a deeper exploration, an invitation for solace, connection and transformation. If you’re a person who has been touched by grief, and weren’t sure how to work through it, or how to help others who are suffering — this is how you can make a difference.

Your contributions will make this all possible! I am putting my heart and soul into this project, and your contributions will help cover the costs of production of the Deeper Still CD and workshops materials.

The Deeper Still CD is an album of songs that invite you to go deeper past the pain and disappointment that life often brings, to the love that is always present. Beautiful, touching and inspirational, these are the songs that helped comfort and heal me as I journeyed through my own grief. I will be accompanied by some of the Bay Area’s finest musicians for a truly magical experience.

The Deeper Still Workshop is an opportunity to learn how to use singing and sounding in your own life to heal, uplift and connect. We draw upon practices ranging from classical and contemporary vocal techniques, yoga, positive psychology and mind body awareness to create a program that is deep, enjoyable, and effective.

The Deeper Still Concert Experience: living with loss and happiness, has been called transformative. I want to take this to groups who could benefit. With live musicians or tracks, I will share the beautiful songs and chants which helped me through my own journey through dark and light, as well as some singalongs and tunes to rock the house!

All funds raised will go to the creation and maintenance of this project, including Rehearsal Time, Development and Arranging, Vocal Arranging, Studio Musicians, Studio Engineer, Recording/Editing/Mixing, Copyright, Photos, Art/Graphic Design, Postage/Office supplies, ‘Bar coding’, and Duplication.

As a thank-you for your support, I’m sharing a number of gifts, or perks— from signed copies of the CD and a video of concert highlights to voice lessons, an awesome array of house concerts, and customized workshops. I’m particularly excited about the perk of creative prints that will share my favorite singing mantras and life mottos-- like Heart to Heaven and Inhale Happy. 

Your support is greatly appreciated. Any and all contributions will help support my efforts, even if we don’t reach the full goal!

 

Thank You!

story:
Hi.

We're Lion in The Mane and we're coming out with a new record! Our music touches people's lives every day. We asked ourselves how we could do something more this go around. Contributing portions of the proceeds to Autism Speaks gives us a way to help people in more ways than just music. Putting out a record through an online store or streaming site is an easy thing to do. Unfortunately, the band doesn't see much in return for you spending the same amount on our music regardless of where you get it; unless you get it directly from us. This gives you the opportunity to spend the same amount of money on the music (and other cool swag) and gives us both the opportunity to give back!

Here's the skinny.

We have narrowed it down and we will need at least $4,620 to get this record out. Besides covering the costs of sending you all your perks, we plan on shooting a couple music videos, mastering the record at Gateway in Portland, ME by Grammy winning music masterer Adam Ayan, touring this spring on The American Gentlemen Tour, and donating proceeds from each bundle to Autism Speaks. Not to mention paying our lovely artist Laura Merizalde to do our CD cover art, copyrighting the album and getting the album pressed by our great friend Dominic at Oasis Disc Manufacturers. We have lots of work to do, but we are very excited about it.
We have put our heads together and are offering many different perks for donating. We're offering digital downloads of the new record "Echoes in Absence", signed physical copies of the album as well, stickers, t-shirts (specifically for this campaigns) signed drum heads used on The American Gentlemen tour by our very own Johnny Coryn, a signed acoustic guitar used in the acoustic sessions, acoustic sessions where we will play your favorite Lion in The Mane song and send it to you, signed copies of "The Noise War" (our first full length album), dinner with the band, an acoustic show live in your town specially for you, a full on rock show at your house, a guest list for life spot so you never have to worry about paying to come to a Lion in The Mane show. We're also offering hand written lyrics to your favorite Lion in The Mane song. And if you really really want him... Our very own Johnny Coryn will crash on your couch for a month. We do like him, so please return him just as we send him!

What Could go wrong, right?

If the goal is not met, don't fret! We will still be sending out your perks and funding this release by borrowing money from large banks where will find ourselves in incredible debt and have a very hard time getting to come tour in your town! So help us out so we can meet our goal.
Each donation (big or small) is valuable to us because it's one step closer to helping others. Last fall our very own Jon Masters nephew was diagnosed with moderate to severe autism. The band has always played at charities and been actively involved in supporting anti bullying, not texting and driving, the Get up and Move program (you can find a song we did called "I'll come back for you" on iTunes for the Thousand Hours Against Hate charity) but never has the band been directly effected like it was the past two years with Jon's family being at the center of their loved ones diagnosis. More than 200,000 cases of autism arise each year and although there is no cure, treatment often helps. So here's to hope for a cure and becoming more educated, so we can make progress and help put an end to this disorder. 

You really want to help out but don't have the fundage at the moment. Well...

Everyone here at the Lion in The Mane camp are excited and appreciative of the years of support from our friends, fans and families. And remember, if you can't make a donation... There are many ways to help. You can help us out by sharing this link and telling your friends. You can help by educating yourself about autism or joining them on a charitable walk. You can help by spreading the word about the band, coming to a show or just turning up our music. So once again, from the bottom of our hearts. Thank you!

story:
RATEDNXT IS A DIVERSIFIED ONLINE MUSIC PLATFORM THAT REDEFINES HOW MUSIC AND TALENT IS DISCOVERED AND MEASURED.
MISSION:
Our Mission is to provide artist and fans with a musically centered fantasy experience.  The RatedNxt story is fundamentally about transformation - of music discovery, product distribution, talent acquisition, artist-fan interaction, and the reconstruction of revenue generation, and our ability to actively shape our futures in a notoriously challenging industry. Visit http://www.ratednxt.com to learn more. 
THE IMPACT: 
We all know someone who has the talent...but not the opportunity....right?  The RatedNxt music fantasy platform empowers individuals to survive and thrive in a financially burdensome industry. 

  • Utilizing Rated Nxt’s immersive technology, budding musicians are able to gain & interact with fan base, compete with fellow artists for rankings, acquire essential tools for artist development, and generate revenue.

  • Users/Fans can discover new music, download media, interact with artists and through fantasy competition, can challenge friends via “critic contests.”

  • Record labels now have a new arena to discover talent, vet strong/weak musicians and have access to in-depth analytics of the artists public perception within the platform.

JOIN THE ARTISTIC REVOLUTION

No road worth traveling is ever easy....or so the saying goes.  And just like the music industry, we at RatedNxt have obstacles of our own.  The musical talent, fans and critiques exist, but to bring it together we need a shot of adrenaline to get the app off the ground.  That's where you come in.  Being an app for fans and artist, we feel its only right that its birth starts with fans and artists.  

Yes, we can go to iheart, Sony, Apple, or any other media giant, if we wanted....but we'd rather not turn into just another run of the mill, music download forum.  

With a simple goal of $15,000, we can keep our integrity, creativity, and ingenuity that we intend to deliver to our users.

We invite you to join our pre-app-launch community user-base by contributing and signing up with one of the revolutionary user profiles.

As a contributor  - you'll get early access to RatedNxt before it goes live, test the app, and have the ability to provide feedback. This will help us make it the best it can be!

You'll also receive access to full upgrades as the app evolves.


NOT INTERESTED IN JOINING? RatedNxt IS FOR EVERYONE!

We're not all about the money at RatedNxt.  WE LOVE GOSSIP!!!  Tell your friends about us, tell your co-workers and everyone you know about us....bring us up whenever and wherever you can, on Facebook, twitter, instagram, snapchat...whatever your cup of tea is and we can make this thing happen in notime.....it's a musical revolution!

story:
"Seis Octavos" is a musical foundation based on Medellín, Colombia, created to encourage artistic and musical practice in people of all ages as an alternative for the development of human spiritual sensitivity improving the meditation about our lifes with consciousness and creativity.

This crowdfunding campaign is to raise funds for a production of Bach cantata BWV 21 by Fundación Musical Seis Octavos from Medellín and Opera Ensamble from Cali, Colombia, to perform it on the 3rd and 4th of November this year (2016), extending the invitation to Trombonastics (trombones Quartet from Bogotá) and Juliana Velasco (baroque Violin), Johanna Calderón (baroque Cello), Sebastián Vega (Tiorba), Pedro Alcázar (stage director) and Nicolás Ángel-Cubillos (conductor).

The funds will be used to pay the movements for the 42 artists during rehearsal and performance time from August 18th to November 6th, such:

Flights and transportation: USD$4.500

Hotels and feeding: USD$8.500

Supplies and rents: USD$2.000

If you want you can visit our website: www.fundacionseisoctavos.org although is in spanish only.

Your donation to this campaign can be deducted from your taxable income. Please consult your tax professional on how to go about this. 

"We've found that in this search of a common purpose, every artist and even the public can build a strong consciousness of how to work as a team. This purpose, beyond egos and envy, is the pursuit of the very essence of ourselves through art and finding that in this beautiful language of art, everyone is equal, even when there are some difference of knowledge, experience or age, and that makes you try harder to understand how to communicate with each other enhancing our efforts in finding our identity as human beings and our role in this life" - Nicolás Ángel Cubillos

THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!


ABOUT US

We've been doing a concert in November since 2013 when we performed "Membra Jesu nostri patientis Sanctissima" a cycle of cantatas made by the great baroque composer Dieterich Buxtehude, with the support of 4 maestros playing baroque violin, viola da gamba, tiorba and organ, 5 vocal soloists and a chamber choir with a chamber ensemble. The result was amazing. You can watch it here.

In 2014, we played the Theresienmesse from Haydn's last mass cycle (No. 12) with a bigger group of artists including small chamber orchestra formed with young players with timpani, 4 soloists and a 15 singers chamber choir. Click here to watch it.

Last year (2015) we performed the Viola Concert No. 1 from Stamitz and the Fifth Symphony from Schubert's with a full chamber orchestra, always with many students and maestros invited to play with us. 

This year we plan to go further. Inviting friends, maestros and artists, from all over the country to make a staging and play of one of the masterpieces from the great maestro Johann Sebastian Bach: "Ich hatte viel Bekümmernis" (I had much suffering) the cantata BWV 21.

Opera Ensamble (chamber choir / opera singers), baroque Violin and Cello, Tiorba, Trombone's Quartet, 3 vocal soloists and our chamber orchestra.

The BWV 21 is perfect. It's a very deep conversation between the Soul and Jesus: the humanity, sad and anguished within; the hope, love and trust in his Savior. The reconciliation with not only God but with the spiritual importance of the ancient music and the arts in our modern society. 

"I know that we’re dreaming big and sometimes it’s enough to scare everyone but I’m not scared. We need you to be strong enough and share hope to the world. This music we’re doing is also a tool and a purpose. We’re doing it because we believe in human kind, in art and science, and that we can build a better future, more natural, spiritual and with a deep reflexion of our role in this planet. So, every impulse you give us is a proof of that. Join us in this journey" - Nicolás Ángel-Cubillos

Human consciousness has this unique ability to make every activity positive or negative for the development of life in this planet. Positive consciousness can achieve that science, sports or arts do its part on living succesfully, inside and out, with harmony among all of us -living beings-, working together in this natural rythm. It's not an easy task. Take this moment to think about your actions and share with the world the best of the best.

Your actions, small as they can look, can change the world. 

Who is going to make that step that only you can do?

"I'm used to big dreams. I challenge myself with sacrifice, dedication and faith to accomplish my goals. For everyone I have the same answer of the last 15 years: This dream is big enough to make it my whole life. Even when it looks like I'm not working on it, I'm living this dream through every project I'm engaged into and with every person I've met... to make it better, to make them think about their own lifes and jobs and goals. This is a vision of the future we need. You want to share this vision in which our lifes become more significant through the development of a very human spiritual sensitivity? 

A great master told me once: The student of music, the artist, must understand that our jobs aren't jobs, not merely everyday activities. Art is our own life and you must take it seriously like the apostle. That's the reason why I'm doing this: to understand that life is more that the activity you're doing while breathing and eating, and art is our deep, true, natural language" - Nicolás Ángel Cubillos



More pics on www.fundacionseisoctavos.org/multimedia
story_txt:
"Seis Octavos" is a musical foundation based on Medellín, Colombia, created to encourage artistic and musical practice in people of all ages as an alternative for the development of human spiritual sensitivity improving the meditation about our lifes with consciousness and creativity.This crowdfunding campaign is to raise funds for a production of Bach cantata BWV 21 by Fundación Musical Seis Octavos from Medellín and Opera Ensamble from Cali, Colombia, to perform it on the 3rd and 4th of November this year (2016), extending the invitation to Trombonastics (trombones Quartet from Bogotá) and Juliana Velasco (baroque Violin), Johanna Calderón (baroque Cello), Sebastián Vega (Tiorba), Pedro Alcázar (stage director) and Nicolás Ángel-Cubillos (conductor).The funds will be used to pay the movements for the 42 artists during rehearsal and performance time from August 18th to November 6th, such:Flights and transportation: USD$4.500Hotels and feeding: USD$8.500Supplies and rents: USD$2.000If you want you can visit our website: www.fundacionseisoctavos.org although is in spanish only.Your donation to this campaign can be deducted from your taxable income. Please consult your tax professional on how to go about this. "We've found that in this search of a common purpose, every artist and even the public can build a strong consciousness of how to work as a team. This purpose, beyond egos and envy, is the pursuit of the very essence of ourselves through art and finding that in this beautiful language of art, everyone is equal, even when there are some difference of knowledge, experience or age, and that makes you try harder to understand how to communicate with each other enhancing our efforts in finding our identity as human beings and our role in this life" - Nicolás Ángel CubillosTHANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!ABOUT USWe've been doing a concert in November since 2013 when we performed "Membra Jesu nostri patientis Sanctissima" a cycle of cantatas made by the great baroque composer Dieterich Buxtehude, with the support of 4 maestros playing baroque violin, viola da gamba, tiorba and organ, 5 vocal soloists and a chamber choir with a chamber ensemble. The result was amazing. You can watch it here.In 2014, we played the Theresienmesse from Haydn's last mass cycle (No. 12) with a bigger group of artists including small chamber orchestra formed with young players with timpani, 4 soloists and a 15 singers chamber choir. Click here to watch it.Last year (2015) we performed the Viola Concert No. 1 from Stamitz and the Fifth Symphony from Schubert's with a full chamber orchestra, always with many students and maestros invited to play with us. This year we plan to go further. Inviting friends, maestros and artists, from all over the country to make a staging and play of one of the masterpieces from the great maestro Johann Sebastian Bach: "Ich hatte viel Bekümmernis" (I had much suffering) the cantata BWV 21.
Opera Ensamble (chamber choir / opera singers), baroque Violin and Cello, Tiorba, Trombone's Quartet, 3 vocal soloists and our chamber orchestra.

This music we’re doing is also a tool and a purpose. So, every impulse you give us is a proof of that. Join us in this journey" - Nicolás Ángel-Cubillos

Your actions, small as they can look, can change the world.

"I'm used to big dreams. I challenge myself with sacrifice, dedication and faith to accomplish my goals. For everyone I have the same answer of the last 15 years: This dream is big enough to make it my whole life. Even when it looks like I'm not working on it, I'm living this dream through every project I'm engaged into and with every person I've met... to make it better, to make them think about their own lifes and jobs and goals. This is a vision of the future we need. You want to share this vision in which our lifes become more significant through the development of a very human spiritual sensitivity? 
A great master told me once: The student of music, the artist, must understand that our jobs aren't jobs, not merely everyday activities. Art is our own life and you must take it seriously like the apostle. story:
My name is Petra, and I'd like to introduce you to the Petra Jarrar Band.

We are based out of the West Village in New York City and play my original music. For years, I performed acoustically at dive bars all throughout New York. However, I desired to find a new way to present my music to audiences, and decided to get a band together. I met Alaska (lead guitar), Matt (keyboard), Aron (bass), and Justin (drums) at The New School- while we met by random chance, we all had one thing in common - our love for live performance.

Over the past four months, we had the pleasure of gracing the stages of Webster Hall, Melrose Ballroom, The Delancey, DROM, The Bitter End, Silvana, and other various, fantastic venues throughout New York City. Live performance is something our band adores. For us, there is absolutely no greater feeling than getting up on a stage, playing music, and having the audience dance and sing along to our music. As a band, our biggest goal has been to go on a world tour- and finally, the opportunity to do so has presented itself. 

This September, our band was invited to perform at the Kansai Music Conference in Japan. On top of this wonderful invitation, we are also going to be touring the country and performing in cities such as Tokyo, Kyoto, Osaka, and Kobe from September 10th to 18th. We never imagined that we would be given the opportunity to travel abroad  this early on in our careers and play our music for audiences overseas. It's mind boggling and exciting, and we all feel so lucky for this opportunity. However, there is ONE major roadblock that is preventing us from going to Japan!

We need approximately $10,000 to cover all costs and expenses for our tour in Japan.

This money will cover round trip flights to Japan for all five of us, train fares, other forms of transportation, hotel rooms, food, tour manager costs, venue booking costs, audio/visual recording expenses, band merchandise (t-shirts, mugs, hats, etc), and physical CDs of our performances of my music.

One of the reasons why the costs are so high for our tour is due to the fact that we are independent musicians. None of us are backed by a label, manager or investor- that's something we pride ourselves on. We love having creative freedom as artists. Yet, when it comes to planning a world tour on a scale like this, our goals seem impossible. That's where you come in!

If you were to fund our campaign, not only will you be giving us the chance of a lifetime, but you will be giving independent artists a chance to make it in the music industry. Finding opportunities to perform at the Kansai Music Conference and tour in Japan are hard to come by. Artists like ourselves gain significant experience from performing live, especially abroad. Japan is a country known for its appreciation for live performance, and this trip will not just help us grow as individuals, but as artists. Although this tour seemed like a shot in the dark for us, we wanted to take the chance with sharing our story and running this IndieGoGo campaign to pursue what we love the most.

When you donate to our campaign, we will be giving back to you as well! We have 7 funky perk packages with personalized gifts, live audio, and video footage from Japan, cool band merchandise, and exclusive up close and behind the scenes footage of our trip abroad.

SPREAD THE WORD! Share this campaign with your friends, whether it is through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or even email! Anything you or your friends can donate to our trip will benefit our trip to Japan. When sharing our campaign, be sure to include the hashtag, #petrabandtakesjapan. This is our official hashtag for our entire tour. Stay up to date on all our adventures by searching for this hashtag on your social media.

We truly hope you can help us make our dreams come true. Thanks for stopping by!


Stay Glamorous, 
Petra, Alaska, Aron, Matt, and Justin

story:
Short Summary

  • STARBREAKERS is a multi-level live concert showcase strategized as an innovative music discovery platform.  Comprised as a digital convergence of TV, radio, film and streaming design, it offers a new experience in entertainment with emerging artists provided with global promotion, consul and a non-traditional road to stardom.


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • STARBREAKERS - The Ultimate Showcase will stage its' event initially in Atlanta.  The entire production will consist of live performances, television taping and networking.  In association and accompaniment will be terrestrial radio station, WIGO 1570AM Mbodymentradio and STUDIO 21, all listed below.  The on-going ripple effect will be initiated by specialized radio shows(internet & terrestrial), podcasts, a family of TV networks (internet, traditional, cable) for the televised program, Atlanta In Concert, consul and sales support; the end result being breaking an artist one-by-one.  Remarkably, it will take only one artist/song to break to change the entire paradigm.  Your $1 aids in achieving this campaign.
  • Naturally, we will not turn down larger donations if one so desires and we will offer surprise perks ranging from autographed CDs, T-Shirts, Patron shout-outs on the radio or TV shows up to a VIP entry to one of the shows in Atlanta.
  • In the event the full campaign goal is not reached it will aid in a continuation of promotion at a lesser pace, but still very effective considering that most independent projects attempt to thrive on a zero budget.  

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Can we break the music industry stronghold with $1.  Of course.  It is with your insight, the joy of discovering new music plus your displeasure of hearing the same 10 songs over-and-over again and taking the opportunity to do something about it.  
  • Our youth along with the millennials make up the new mass audience.  An audience now too large to ignore.  A generation who not only want to expose the status-quo but change it.  There is no law dictating that Hollywood should control the entertainment industry forever.  The entertainment world is too large to confine to one stage.  And lastly, why are we so grossly underrepresented by stations we so heavily support?  
  • Countdown: those days are over.  As a collective, your each $1 sends a message that change is here.  Your $1 will create a more level playing field, develop an alternative to existing content-creation and distribution systems (a new world of choice.) Your $1 exercises digital engagement for the consumer and persistent presence for the artists.  Your $1 will insulate programming from political pressure and marketplace forces.  Once you go galactic...you never go back.

Risks & Challenges

  • The only challenge faced is the same one all independent productions face: the lack of promotional funding that will establish an equalization to corporate media. Your collective $1 will aid in a unprecedented volume of exposure for those talents who may never be heard unless promoted through a major label or corporate media.  
  • STARBREAKERS transcends and circumvents the usual blockades as it recognizes visibility and recognition are essential in the development of an independent artist.  Created is a solid approach to publicity and public relations.  Designed as a disruptive force creating a demand and a personal link to the artists and their products.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • We truly understand that some cannot for various reasons cannot contribute, but that doesn't mean that you can't help.  Please spread the word (every click sends a message) and use Indiegogo share tools.  
    • Below are listed all the ways you may also help.

    Listed below are links and sites of our team.  Tune in, listen, view and spread the word for others to check out the upward movement of this program.

    www.America2Broadcasting.com * Our main outlet * needs update technical expense

    Follow us on: https://www.instagram.com/StarbreakersTV

    Follow us on: https://twitter.com/STARBREAKERS2

    Subscribe to: www.youtube.com/atlantainconcert 

    www.Studio21media.com 

    http://mbodymentradio.com

    http://iconosquare.com/yowhatsgood_ga

    https://www.reverbnation.com/mzchevy

    https://www.reverbnation.com/lyvationentertainment

    Support with a $.99 cent download - our first compilation

    STARBREAKERS Presents - ATL The Corner of Rhythm & Bling

    www.cdbaby.com/cd/starbreakers

story:
Welcome to Happy Hour

So here’s the news… I am this close to releasing my next album! I love the way it sounds, and I can’t wait to share it with you.

Nils has done an amazing job producing and helping me with the song writing. He has produced a virtual string of Billboard Top 20’s. Honestly, I think this record has some of his best work. And mine!

Here are some of the things people are saying:

"He's 'Plan A' whenever you can!  A superb, classically trained saxophonist, he wears melodies like second skins. Tunes with TEETH!" – Trish Hennessey, Hybrid Jazz Radio

"Charley Langer has nailed it with his latest release Happy Hour, as far as original and melodic grooves go. With great horn arrangements and a large overall presence, the album grabbed me from the first notes and wouldn't let go!" – Ronald Jackson, The Smooth Jazz Ride

"Happy Hour certainly lives up to its name!! An exciting selection of great tunes from Charley and a top selection of supporting musicians. Initial favourites include 'That Certain Feeling' and 'Big Sur,' but the whole album hits the spot!! An exciting addition to the playlist and highly recommended!" – Richard Edwards, SmoothGrooves Radio UK

This is my first time involving fans in the process of releasing my music. Why do it? Because I need some help (obviously). But more importantly, I have participated as a fan in other musical projects, and it’s fun! You’re going to get a behind-the-scenes look into my musical life, and a chance to get some cool stuff that the general public is never going to see. And every backer gets an early download of the entire album. NOTE: the download link will be emailed to you within 24 hours -- that’s way before the album release, expected early February 2017.

I have named the album Happy Hour because it’s a virtual happy hour, sans food and drink (you supply your own). This is a very fun, danceable, and distinctively happy collection of music. Please join Nils and me for Happy Hour!

What I Need & What You Get

Record labels spend millions of dollars on artwork, manufacturing, advertising, publicity, radio promotion, etc. I plan to do it all for only $7,500. But we could knock this one out of the park with $12,000!

I've already done the heavy lifting. The music is done. This album is going to be released even if I don't raise another cent. But the effect that this album can have is soooo much bigger if you help!

What you probably don't realize is that I am doing this for you. I constantly get emails asking me when I'm coming to New York, or Chicago, or Denver, or [name your city]. The truth is, to do that kind of touring requires venue owners who are willing to take a risk on me. And they are not going to do that for someone they have never heard of. Radio promotion and advertising can make the difference.

And, in the process of helping me, you have some fun opportunities! First of all, every backer gets an immediate digital download of the album. But you could also get:

  • Signed CDs and other exclusive memorabilia
  • Your name in the liner notes
  • A personalized birthday video for you or a friend
  • Time with me on Skype or FaceTime
  • A cover of a favorite song that I've recorded especially for you
  • Dinner with me and Nils
  • A picture painted and signed by me (I'm pretty good with a paint brush)
  • Maybe a concert in your own living room!

And if I don't make my goal, I'll use whatever is raised to promote the heck out of this album.

The Risk...?

...well... you have none! You're going to get the digital download and whatever exclusive items you've paid for! My risk is: I might feel a little red-faced if I don't get a hit song from this album. But I can handle it. Humility is a good thing. And I'm not doing this for me anyway. I'm doing it for you.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Others of you might want to do a bit extra! Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out! They are at the upper right of this page and look like this:

Thank you! I hope you enjoy Happy Hour!

Other Ways You Can Help
Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Others of you might want to do a bit extra! Please use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out! They are at the upper right of this page and look like this:

Thank you! I hope you enjoy Happy Hour!

story:
Short Summary

Hi,

My name is Andrew Davis. iIf you're here then I'm pretty sure you may know who I am and how passionate I am about wanting to be a great musician. Since 2007, "Andrew Davis has forever been served playing to his own drum." - Brandon Caldwell, Houston Press. I reached out to my friend Sean Padilla in August about setting up a tour for me to run in NOV. I was in a dark space financially; being fired from Public Storage for a last strike offense of being on my phone on the floor; although I was clocked out for lunch I wasn't given a chance to explain. Yes, back then I predicted that I would be out of the financial struggle of job security by NOV. I have since been hired as a bank teller part time and have been working there for a little over a month.  I am extremely blessed and grateful to my job for allowing me to take the time off. Working part time, my 20hrs a week isn't enough to cover tour production costs as well as rent for NOV. So i did the right thing and went ahead and put aside my rent money and as I look at the rental car costs realize that i need a miracle to pull through for me to be able to get off the ground for the tour.

This is why I am asking for your help. Something, perhaps family, will come through for me to secure the rental car costs before I leave; I need you to support financially so that by the time the indie go go campaign is over the payout will be in enough time for me to stay afloat while on tour. Your support is instrumental to the launch and survival of the tour.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Rental car costs range between $600-$750; I've driven to New York and back before so I am estimating gas to be around $300. I'm not tripping on food though I should be lol. Stacking up on lots of peanut butter and trying to get Per Diems from venues; little to no success.
  • Your donations will not go without reward. I am manufacturing Sweaters, Hats, and 4GB USB drives filled with content (entire discography, pics, and vids). People that donate in cities I play will be able to pull up to the show for free.
  • If I do not reach my goal the money raised will go straight towards gas.

The Impact

  • There's a part, while i'm building my indie go go campaign, that asks me to describe to you all why this is important to the world. I can say whole heartedly that I hope this inspires people to realize wen they need help and to not be afraid or too proud to reach out. Pride is a real thing I have to overcome and I'm thankful for the ability to make strides towards that.
  • This is my first time touring a string of shows as such. In the past i've played pop up shows in different cities but never to this magnitude; so I am excited about new challenges .

Risks & Challenges

  • If you're a spiritual person please offer some blessings for safe travel. Accepting all forms of prayer and meditative vibes. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • If you know anyone with the rent a car plug please email theaspiringme@icloud.com
  • Please share the campaign using the IndieGoGo share tools!

Keep up with the tour schedule here http://theaspiringme.tumblr.com/tour

story:
A group of songwriters from Glasgow, Scotland with a common vision and outlook on life have been collaborating for around 4 years experimenting with different ideas and sounds, trying to form a way to express this within a coherent narrative. This is the overall idea behind the creation of the album. Though as we have been financing it all ourselves we would really appreciate contributions that would help us pay for studio time, make physical copies of the tracks and the artwork and help with any additional fees. 

Our friend and musical companion AJ Meadows of Starship Nicola wrote a little about each of the members of the band while we were working with him over the last two years, also here's a link to music we recorded with him :

http://www.starshipnicola.com/

http://starshipnicola.bandcamp.com/

If you like the sound of what you've heard here perhaps you would like to donate. Though if you can't contribute financially, sharing the page will really help us to reach more people and achieve our goal.

Thank you kindly,

H&H

story:
Summary

The songs on this CD are truly world music, combining traditional and modern flamenco with elements of Brazilian jazz and Middle Eastern music. They represent our current repertoire, so audiences who hear us on tour will be able to take our sounds home.

The music is ready to go, so we need your help to generate funds to complete the project. We've already completed our initial studio sessions at Brokenworks Studios in Ashland, OR on October 7-9. We have more sessions coming up October 21-22 and beyond. We've carefully estimated all of our costs for recording, mixing, CD duplication, artwork, and packaging - all the nuts and bolts stuff that goes into making a quality product.

Let's break it down in more detail for you. We're aiming to raise $10,700. This will cover $3,600 in recording, mixing, and mastering sessions; $3,400 in duplication and packaging costs; and $1,500 in art and layout fees. Our sound engineer is the highly skilled Sean McCoy of Oregon Sound (oregonsound.com) in Ashland. We're working with discmakers.com for packaging, fretless bassist extraordinaire Randy Tico from Santa Barbara, and a very talented artist in Spain named Julian Lorenzo for the artwork and layout. (He's also a flamenco guitarist, singer, and professional skateboarder.) We are also recording with percussionist Terry Longshore and dancer Elena Villa, who have appeared often with Flamenco Pacifico on stage. The fee for the extra artists on our project will come to $2,200, and we're very happy to be supporting them as part of our efforts as well.

We want you to know, we're not asking you all to pay for the whole project. The numbers above are our best estimate for basic costs for an album that will most likely cost $15,000.  If you help us get started with the basic costs, we'll cover the rest, no matter what it takes to get you a fantastic album!

We're happy to offer several perks for whatever level you'd like to contribute. You can pre-purchase your CD (plus shipping) or download cards. You can get signed CDs and guitar lessons over Skype or personal dance lessons. You can be be given credit as a producer on the CD. You can sign up for a private house concert, all the way from solo guitar to a quartet show. You can even fund visits by the troupe to your favorite schools!

The Impact

The world needs more original, deep art! You'll be helping us fund a lifetime of musical study and creation to distill it into a product that will move and inspire people. All of us in Flamenco Pacifico are earnest artists and hardworking professionals who perform and teach on a regular basis and make their livelihoods from their passions. Berto Boyd, Grant Ruiz, and Terry Longshore have all recorded successful CDs in the past and believe this unique collaboration will stand out.

Integrity is very important to us, and we look forward to fulfilling each and every one of the perks listed in this campaign as an expression of our passion and gratitude.

Risks & Challenges

There's always a risk that a project won't be completed or completed to satisfaction; however, we put months into preparation and pre-production for this album. These pieces are tried and true. We've played them in concert many times in large venues and have polished them, so we are confident that we will complete the recording process on time and have a quality product to share. We have two CD release concerts scheduled at the Majestic Theater in Corvallis, OR January 27-28, so you can BET we're motivated!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some folks may not be able to help us financially at this point, but anything you can do to get the word out would be much appreciated. Check out our website at flamencopacifico.com, "like" us on Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/FlamencoPacifico/). If you have any friends who are interested in flamenco, let them know about us and our CD project! Email, text, tweet, message, carrier pigeon, smoke signals, whatever it takes.

We're very proud of our school residency perk, so if you know anybody involved in school music programs or funding them, please let them know about us as well. Thanks!

story:
My Sophomore EP

This next record is a follow up to my last EP "Seasons". Entitled "Room for Love"

My name is Sarah Petrella and I am a songwriter born and raised in Southern California. Music has been a HUGE part of my life ever since I was a very little girl. I love being able to witness my own self grow and evolve through my music but most of all I love sharing it with all of you!

I have come a long way over the last few years. I have written and recorded a lot of tunes. But SO much goes into making an album. Producing, mixing, mastering, the musicians, the artwork, the printing, the marketing and the promotion. I am very close to finishing this next EP but I need your help to finish it off.

YOU are the Record Label

I have already funded a large portion of this next EP on my own. I have recorded many of the songs already, but still have a lot to do. This is my FIRST campaign and my very first time asking for help from fans. Being able to use a platform like IndieGoGo allows me to have the artistic freedom of an independent artist while allowing the people that support my music to act as my Record Label.

Where the Money Goes

  • Firstly, I will be filming my music video for the title track "Room For Love". I have a plan for the video and it is going to be incredible. Just need the funds to make it a reality. Budgeted 3k
  • Finish recording the final tracks. Musicians. Mixing. Mastering. Budgeted 2k
  • Next I need to distribute the EP online and print the physical copies. Budgeted 2k
  • Merchandise Budget $500
  • Advertising/Promotion Budgeted 2k
  • Indie Go Go Fee percentage $500

I have so many fun gifts for you to choose from for being apart of this journey with me!

If I don't reach the goal I am asking for, I will have to trim down on my plans but will still make this project come to life. If I exceed the goal I am asking for I will be able to fund as much promotion as possible. Either way, if you donate, this music will be in your hands no matter what!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you aren't in a position to help financially right now. But your support alone means SO much. So please share, share, share with everyone you know who may be interested in helping me. Share on social media, call your friends on the phone personally and encourage them to donate, every little bit of that helps.

I CAN NOT WAIT TO BRING YOU MORE MUSIC!!

story:
Short Summary

I am a singer/songwriter. I believe in writing authentic, raw, and honest songs ESPECIALLY for myself as an artist. I've lived in Nashville for 12 years now and I've always been a writer, as far back as I can remember there was always a notebook of some kind with me or close by. I love what I do and I don't believe that age or background or anything should ever hold someone back from pursuing their dreams....which leads us HERE!!! 

 

What I Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise $15,000. This would cover studio fees, musicians, producer, any overages, Product duplication, album photo shoot. It also leaves a small cushion for any incidentals not specifically budget for (kinda like building a house :)

If we surpass the goal, I may even be able to have proper merchandising and maybe even release another single to radio again, which would make my heart incredibly happy.  :)

As you might guess, getting off the ground and making a record is an expensive endeavor. I have exhausted all that my own personal budget will allow at this point.

That's where you come in. I've come up with a few ways for you to get involved. It could be as simple as helping me spread the word, or pre-ordering your very own shirt or CD. If you are feeling really generous and want to go all out you can spring for one of the higher end options. I'm hoping that each of these items is guaranteed to please even the most discriminating of crowd funders. Come hang out at a recording session, or have dinner with me, get a mix tape or a one on one vocal lesson or cowrite with me! Along with a few other social items including my book "Love, IZZ", signed lyrics and more.

Thank you in advance.....

This project can not happen without you, and I am humbled by that. If you can't help financially, please consider sharing it with your friends and family! Let's make a record shall we?!?!?!

 

I love you ALL!!!!!

Love

Vickie Raye
