story:
Short Summary

Through devastating and life threatening injuries, to life changing struggles, Scooter Pearce has always had one goal: To share her life and experience with others through music. And for decades she has done just that. However now she needs your help to keep that mission alive.

  • She has recorded and mastered a new set of songs in Austin Texas, and Mixed and Mastered in Nashville to release as a limited EP.
  • However funds for CD production are not there. 
  • This is where you can help, but not for free, no that's not Scooter's style. She wants to make sure you get what you pay for. 

What We Need & What You Get

With that in mind:

  • We need a total of $3000 to make this dream a reality. This money will be used for the production of CDs as well as merchandising to sell at shows and in the online marketplace. Roughly $2000 is needed to produce CDs with a beautiful cover and booklet. The rest will go strictly to production of T-Shirts, pins, stickers and other Scooter branded apparel.
  • $10 dollar pledge= Copy of new EP
  • $25 dollar pledge=Signed copy of new EP
  • $50 dollar pledge=Signed copy of new Ep as well as a personalized thank you included in CD booklet!
  • $75 dollar pledge=Signed copy of new Ep, Personalized thank you in booklet, and Scooter Pearce T-Shirt(Design in progress)
  • IF on the chance we don't reach our goal, rest assured that the funds raised will still go strictly to production of the CDs and everyone who pledged will still receive their pledge level gift, added time may simply be needed.

The Impact

Everydollar raised would make an enormous impact on the project's viability. With CD production and Merchandise costing as much as they do, without the help of your contributions it may be another year before We are able to reserve the funds needed on our own.

  • This EP will contain previously unreleased songs such as "Let it Rain," and "Grace of Angels." Songs that have only been available at live performances.
  • Your contributions will help Scooter get the wider recognition she deserves as well as the increased fan base she works so hard to make a connection with.

Risks & Challenges

The best part of this project is simply that there is no risk. All of the songs are already, mixed and mastered and ready for production. So the only challenge will be if the goal is not met. In which case we will extend the fundraising drive once, if the goal is still not met then we will use other methods: concerts, other crowdfunding campaigns, and grassroots fundraising to keep trying to get this album made.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you are just unable to contribute, no worries. We know times are tough for everyone. If you could just share this page to as many people as you can we would be eternally grateful.
  • Indiegogo even has a variety of ways to share this so any help with word of mouth is incredibly appreciated!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hey everyone! 

I hope you enjoyed my first solo release 'ElectriGuitartistry'.  Here are some samples of my new record 'Fire Dance'


I believe the songs on 'Fire Dance' represent the best writing of my career, and it has been a dream of mine to release them on a limited-editing double-LP vinyl set.  For this to happen, I need your help. 

What We Need & What You Get

We've been diligently working through pre-production for over a year now, and we have all ten songs tracked and roughly mixed.  The biggest hurdle, of course, is funding everything that comes along with making a full length record.

I've worked closely with a bunch of incredible people including Lars Daugaard (Drums & Mixing) and Henrik Bjoern (Bass), just to name a few.  Now, we need your help to finish mixing and mastering the songs and create the packaging for both the CD and a limited-editing numbered double-LP vinyl set.  

The Impact

We're putting the power in YOUR hands.  You now play an integral role in how we make music.

Let's make this record huge and join us with your support behind it!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't scoop up one of our perks?  It's all good.  Help us spread the word about this campaign by sharing the link, telling your friends, and ultimately assisting us in reaching our goal!
story_txt:
Hey everyone! I hope you enjoyed my first solo release 'ElectriGuitartistry'.  Here are some samples of my new record 'Fire Dance'



I believe the songs on 'Fire Dance' represent the best writing of my career, and it has been a dream of mine to release them on a limited-editing double-LP vinyl set.  For this to happen, I need your help. 

What We Need & What You GetWe've been diligently working through pre-production for over a year now, and we have all ten songs tracked and roughly mixed.  The biggest hurdle, of course, is funding everything that comes along with making a full length record.I've worked closely with a bunch of incredible people including Lars Daugaard (Drums & Mixing) and Henrik Bjoern (Bass), just to name a few.  Now, we need your help to finish mixing and mastering the songs and create the packaging for both the CD and a limited-editing numbered double-LP vinyl set.  The ImpactWe're putting the power in YOUR hands.  You now play an integral role in how we make music.Let's make this record huge and join us with your support behind it!Other Ways You Can HelpCan't scoop up one of our perks?  It's all good.  Help us spread the word about this campaign by sharing the link, telling your friends, and ultimately assisting us in reaching our goal!

story:
Who Are We?

YoungStar Radio is an internet radio station designed for kids to promote their talents. Where aspiring students can showcase their Music, Artwork & Poetry.

YSR will be broadcasting quality programming. The station, compromised with 10 volunteer DJs and staff, it is run by kids for kids and listener supported, through charitable donations.

The young hosts 7-17 will discuss food, fashion, social events, musical artists and book reviews to name a few things.

What is our goal for this project?

As an Internet broadcaster, in some respects YoungStar Radio reaches the world better than we do our own back yard.  Internet radio IS the future of local radio and we are actually ahead of the game by a few years.  This is why we wish to be a model for how community-based Internet broadcasters can serve their communities.

We are positively You can support this creative radio movement today by helping us pull together the legally-mandated equipment we need to put our radio on the air for the community and give dozens of DJs the tools they need to make great radio for you.

Our goal is to immerse the kids in the community with community events (ex. monthly birthday parties for foster kids, annual back to school concerts)

What we will be able to do with the funds raised?

We will be able to remodel the station, we're hoping to create a place that not only attracts but develops the best and brightest DJs and musical young guests, comics that kids radio has to offer, all the while providing our listeners with the original and creative programming the world will come to love us. But we can't do this without you!

Your donation will go directly towards these necessary expenses:

  • A new soundproof broadcasting booth $1,700
  • Station Access $2,200
  • Marketing & Advertising $900
  • Computers $1,200
  • Coaxial Cables $300
  • Furniture $500 (that will allow for proper seating both in the booth and the station
  • Mixing Console (used) $2,000
  • Vacuum $70 (that will help keep our new carpet clean)
  • Merchandise $600 (exclusive YSR merchandise that we can provide our devoted listeners!
  • Acoustic Foam $499
  • First & Last Month's Rent (studio) $1200

Other Ways You Can Help

We know everyone can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

story:
Origins

- Who We Are, and Our Mission

The J-MUSIC Ensemble was once just a humble idea based on a passion for Japanese music, and a dream to bring new ideas based on it to the world. Influences from games such as Sonic the Hedgehog, Pokemon, and Final Fantasy, anime such as Cowboy Bebop and Naruto, and J-Pop artists like Perfume and Utada Hikaru were the context for this dream. Three years ago at the Manhattan School of Music, the band became a reality, and pure joy and happiness overcame every rehearsal and school performance we had - we were exploring our favorite songs, as well as new ones, and finding ways to get deeper into this music. However, after leaving the nest of college, the "real world" hit hard, and pressures to get serious about the presentation of our music became realized. It was time for us to get these songs recorded, and eventually released to reach more people who shared the same love as us - but we soon came to understand that this was not going to be easy.

始まり

- 僕たちについて - 僕たちの使命について


J-MUSIC Ensemble は元々は日本の音楽への情熱に基づくほんのアイディアで、その新しいアイディアを発表するという夢に過ぎませんでした。この夢の背景には、ソニック・ザ・ヘッジホッグ、ポケモン、ファイナルファンタジーといったゲーム、カウボーイ・ビバップや Naruto といったアニメ、また Perfume や宇多田ヒカルといった J-Popの影響がありました。このバンドは、3年前にマンハッタン音楽学校で現実のものとなり、純粋な喜びと幸せがあらゆるリハーサル、学内パフォーマンスで満ち溢れました。僕たちのお気に入りの曲を探し、この音楽をより深く理解する方法を追求いていました。しかしながら、大学を出て、現実社会に直面し、僕たちの音楽を本気で社会に打ち出していくためのプレッシャーに気がつきました。これらの曲をレコーディングし、発売して、僕たちと同じ情熱を持つより多くの人たちに僕たちの音楽を届けること、それは決して簡単なことではないと気がついたのです。



Journey

- Costs, Risks, and Perks

We were able to scrap our money together from previous shows and get into a reasonable studio. However, there were other costs that we needed to be aware of. On top of studio costs, mixing costs, and mastering costs, there were also licensing fees - money paid to publishing companies and copyright holders for permission to record and release this music legally. These costs aren't always concrete, and are usually based on certain criteria defined either by the industry or the copyright holders themselves - and without paying them, we can run into serious legal trouble that would hinder us from producing any more music. These fees are super important to us, because this is the only real way we can pay respect to the composers and artists that have affected us so deeply since childhood. 

Mixing - $1000
Mastering - $800
Physical CD Distribution - $1000
Album Artwork/Design ~ $300
Licensing Fees ~ $500-800
Publicity and Promotion ~ $2,500
It is because of these incredible costs, and our current difficulty in producing these funds at our current stage, that we ask for your help in bringing this album to life. We are extremely grateful for our friends and family, and in return for your help, we'll give you some amazing things to take home with you (or download)! We'd also like you to know that ANY contribution you make will get your name on our "J-MUSIC Alliance Team Wall" on our website, making you an official member of the J-MUSIC Alliance!

Perks start at $1, and by doing so, you already get your name on our J-MUSIC Alliance Team Wall! Moving up between $5 - $50, you get prizes including free stickers, discounted pre-orders, T-shirts, signed CDs, and more! There are rewards at every level, because we really want you to know how much we appreciate your help.

旅路

- 費用、リスク、特典


僕たちは過去のショーからのお金をかき集めて、リーズナブルなレコーディングスタジオに入ることができました。しかしながら、他の諸々のコストに気がつきます。スタジオ費用に加え、ミキシング費用、マスタリング費用、そしてライセンス料(この音楽を合法的に録音、発売する許可を得るために出版社や著作権保持者に支払うお金)です。ライセンス料は常に具体的ではありませんが、音楽業界または著作権保持者自身によって決められたある基準に基づいています。そしてこれを支払わなければ、今後一切音楽の制作活動ができなくなるという重大な法的問題へと発展します。この料金は僕たちにとって、ものすごく大切です。なぜなら、これが僕たちに子供の頃から絶大な影響を与えてきた作曲家やアーティストへの敬意を払う唯一の本当の方法だからです。

ミキシング - $1000 (約 10 万円)
マスタリング - $800 (約8万円)
CD 流通 - $1000 (約10万円)
アルバムカバーデザイン - $300 (約3万円)
ライセンス料 - $500-800 (約5万〜8万円)
宣伝、プロモーション- $2,500 (約25万円)

これらの莫大な費用、そしてこれらの資金を生み出すのが困難である僕たちの現状から、このアルバムを世に送り出すためにあなたのご協力をお願いしたいと思っています。僕たちの友達や家族に非常に感謝し、支援いただいた方々には、素晴らしいものを持って帰って(ダウンロードして)いただき、恩返しをしたいと思っています。また、貢献をしてくださった全ての方のお名前は僕たちのウェブサイトの“J-MUSIC アライアンス・チーム・ウォール”に刻ませていただき、J-MUSIC アライアンスのオフィシャル・メンバーになっていただけます。

特典は1ドル(約100円)から始まり、1ドル(約100円)の貢献をいただくだけでもあなたのお名前は J-MUSIC アライアンス・チーム・ウォールに刻まれます!さらに5ドル(約500円)〜50ドル(約5000円)になると、シールや、イベントの発売前チケットのディスカウント、T シャツ、サイン入り CD などなど、特典が盛り沢山!僕たちがあなたのヘルプにどれだけ感謝しているかを知ってもらいたいのです!

Continuum

- The Impact, Giving Back

Your help in this campaign does a lot more than just help us release our album - you're helping us serve as an example for the future. Most of us in the band come from situations where music was not the first thing pushed as a career option; combine that with an already skewed and negative view on video games and Japanese anime, and you have a recipe for seriously low motivation in a child's artistic dreams, and their development. While we were able to push through by ourselves, and with the encouragement of mentors, there are others who may be feeling the same way about their favorite alternate interests and don't have a platform to express those interests. We want to eventually build communities for those even younger than us to learn about music, how to play music, and how to mold their dreams into a reality. They'll be able to learn how to combine a knowledge of music with an interest in video games, anime, and pop culture in order to turn an otherwise innocent, hidden interest into potentially the greatest art our future can hold.

続き

- 影響力、還元

このキャンペーンにおけるあなたのご協力は、僕たちのアルバムのリリースを助けるだけではありません。 あなたは、未来のための実例となることを支えることとなります。  バンドメンバーのほとんどが、ビデオゲームや日本のアニメに対する歪んだネガティヴな意見とも合わさり、キャリアの選択において音楽が一番に持ってこられない状況を経験してきました。そしてあなたは、子供らのアーティスティックな夢と発達における深刻なまでに低いモチベーションに対する処方箋を持つことになるのです。 僕たちが良き指導者たちの励ましとともに頑張る一方、恐らく別のお気に入りのものに対して同じように感じている人たちもいて、その興味のあることを表現する場がない人たちもいます。 僕たちはやがては、より若い人たちのために、音楽や、音楽を演奏する方法や、彼らの夢を実現する方法を学べるコミュニティーを作りたいと思っています。 そこでは純真な、隠された興味を、潜在的に偉大な未来の芸術へと変えるために、音楽の知識をいかにしてビデオゲームやアニメ、ポップカルチャーへの興味と結び付けるかを学ぶことができるでしょう。


J-MUSIC Alliance

- Other Ways You Can Help

Contributing to our campaign is not the only way you can help! Tell your friends and family! Share our video and this post on all your social media networks! The most important aspect of our band and mission is what we like to call the "J-MUSIC Alliance", the idea of a true connection between fans of all aspects of Japanese culture, and how it's beauty has affected the world in various ways. There is strength in numbers! Sometimes, that's all it takes to make things happen.

Thank you so much for considering us, and helping us make our dream come true!

J -MUSIC アライアンス(同盟)

- ほ かにもあるヘルプの方法


僕たちのキャンペーンに貢献をすることだけがあなたのできるヘルプではありません!お友達や家族にも僕たちのキャンペーンのことを話してください! 僕たちのビデオやこのページをあなたのソーシャルメディアネットワークでシェアしてください! 僕たちのバンドの最も重要な部分と使命は、全方面にわたる日本のカルチャーのファンと、そのカルチャーの美しさが世界に様々な形で与える影響との真のつながり“J-MUSIC アライアンス”と僕たちが呼ぶアイディアです。 数が多いに越したことはありません!物事を実現するのに必要なのは、数でもあります。

僕たちのことを気にかけ、僕たちの夢の実現を手伝ってくださり、本当にどうもありがとうございます!

♪♪出資してくださった方への特典♪♪

れ、あなたのために３回のショーを行います！

It was time for us to get these songs recorded, and eventually released to reach more people who shared the same love as us - but we soon came to understand that this was not going to be easy. 始まり
- 僕たちについて - 僕たちの使命について
J-MUSIC Ensemble は元々は日本の音楽への情熱に基づくほんのアイディアで、その新しいアイディアを発表するという夢に過ぎませんでした。この夢の背景には、ソニック・ザ・ヘッジホッグ、ポケモン、ファイナルファンタジーといったゲーム、カウボーイ・ビバップや Naruto といったアニメ、また Perfume や宇多田ヒカルといった J-Popの影響がありました。このバンドは、3年前にマンハッタン音楽学校で現実のものとなり、純粋な喜びと幸せがあらゆるリハーサル、学内パフォーマンスで満ち溢れました。僕たちのお気に入りの曲を探し、この音楽をより深く理解する方法を追求いていました。しかしながら、大学を出て、現実社会に直面し、僕たちの音楽を本気で社会に打ち出していくためのプレッシャーに気がつきました。これらの曲をレコーディングし、発売して、僕たちと同じ情熱を持つより多くの人たちに僕たちの音楽を届けること、それは決して簡単なことではないと気がついたのです。
  
Journey
- Costs, Risks, and Perks
We were able to scrap our money together from previous shows and get into a reasonable studio. However, there were other costs that we needed to be aware of. On top of studio costs, mixing costs, and mastering costs, there were also licensing fees
 - money paid to publishing companies and copyright holders for 
permission to record and release this music legally. These costs aren't 
always concrete, and are usually based on certain criteria defined 
either by the industry or the copyright holders themselves - and without paying them, we can run into serious legal trouble that would hinder us from producing any more music. These fees 
are super important to us, because this is the only real way we can pay 
respect to the composers and artists that have affected us so deeply 
since childhood.  
Mixing - $1000Mastering - $800Physical CD Distribution - $1000Album Artwork/Design ~ $300Licensing Fees ~ $500-800Publicity and Promotion ~ $2,500 
It is because of these incredible costs, and our current difficulty in producing these funds at our current stage, that we ask for your help in bringing this album to life. We are extremely grateful for our friends and family, and in return for your help, we'll give you some amazing things to take home with you (or download)! We'd also like you to know that ANY contribution you make will get your name on our "J-MUSIC Alliance Team Wall" on our website, making you an official member of the J-MUSIC Alliance!Perks start at $1, and by doing so, you already get your name on our J-MUSIC Alliance Team Wall! Moving up between $5 - $50, you get prizes including free stickers, discounted pre-orders, T-shirts, signed CDs, and more! There are rewards at every level, because we really want you to know how much we appreciate your help.旅路
- 費用、リスク、特典
僕たちは過去のショーからのお金をかき集めて、リーズナブルなレコーディングスタジオに入ることができました。しかしながら、他の諸々のコストに気がつきます。スタジオ費用に加え、ミキシング費用、マスタリング費用、そしてライセンス料(この音楽を合法的に録音、発売する許可を得るために出版社や著作権保持者に支払うお金)です。ライセンス料は常に具体的ではありませんが、音楽業界または著作権保持者自身によって決められたある基準に基づいています。そしてこれを支払わなければ、今後一切音楽の制作活動ができなくなるという重大な法的問題へと発展します。この料金は僕たちにとって、ものすごく大切です。なぜなら、これが僕たちに子供の頃から絶大な影響を与えてきた作曲家やアーティストへの敬意を払う唯一の本当の方法だからです。ミキシング - $1000 (約 10 万円)マスタリング - $800 (約8万円)CD 流通 - $1000 (約10万円)アルバムカバーデザイン - $300 (約3万円)ライセンス料 - $500-800 (約5万〜8万円)宣伝、プロモーション- $2,500 (約25万円)これらの莫大な費用、そしてこれらの資金を生み出すのが困難である僕たちの現状から、このアルバムを世に送り出すためにあなたのご協力をお願いしたいと思っています。僕たちの友達や家族に非常に感謝し、支援いただいた方々には、素晴らしいものを持って帰って(ダウンロードして)いただき、恩返しをしたいと思っています。また、貢献をしてくださった全ての方のお名前は僕たちのウェブサイトの“J-MUSIC アライアンス・チーム・ウォール”に刻ませていただき、J-MUSIC アライアンスのオフィシャル・メンバーになっていただけます。特典は1ドル(約100円)から始まり、1ドル(約100円)の貢献をいただくだけでもあなたのお名前は J-MUSIC アライアンス・チーム・ウォールに刻まれます!さらに5ドル(約500円)〜50ドル(約5000円)になると、シールや、イベントの発売前チケットのディスカウント、T シャツ、サイン入り CD などなど、特典が盛り沢山!僕たちがあなたのヘルプにどれだけ感謝しているかを知ってもらいたいのです!   Continuum


- The Impact, Giving Back

Your help in this campaign does a lot more than just help us release our album - you're helping us serve as an example for the future. Most of us in the band come from situations where music was not the first thing pushed as a career option; combine that with an already skewed and negative view on video games and Japanese anime, and you have a recipe for seriously low motivation in a child's artistic dreams, and their development. While we were able to push through by ourselves, and with the encouragement of mentors, there are others who may be feeling the same way about their favorite alternate interests and don't have a platform to express those interests. We want to eventually build communities for those even younger than us to learn about music, how to play music, and how to mold their dreams into a reality. They'll be able to learn how to combine a knowledge of music with an interest in video games, anime, and pop culture in order to turn an otherwise innocent, hidden interest into potentially the greatest art our future can hold.
続き
- 影響力、還元
このキャンペーンにおけるあなたのご協力は、僕たちのアルバムのリリースを助けるだけではありません。 あなたは、未来のための実例となることを支えることとなります。  バンドメンバーのほとんどが、ビデオゲームや日本のアニメに対する歪んだネガティヴな意見とも合わさり、キャリアの選択において音楽が一番に持ってこられない状況を経験してきました。そしてあなたは、子供らのアーティスティックな夢と発達における深刻なまでに低いモチベーションに対する処方箋を持つことになるのです。 僕たちが良き指導者たちの励ましとともに頑張る一方、恐らく別のお気に入りのものに対して同じように感じている人たちもいて、その興味のあることを表現する場がない人たちもいます。 僕たちはやがては、より若い人たちのために、音楽や、音楽を演奏する方法や、彼らの夢を実現する方法を学べるコミュニティーを作りたいと思っています。 そこでは純真な、隠された興味を、潜在的に偉大な未来の芸術へと変えるために、音楽の知識をいかにしてビデオゲームやアニメ、ポップカルチャーへの興味と結び付けるかを学ぶことができるでしょう。

  J-MUSIC Alliance


- Other Ways You Can Help
Contributing to our campaign is not the only way you can help! Tell your friends and family! Share our video and this post on all your social media networks! The most important aspect of our band and mission is what we like to call the "J-MUSIC Alliance", the idea of a true connection between fans of all aspects of Japanese culture, and how it's beauty has affected the world in various ways. There is strength in numbers! Sometimes, that's all it takes to make things happen.Thank you so much for considering us, and helping us make our dream come true!J -MUSIC アライアンス(同盟)
- ほ かにもあるヘルプの方法
僕たちのキャンペーンに貢献をすることだけがあなたのできるヘルプではありません!お友達や家族にも僕たちのキャンペーンのことを話してください! 僕たちのビデオやこのページをあなたのソーシャルメディアネットワークでシェアしてください! 僕たちのバンドの最も重要な部分と使命は、全方面にわたる日本のカルチャーのファンと、そのカルチャーの美しさが世界に様々な形で与える影響との真のつながり“J-MUSIC アライアンス”と僕たちが呼ぶアイディアです。 数が多いに越したことはありません!物事を実現するのに必要なのは、数でもあります。僕たちのことを気にかけ、僕たちの夢の実現を手伝ってくださり、本当にどうもありがとうございます!♪♪出資してくださった方への特典♪♪＄１（約１００円）あなたはアライアンス・オフィシャル・メンバー！:スペシャルギフト獲得！あなたのお名前は僕たちのウェブサイトの”J-MUSIC アライアンス・チーム・ウォール”にJ-MUSIC アライアンス・オフィシャル・メンバーとして刻まれます！このウォールはあなたのようにJ-MUSICの活動継続のために重要な役割を果たしてくださる皆様のために作られています！（ウォールはこのキャンペーンが終了次第完成します。本名以外の別名を選んでいただいても結構です。）$5 (約５００円）フューチャーバウンド！:あなたのお名前は僕たちのウェブサイトの”J-MUSIC アライアンス・チーム・ウォール”にJ-MUSIC アライアンス・オフィシャル・メンバーとして刻まれます！また、ニュー・アルバム収録曲の中から２曲をフィーチャーしたシングル「Futurbound」に５月初版発売時のオリジナル・ボーナス特典（４ウォールペーパー、「Game」より譜面）をプラス！$10（約１０００円）Time To Play :あなたのお名前は僕たちのウェブサイトの”J-MUSIC アライアンス・チーム・ウォール”にJ-MUSIC アライアンス・オフィシャル・メンバーとして刻まれます！また、ニュー・アルバムのデジタルコピーをプレゼント！$15（約１５００円）＋送料本気だしちゃお！:あなたのお名前は僕たちのウェブサイトの”J-MUSIC アライアンス・チーム・ウォール”にJ-MUSIC アライアンス・オフィシャル・メンバーとして刻まれます！また、ニュー・アルバムのCDとJ-MUSICスペシャル・ステッカーをプレゼント！$25（約２５００円）＋送料J-MUSIC インサイダー :ニュー・アルバムのCDとJ-MUSICスペシャル・ステッカー、さらに公表前のJ-MUSICニュースや最新情報（コンサート・スケジュール、リリース曲、発売前のイベントディスカウントチケットなど）が入手できるメンバー限定メーリングリストにアクセスできます！そしてあなたのお名前は”J-MUSIC アライアンス・チーム・ウォール”に！$40 （約４０００円）＋送料J-MUSIC インサイダー・プラス :バンドメンバー全員のサイン入りニュー・アルバムCD、J-MUSIC ステッカー２枚、メンバー限定メーリングリストにアクセス！そしてもちろんあなたのお名前は”J-MUSIC アライアンス・チーム・ウォール”に！$50 (約５０００円）スペシャル・サンキュー・パック！:バンドメンバー全員のサイン入りニュー・アルバムCD、J-MUSIC Tシャツ、手書きのサンキューカード（サイン入り）。送料無料！そのほか、インサイダー・メンバーシップ！そしてもちろんあなたのお名前は”J-MUSIC アライアンス・チーム・ウォール”に！$75 (約７５００円)永久の宝物！:バンドメンバー全員のサイン入りニュー・アルバムCD、J-MUSIC Tシャツ、J-MUSICステッカー２枚、手書きのサンキューカード（サイン入り）、インサイダー・メンバーシップ！有料のJ-MUSICショーの無料入場券（１枚）！そしてもちろんあなたのお名前は”J-MUSIC アライアンス・チーム・ウォール”に！$100（約１万円）リンリン！:$75用パックの全特典＋パトリックからのスペシャルなお電話またはスカイプコール！（お電話をご希望の方は、お電話番号をお残しください。）$150 （約１万５千円）ピープルズ・チョイス :$100用パックの全特典＋J-MUSICのショーにVIP/バックステージ・アクセス（１回分）、あなたのお好きなJ-POP、アニメまたはビデオゲームミュージックの曲を４５～６０秒あなたのために演奏（ビデオ録画）！（バンドの一部のメンバーによる演奏となるかもしれません。）$200（約２万円）ミュージシャンズ・チョイス :$150用パックの全特典＋あなたのために演奏した曲の楽譜（デジタル）、またバンドメンバーのうちの誰からでも個人ミュージック・レッスンが受けられます！$250（約２万５千円）コレクターズ・チョイス :$200用パックの全特典＋ニュー・アルバム”Time To Play”収録曲のうちの１曲の表紙付き完全楽譜をお送りします。$500（約５万円）サイン入りCD８枚？！:$250用パックの全特典＋バンドメンバー別々にサインが入った８枚のニュー・アルバムCD（各CDにそれぞれのメンバーからの手書きのサンキューカード付き）！またあなたのお名前はニュー・アルバムCD発売時にアルバムにクレジットされます。$750（約７万５千円）グランド・コミッション！:$500用パックの全特典＋あなたのために書かれたオリジナル曲またはあなたのお好きなJ-POP、アニメまたはビデオゲームミュージックの曲の完全編曲をプレゼント！その曲のサイン入り楽譜！そしてあなたのために録音します！$1000（約１０万円）プライベート・ショー ・アンド・モア! :$750用パックの全特典＋あなたのための特別プライベートショー！（場所は問いません。ただしニューヨークシティ以外の場合、バンドの旅費はお客様ご負担となります。）またあなたのお名前はプロデューサーとしてアルバムに記載されます。（コレクターズ・チョイスの特典は２０１６年１０月までに発送されます。）$2500（約２５万円）J-MUSIC スーパーすごい・パック！:$1000用パック全特典＋今後全てのJ-MUSICショー無料VIP入場券！ニューヨークシティまでのあなたの旅費、そして僕たちと一緒に僕たちのお気に入りの日本食レストランでディナーしましょう！コレクターズ・チョイスの特典は２０１６年１０月までに発送されます。）$6500（約６５万円）100% 究極プレミア・パック・プラス！:このプロジェクト全てに出資してくださった方には、このリストにある全特典をプレゼント！ニュー・アルバムにエグゼクティブ・プロデューサーとして記載され、あなたのために３回のショーを行います！

story:
FOX - Picture Music

 

FOX – Picture Music wagt sich über die Genregrenzen hinaus und verbindet Filmmusik und Klassik mit Pop und Rock.
Die ausgefallene Besetzung mit Trompete, zwei E-Celli, Bass und einem Drummer gewährt Flexibilität, um Musik von Vivaldi und Albeniz über epische Soundtracks bis hin zu Gotthard und Metallica an einem Abend zu vereinen.

 
  •  Für höchste instrumentaltechnische Qualität garantieren fünf aufstrebende, diplomierte und schweizweit gefragte Musiker, welche sowohl im Sinfonieorchester als auch auf internationalen Jazz- und Showbühnen anzutreffen sind.
  •  Ziel ist es, die klassische Musik mit Hilfe von rockigen Grooves, Choreographie- und Lichtelementen einem breiten Publikum zugänglich zu machen.
  •  Mit dieser Kampagne schaffen wir uns sowohl einen Grundstein zum Aufbau der Band, als auch die Realisation einer ersten Konzerttour durch die Schweiz.
  

 

Wer wir sind
 

  • Manuela Fuchs, Trompete
  • Ellen Cameron, E-Cello
  • Christoph Kuhn, E-Cello
  • Stefan Mens / Felix Kübler, Bass
  • Mario Von Holten, Drums
     
  • Stefan Mens, Arrangements
  • Sabine Schindler, Choreographie
  • Daniel Tschanz, Nuance Veranstaltungstechnik GmbH
     

 

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst

  
Folgende Kosten müssen gedeckt werden:

  • Arrangements
  • Choreographien
  • Musikergagen für Proben  und Konzerte
  • Licht- und Tontechniker
  • Trailer und Fotos für diese Kampagne
  • Werbematerial
  • Outfits
  • Raummieten
  • Suisa-Gebühren
  • Indiegogo-Gebühren


 

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

 

Teile diese Crowdfunding-Kampagne auf jeglichen Kanälen, erzähl deinem Bekanntenkreis davon und besuche unsere Konzerte :-)

Falls du uns auf einem anderen Weg unterstützen möchtest, melde dich unter kontakt@manuela-fuchs.ch

Konto: CH13 0077 0253 4677 6200 2
Rubrik FOX - Picture Music
Inhaber: Manuela Fuchs, Basel

 

 

Konzerte

  
Folgende Showacts sind bestätigt:

  • Mo 27. Juni, 18.30 Uhr, Diplomfeier Dentalassistenten/innen, Berufsschule Aarau
  • Mi 29. Juni, 20.00 Uhr, ONO Bern
  • Do 30. Juni, 20.00 Uhr, Markthalle Basel
  • Fr 8. Juli, 20.00 Uhr, Kulturbar Werkhof102 Bern
  • Fr 9. September, 20.00 Bar Niente Zug (bei schönem Wetter outdoor)
  • Do 22. September, 20.00 Uhr La Madeleine Luzern
  • Due Entlebuch (Datum noch offen)
  • Memphis Zürich (Datum noch offen)
  • Markthalle Basel II (Datum noch offen)

story:
Who We Are

A Mile In My Shoes Inc. is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the purposes of A Mile In My Shoes Inc. must be made payable to Fractured Atlas and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

A Mile In My Shoes, Inc. (AMIMS) is a fiscally sponsored arts organization, with a mission is to use the arts as a platform to address modern social issues.

On Friday, August 21, at the Metropolitan Room, AMIMS will present “The Real Love Concert: Go Love Yourself,” an evening of empowering entertainment anchored by dynamic performances from two of New York City’s most talented artists.

Crystal Monee Hall and Huling Foster headline the show with new arrangements of classics such as Nina Simone’s “I Wish I Knew How It Would Feel to Be Free”, Carol King’s “Beautiful”, and many more. These powerhouses will fuse their sets with very personal stories and reflections of their journeys towards self-love.


Why a concert about self-love?

We feel that many of our social issues  would be remedied if self-love, self-respect and a positive self-image were engrained into the psyche of every human being. These fundamental ideals are central to the betterment of society. An impactful way to get this message across is a concert focused on the person who matters most...you!


What We Need & What You Get

Your donation will help make the Real Love Concert a reality.

Any size donation will help offset the costs of producing our Real Love Concert on August 21. These costs include: compensating performers and band members, live video recording, live streaming, program printing and ad design. There are great perks for donating, including a Go Love Yourself T-shirt and tickets to the show!


Other Ways You Can Help

So many people have encouraged us not to ever end this campaign and that it sends a timely and vital message. In order to continue to grow this campaign, we need your support. Please share this campaign with your friends or anyone you know who would be interested. You can easily share with friends on social media through our links.

Thank you for supporting Real Love!

Monee Hall and Huling Foster headline the show with new arrangements of
classics such as Nina Simone’s “I Wish I Knew How It Would Feel to Be Free”,
Carol King’s “Beautiful”, and many more. These powerhouses will fuse their sets
with very personal stories and reflections of their journeys towards self-love.
Why a concert about self-love?
We feel that many of our social issues  would be remedied if self-love, self-respect
and a positive self-image were engrained into the psyche of every human being. These fundamental ideals are central to the betterment of
society. An impactful way to get this message across is a concert focused on the person who matters most...you!
What We Need & What You Get
Your donation will help make the Real Love Concert a reality. 
Any
size donation will help offset the costs of producing our Real Love Concert on
August 21. These costs include: compensating performers and band members, live video
recording, live streaming, program printing and ad design. There are great
perks for donating, including a Go Love Yourself T-shirt and tickets to the
show! 
Other Ways You Can Help
So many people have encouraged us not to ever end this campaign
and that it sends a timely and vital message. In order to continue to grow this
campaign, we need your support. Please share this campaign with your friends or
anyone you know who would be interested. You can easily share with friends
on social media through our links.
Thank you for supporting Real Love!

story:
The Campaign


Music is an integral part of African cultures.  It often permeates every aspect of life.  LA Rota grew up in Kenya in a house that was abundant with love and music - but not a lot of anything else.

Ms Rota cannot remember a time when she was not singing at home, at church and in school.  She has sung in competitions and won many awards including signing with a record label.


Through all of this, she has continued with her education.  She is currently enrolled in Kenyatta University studying psychology and business management.

Living a life without many things is something Ms Rota knows well.  Her father died when she was two years old.  Her mother struggled to provide for her and her five siblings.  They had times when they were hungry and times when they were homeless.

Having faced these hardships has driven her to a life of giving.  She volunteers at St Martin School in Kibera, Kenya (Kibera is the biggest slum in Africa and one of the biggest in the world).  She has learned that, as much as kids need an education to better their lives, they need hope and inspiration.  She is hoping she can utilize her musical talents to not only better her life and that of her family, but to also give to the students at St Martin School a view of how their future can be brighter, too.

Wazimu and Moja World have brought together LA Rota with Hot Sun Films (also based in Kibera) to make her first music video.  She is looking for this to help catapult her career and get her in a better place to contribute the the future of the people of Kenya -- especially in Kibera. 

Hot Sun Films has operated the Kibera Film School training students from Kibera to have skills to work in the film, television and other industries.  Many of the alums are hired by the Kibera Film School to teach and work on the  production side of the organization, Hot Sun Films.  The students only pay 1/3 of the cost of their training.  The balance of the funds is brought in through the Hot Sun Foundation and through Hot Sun Films (such as the making of this music video).  Hot Sun Films stays with the highest of global industry including utilizing the best of the best equipment including the Red Dragon camera & Zeiss lenses.

By contributing, you are not only supporting LA Rota in forwarding her career, you are helping the kids at the St Martin School, Hot Sun Films, and the students at the Kibera Film School.  That's what we call "More bang for the buck!"


What We Need & What You Get

The campaign is asking for $15,000. 

The making of the music video with Hot Sun Films will cost almost $10,000.
(This includes payment of all those involved in the production of the music video including students and alums of the Kibera Film School.)

LA Rota's costs for the campaign and also her school fees for this year are approximately $5,000.
(This will allow Ms Rota to focus on her studies, her singing career and helping the students at the St Martin school.  Without this, the campaign could not happen, and Ms Rota's time would be spent in raising funds for tuition).


The Impact

The impact will be felt on so many levels.  Not only will it directly elevate LA Rota's life, it will help all the children at the St Martin School in Kibera and provide support for the continued operation of Hot Sun Films.  St Martin School, the Kibera Film  School & Hot Sun Films all contribute to a better life for all in Kibera, Kenya.


Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge will be raising funds in the amount needed to produce the quality of video wanted.  Ms Rota's video will be of a quality that it can be launched on the international stage not only putting her and her music in the spot light, it will help all of those she, Hot Sun Films, the Kibera Film School and The St Martin School touch in Kibera.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please, pass information of the campaign to all of your friends. 

If you are ever in Kenya, please spend some time in Kibera volunteering at Hot Sun Films and/or The St Martin School. 

Listen to LA Rota's music on Reberb Nation: https://www.reverbnation.com/larota and on SoundCloud: www.soundcloud.com/laurriette-rota

Learn more about Hot Sun Films and the Kibera Film School:  hotsunfilms.com and hotsunfilmschool.com

story:
Making an album is a ton of work!! It's done as a act of love, especially when the music is as intentional as with Love Eternal, Music for an Awakening World. 

However,  it's more than half way done!!! 14 tracks, including a few oldies never recorded, a couple new versions or pre-recorded jems, and the rest is mostly brand new songs!! We are all completely confident that this album is by far our best work!! 

Luckily, we have a studio! So what do we need $3,000 for??? 

Its about $1,500 to press the CD once finished and mastered! So that's half right there. We need at least $500 to be able to press the moment the audio is finished. 

We are also working with a few professional video editors so that we can release a couple professional videos coinciding with the album release. And are underway with a PR campaign. Love Eternal is giving it all we got for this one!!! 

And finally, it takes so so so much time and something as simple as a few hundred bucks to know that the band can be fed while working on it is huge!!

 Everyone who donates at least $1 will get a digital copy of the next album!

 Everyone who donates at least $10 will get a pre-order physical copy of the CD shipped right to them in time for the holidays! 

$50 and above, we will send you a gift pack of every CD we have recorded!! 

Lots more great perks available as well.

There are so many great causes out there to donate to... We would be so amazingly grateful if you chose to donate to ours!

story:
Recently my family and I started traveling for music. During this process of our careers launching, not only are we being invited around the world to perform we also have been hitting the studio. We have been releasing single after single and giving you all pretty good music to listen to. But we desire to do more that just give you pretty good music to listen to. You all have been requesting more music and requesting us to come to your city. SO We are getting ready to hit a major studio to create our albums, to create top quality, radio ready music. With our new sound and your hungry ears, we believe this is a match made in heaven. In order for us to travel and come to your city to perform and release the new album, we are definitely going to need your help. To record in a top industry studio, fuel buses and air travel is not cheap at all. We are raising 10,000 dollars to make your request come true. We are also releasing the album for free at our shows and to do so it is very pricey for this to happen. During this Process we will be documenting everything through Youtube videos and a Short Film that we wil release about our progress. All music will also be on major digital distribution outlets.   

Hint- You can earn a feature in our short film. Look in perks for more details.

Here's What We Need Funded!

Air Travel

Bus Travel

Studio Time/Rates

Distribution (album)

Housing

Website

Film equipment for short film

Tshirts/Shipping and handling

story:
*Our campaign is over, but several people have asked if they can still contribute. If you would like to give to Wild Cities, you can send donations via Paypal to francesca.anderegg@gmail.com. Also, please check out my page on Facebook for the latest news and events!*

The Story

I am a violinist who plays contemporary music. Pianist Brent Funderburk and I have been working together- performing, touring and recording- for 5 years. Our first CD, released in 2012 by Albany Records, contained music by Mozart, Schubert, Schoenberg, George Perle, and Elliott Carter. We just recorded our second album, Wild Cities.

The name "Wild Cities" is inspired by the poem "After Dead Souls" by Allen Ginsberg. In it, Ginsberg asks, "Where O America are you/going in your glorious/automobile….toward what wild city/jumping with jazz/on the Pacific Ocean?" This classic image inspired generations of composers who were trying to forge a uniquely American musical identity. The Ginsberg poem suggests both a journey and a destination that is both exciting and unknown, concepts that we explore in the album. Wild Cities is a journey through the new landscape of American music. 

Project & Budget

We're excited to share this amazing music with you and hope you will be moved to support it! 

We recorded the album at the new Concert Hall at the Ordway Center for the Performing Arts in St. Paul, MN. We paid for these sessions with a combination of grants and personal savings. Now, we are raising funds for post-production expenses, including manufacturing, distribution, artwork and publicity. 

Post-production expenses

Editing, mixing and mastering: $3000

Label fee (upfront fee charged by recording label to manufacture and distribute the album): $5800

Artwork (photography and design): $1000

Help us cross the finish line and deliver the sounds of Wild Cities to your ears!


The Impact

The five young composers featured on the album- Ryan Anthony Francis, Clint Needham, Hannah Lash, Ted Hearne, and Reinaldo Moya- are my friends and colleagues (one is my husband!). These close collaborations have yielded some pretty great results, and we want to share these with as wide an audience as possible. 

In a world where "new music" is valued primarily for being new and quickly loses its lustre, we've created an album that we feel is fresh and will be worth hearing again and again. We really believe in these composers and feel like they have something to say. Their music is surprising, moving, beautiful- and it's part of a larger narrative of contemporary American culture. We have loved the experience of delving into the music of these talented composers, and are excited to share their artistic vision with you.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our story! Link to this campaign on your Facebook page with a personal message showing support for the artists or composers. This will help us get the word out to the widest possible network of friends and supporters.

Thank you for supporting new music!!!

story:
Who is STARBABY ENTERPRISES?

Launched by Jordan Elizabeth Gelber in 2013, Starbaby Enterprises, LLC is an innovative NYC based, PR, Marketing, and Production firm geared towards individuals in the entertainment and fashion industries.

Since our launch in 2013, we have been fortunate to create and be a part of large projects such as Celebrity Filled Fashion Shows, national advertising campaigns, and for 2015 we have launched a new film production division.

Starbaby Enterprises, LLC was created to provide creative individuals with the opportunities to achieve their goals and dreams in their desired industries. This Summer 2015, we have partnered with international metal superstars, Sacred Oath to produce the music video for their new single "Taken."

Who is SACRED OATH?


Sacred Oath is a metal band that formed in 1985 and is still cranking out old-school metal today.  In 2006, vocalist/guitarist Rob Thorne resurrected the band and set upon producing and releasing 6 albums over the next 7 years, including Darkness Visible, Sacred Oath, World On Fire, Fallen, a live album Till Death Do Us Part, and a "best of" compilation called Spells and Incantations. 

The band also toured minimally in Europe and the US during this period with a few lineup changes including Kenny Evans, Billy Smith, and Brendan Kelleher.

The latest album Fallen was recorded by all four original members of the band as a celebration of their 25th anniversary. A new album is expected in 2015 with the new single "Taken."


THE MUSIC VIDEO

The band is on the cusp of their new album launch and we are producing their music video for the upcoming single “Taken.” This will be Starbaby Enterprises’ first full length feature  to be launched on Itunes through Universal on September 4, and we invite you to be a part of it.

Storyboard:

The idea behind the “Taken” Music Video, is the story of one women’s eternal lust for metal and the band doomed to play for her forever.

It follows our video vixen, Alt model and artist, Leah Jung, as she portrays a sexy Siren who woos Sacred Oath to her island that is haunted by her army of zombies.

Her goal is to “take their breath away,” keeping her favorite band playing metal for eternity.

Leah Jung - Facebook Inspiration:

1.  -In Greek mythology, the Sirens (Greek singular: Σειρήν Seirēn; Greek plural: Σειρῆνες Seirēnes) were dangerous yet beautiful creatures, who lured nearby sailors with their enchanting music and voices to shipwreck on the rocky coast of their island.


2. Zombies - because everyone loves The Walking Dead

Anyone who donates will be able to be a ZOMBIE in the Music Video! It's a way for the fans to become a part of the project and a way for us to give thanks for all the support!

The Impact

As this is Starbaby Enterprises' first music video production, we are putting everything we have to make sure this project is amazing. We have been fortunate to partner with SACRED OATH for the upcoming video. 

  • The Video will debut on September 4, 2015 on Itunes through Universal
  • It will premiere on Vevo & Windows Media's Home Page same day
  • Between our trusted company affiliates and Sacred Oath's fanbase this video will reach a large international audience. (Audience of over 1 million national viewers and 1 million international viewers)

How will the funds be used?

Over the years both Sacred Oath and Starbaby Enterprises have been fortunate enough to work with a database of companies and affiliates that have signed on for this project. However, even though we have the ability to cut many costs, there are still a few hurdles that we have come across. 

Following is an overview of our Risks & Challenges:

  • Crew & Production Staff (including DP, Cinematographer, and Equipment) (Special Shout Out to Killer Beam Productions who have signed on to work with us!)


  • Makeup & SFX (Prosthetics and Zombie Makeup) - We are looking to partner with a makeup school or makeup company.
  • Post- Production - This is where the majority of our funding will go to, how a film is edited in post can make or break a production. 
  • Location & Insurance Protection - We are filing location permits for Pleasure Beach in Bridgeport, CT as well as several other places, the insurance is protect everyone on set and make sure that those who work on the project feel safe and secure.

Pleasure Beach, Bridgeport, CT
----If you a company interested in sponsoring please let us know----

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this video EVERYWHERE! Like us all on facebook, twitter, and instagram and keep the music alive.

Starbaby Enterprises: Facebook   Twitter    Instagram

Leah Jung:  Facebook  Twitter  Instagram

Sacred Oath: Facebook  Twitter

story:
Hello Fellow Rebels!

My name is Sarah-Jean Villa and you can call me SJ or Rebel Style Queen. I’m a singer-songwriter who has been working on this album about my healing journey for over 6 years. This is my first album, and I invite all of you to come and be part of the Rebel Masquerade Celebration. The Rebel Masquerade will be on October 29, 2015 at 7:30pm at Innovative Versatile Artistry in Port Credit. 

This album was made possible through the support of my family, mentors, organizations and friends. I have decided to give a percentage of all the proceeds to the Interim Place.  The Interim Place has played a large part in my healing journey and it continues to support me.  

With Interim Place, I work with “My Life My Canvas” and “Her Life Her Canvas” as an Artist Educator/Peer Facilitator.  This program of art based healing in the community and many other programs that are being offered at the Interim Place are in need of funding and I am extending an invitation to you to help keep these programs active in the community through your generous support. 

My album was produced by Roman and Mike Zebik of Roman’s Music. Mark Zubek of Zedd Records, Zubin Thakkar and Matt Zaddy, Brett Zilahi and Domenic Spaziani have also been artists that I have worked and continue to work with. I would also like to thank Factor for their support. I am grateful to be surrounded by so many talented artists. 

I dedicate my story to all those who have struggled and continue to struggle with physical, emotional and sexual abuse to let them know that they are not alone.  It is through my own personal experiences that have allowed me to be musically creative and to heal and to have a voice. I would like thank all those of have made this album and journey possible. My parents Rosa and Ivo, my husband Domenic, who has stood by me and believes in me and my second set of parents, Michael and Noelle.  

I would like to give big hugs to all the musicians who added their magical gift to this album Domenic Spaziani, Matt Zaddy, Darryl Daz Coppins , Mike Zebik, Roman Zebik, Zubin Thakkar, Alex Marr, Peter Lozano and Mark Zubek. A special thank you to my mentor and friend Howard. Thank you also to The Gatehouse, The Region of Peel, Job Skills Brampton Team, Jane Tweed Center, Hae Kawang Sunim, Stella, Siobhan, Sharon, from the Interim Place for giving me a second home and helping be feel safe. For more details about Interim Place you can check out http://www.interimplace.com.

I invite you to watch my video I made with Domenic and view all the different ways you can support my CD Release and Interim Place. What better way to come together and do something magical this Halloween by coming out to The Rebel Masquerade Party and enjoying this magical evening with me and your fellow Rebels. 

Tickets are only available through the indiegogo page and not at the door. We only have 100 tickets so reserve your ticket today. 

Have a beautiful day filled with love and kindness.

Thank you for your support.

Sarah-Jean Villa
story_txt: Hello Fellow Rebels!My name is Sarah-Jean Villa and you can call me SJ or Rebel Style Queen. I’m a singer-songwriter who has been working on this album about my healing journey for over 6 years. This is my first album, and I invite all of you to come and be part of the Rebel Masquerade Celebration. The Rebel Masquerade will be on October 29, 2015 at 7:30pm at Innovative Versatile Artistry in Port Credit. This album was made possible through the support of my family, mentors, organizations and friends. I have decided to give a percentage of all the proceeds to the Interim Place.  The Interim Place has played a large part in my healing journey and it continues to support me.  With Interim Place, I work with “My Life My Canvas” and “Her Life Her Canvas” as an Artist Educator/Peer Facilitator.  This program of art based healing in the community and many other programs that are being offered at the Interim Place are in need of funding and I am extending an invitation to you to help keep these programs active in the community through your generous support. My album was produced by Roman and Mike Zebik of Roman’s Music. Mark Zubek of Zedd Records, Zubin Thakkar and Matt Zaddy, Brett Zilahi and Domenic Spaziani have also been artists that I have worked and continue to work with. I would also like to thank Factor for their support. I am grateful to be surrounded by so many talented artists. I dedicate my story to all those who have struggled and continue to struggle with physical, emotional and sexual abuse to let them know that they are not alone.  It is through my own personal experiences that have allowed me to be musically creative and to heal and to have a voice. I would like thank all those of have made this album and journey possible. My parents Rosa and Ivo, my husband Domenic, who has stood by me and believes in me and my second set of parents, Michael and Noelle.  I would like to give big hugs to all the musicians who added their magical gift to this album Domenic Spaziani, Matt Zaddy, Darryl Daz Coppins , Mike Zebik, Roman Zebik, Zubin Thakkar, Alex Marr, Peter Lozano and Mark Zubek. A special thank you to my mentor and friend Howard. Thank you also to The Gatehouse, The Region of Peel, Job Skills Brampton Team, Jane Tweed Center, Hae Kawang Sunim, Stella, Siobhan, Sharon, from the Interim Place for giving me a second home and helping be feel safe. For more details about Interim Place you can check out http://www.interimplace.com.I invite you to watch my video I made with Domenic and view all the different ways you can support my CD Release and Interim Place. What better way to come together and do something magical this Halloween by coming out to The Rebel Masquerade Party and enjoying this magical evening with me and your fellow Rebels. Tickets are only available through the indiegogo page and not at the door. We only have 100 tickets so reserve your ticket today. Have a beautiful day filled with love and kindness.Thank you for your support.Sarah-Jean Villa

story:
Bright People is a creative platform for gatherings, artistic environments, dance music, and friends. We encourage community collaboration and dedicate our time to helping those around us foster their creativity.

What are we crowdfunding for?

We are holding a crowdfunding campaign to purchase the supplies we need to create amazing environments at transformational festivals. At these festivals we provide an unforgettable experience that includes activities, a space for workshops and yoga, food and even costumes for ultimate self expression. Our team works together as a unit to collaborate with other artists, builders, and creatives who have so much to offer to the festival attendees. Yes, we do all of it for fun! WHY? Because we're passionate about art, music, and self-expression and we want to provide a space for people to enjoy.

GO CAMP BRIGHT PEOPLE!!

This money we raise in this crowdfunding campaign is dedicated to our featured art space, "CAMP BRIGHT PEOPLE",  at the Desert Hearts Music Festival in November 2015. Desert Hearts is an outdoor, bi-annual 3,000 person art and music festival on the Los Coyotes Indian Reservation just outside San Diego, CA.

For the second time this year, Camp Bright People will be designated our very own area at the outdoor festival. In our designated area (which we have been given full creative artistic freedom) for the second time this year, we will create an environment for the whole crowd to enjoy. Our goal is to decorate this a football field sized space with several areas that will have flowing fabrics, beautiful lighting, and painted backdrops, featuring free amenities like yoga workshops, food, and a pop up costume shop. We will have approximately 50 members who are part of our group, most of whom will be donating volunteer hours and supplies for our camp to use. This is a group effort and teamwork truly makes the dream work in every sense.

Where will your donations go?

 It takes money to make an impression at an outdoor music festival! 

Your generous donations will help purchase what we need.

See a detailed list below.


 ~Lighting ($125)

A festival theme camp isn't a camp without awesome lighting! We will be purchasing more string lights, decorative star lights, battery operated "el wire" to light up our camp at night

6 packs el wire 5 ft el wire for $14 each- $85

Ikea string lights 2 packs - $20

2 Ikea Star pendant lights  to hang from trees at $10 each- $20


~ Art Supplies ($165)

We would like to purchase spraypaint, glitter, and wood for making camp signs and decorations to distinguish the different areas of our camp. These signs are positive reminders, stating things like "let your light shine" and list how to make an exchange at our free costume shop. We will also be hosting a crafting workshop on Sunday and a portion of donations will go towards covering the cost for materials.

Montana Gold spraypaint in 5 colors at $8 each- $50

Silver & gold glitters from Michael's Arts & Crafts at $10 each- $20

6  large and small wood panels from Home Depot for fun camp signs- $40

Spray adhesive - $5

Acrylic paint- $20

9x12 canvas backdrop to paint for our funky outdoor photobooth- $30



~ Fabric ($240)

Donations will go towards purchasing comfortable fabrics and rugs for our  relaxing community camp center where free yoga and art workshops will take place.

60 yards of several multicolored & textured decorative fabrics at $4 per yard- $240


~ Grilled cheese sandwiches ($111)

 A portion of funds raised will go towards the ingredients for grilled cheese sandwiches, which we give out for out for free at Camp Bright People. We will serve them on Friday, Saturday and Sunday from 1pm-4pm at the festival

6 loaves of sourdough bread at $4 each- $24

3 two lb blocks of Tillamook medium cheddar $23 each- $69

3 large containers of butter at $6 apiece- $18



~ Sunday Funday Happy Hour ($270)

On Sunday we will be hosting a mimosa Happy Hour for Desert Hearts Festival attendees. As always, this will be free for everyone. We look forward to inviting people to our camp to enjoy our space, mingle, and have a great time. A portion of the donations from this fundraiser will be used for champagne and orange juice...mimosas!

20 bottles of Cook's champagne at $6 per bottle-$120

50 half gallons of orange juice at $3 each- $150

~EZ-UP Canopy ($160)

Through this fundraiser we are planning to purchase one new EZ-UP canopy to provide shade for our Bright People kitchen

One 10 ft x 10 ft EZ-UP canopy - $160



~Gas and propane ($230)

We travel from Los Angeles to the festival location in Escondido in a large truck which hauls a Uhaul trailer. A portion of donations will go towards the gas to get there. We will also be purchasing propane for our grill so we can make the grilled cheese sandwiches which we'll be giving away. We also need gasoline for our generator which will be powering all of our lights and grill.

One Large propane tank - $30

Gasoline for generator- $100

Gasoline for the truck to San Diego and back- $100



~Uhaul Trailer ($250)

In order to transport Bright People camp supplies like  canopies, decor, tables, and fabrics, we must rent a large trailer from Uhaul.

Large 6' x 12' Cargo Trailer from Uhaul for $30 per day x 8 days plus tax= $250


~Custom built Structure ($300)

At the last Dessert Hearts Festival in April, we had the opportunity to use a unique hand built structure created by Space Nature Tech. This year we are doing it again. The structure lights up and really gives our camp a unique feel. People love to place chairs and blankets inside the structure to stay out of the sun and relax. The best part is the structure lights up at night with rgb lights and changes color, adding a beautiful ambiance to Camp Bright People!

~Custom built modular Space Nature Tech shade structure with lighting- $300


~Bright People T-shirts ($250)

As you can see from the perks we are offering, a Bright People "Let Your Light Shine" Tee-Shirt is included in every perk that is $25 or more. The shirt was designed by Bright People founder and artist Jamie Janett. The cost of each shirt was $4.50. The screenprinting was donated to us by Reggie Martinez of www.livemadhappy.com, one of our sponsors.

~50 shirts at $4.50 each plus tax -$250

Shirts printed on Next Level Apparel CVC Crew, cotton polyester blend



If we exceed our goal, the remaining funds will go towards...

~a Bright people website and domain name

~ venue costs for our upcoming annual art and music event

~production of more Bright People t-shirts



WHAT HAS THE BRIGHT PEOPLE COLLECTIVE DONE IN THE PAST?


  • In August 2012 the first Bright People event in downtown LA showcased 10 local artists , 5 Los Angeles dj's and an electronic band all under one roof. Art and photography was on display, live bodypainting took place, collaborative art unfolded, and door prizes were given out. Approximately 120 people attended our first event. Each one left inspired.
  • In December 2014 the second Bright People event was held in downtown Los Angeles. It was significantly larger than the first, and proved to be a quality event with quality performers. Five professional visual artists were featured along with body art and 6 amazing dj's in a 250 person capacity venue.
  • Three months later in March 2015, the Bright People collective was invited as a featured art theme camp at the Desert Hearts Spring Festival. This was a pivotal event that brought our community together and solidified Bright People as a collective of art and music lovers who were here to stay. We raised our goal of $1,200 in order to provide festival goers with free grilled cheese sandwiches cooked by our resident dj's, a free festival costume clothing boutique with free clothing, and collaborated to build a custom built chillpsace with art on display. Our featured artists held workshops and did live art for all to see.
  • Various community events including a free park party, sign painting and tie dye party, and our Backyard Boogie party where we painted, made jewelry, and danced to our community dj's



MORE ABOUT THE DESERT HEARTS MUSIC FESTIVAL


Over the past few years Desert Hearts has seen tremendous growth and has transformed into a full blown movement of love and community. It's truly blown our minds how beautiful our family has come to be. We've brought our love and our vibe to the far reaches of North America and now it's time to celebrate with our beloved Desert Hearts Family once again on our home court in Southern California! This November we are incredibly excited to announce a super special celebration for our Desert Hearts 3 Year Anniversary!



PERKS

            Receive awesome gifts for your donations!

We at Bright People are offering you handmade and creative gifts in return for your donations. These include a limited edition Bright People t-shirt, hand crocheted hats, artistic leggings, fine art prints, an original painting, or even a synthesizer for creating your own beats. Our gifts are our way of saying THANK YOU for supporting our vision.


$25

1 BRIGHT PEOPLE "Let your light shine" T-Shirt
Your choice of ONE men's or women's Bright People exclusive limited edition t-shirt!


$85 

BRIGHT ART PACK

1 Signed Fine Art Art Print OR Crocheted Beanie OR Bleach Art Leggings +TWO  BRIGHT PEOPLE T-Shirts
Your choice of TWO Bright People exclusive limited edition t-shirts and your choice of a beautiful collectible signed fine art print or a crocheted beanie or bleach art leggings!

   

OR


PLUS




        

$100

BRIGHT TRENDSETTER

Choose 1 Crochet beanie OR Bleach Art Leggings +Two Bright People T-Shirts + 1 Signed Fine Art Art Print

PLUS

PLUS




$325

BRIGHT MUSIC MAKER
ONE VINTAGE SYNTHESIZER+2 Bright People T-Shirts + 1 Signed Fine Art Art Print OR crocheted beanie or bleach art leggings


PLUS

PLUS


OR


$600

BRIGHT ANGEL

CUSTOM PAINTING by Jamie Janett+ 2 Bright People T-Shirts + 1 Signed Fine Art Art Print OR Crochet beanie OR Bleach Art Leggings 

PLUS


PLUS

OR



The Opportunity Bright People has to Inspire

The Bright People Collective is an artistic platform that inspires others to be creative. We offer free activities and workshops that invite people to be a part of our community so they can learn new things and have fun. These values are seen in our workshops and invite others to delight in the new experiences.
At Bright people we are constantly helping people express themselves by creating an open minded environment for their ideas to be born; whether it's an adult learning to play music, or a child learning to paint, we encourage all growth and experiences from everyone.
                                    

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Even if you cannot contribute to our project right now, you can still help!

    Please share on Facebook, Instagram and social media. Tell your friends about our project and please stay tuned about our upcoming events and projects

    www.facebook.com/britepeople

story:
What I'm doing

Friends, Family, Fans and Lovers of song! Jason bid on some discounted studio time with a local artist, Ted Kamp, at a charity auction here in LA, and we won it! I went into the studio last week and we layed down 5 amazing tracks which I've shared a snippet of here with you. I'm so excited, BUT now I need to pay the musicians, mix and master the recording, pay music royalties, obtain artwork and then press the CD's! Whew. It ain't simple.

Although I got a great start with the studio time, I do need additional funds to make the rest happen, otherwise it's just a digital recording that I can't hand to the people I love or that I want to work with! I'd be immensely grateful if you are able to assist in making this vision a reality. 

What I Need & What You Get

I'm calling on you to help support my first studio recording EVER! It's time to take the music I love to sing to live venues around LA and wherever I can, to book work and to share with fans. This EP will allow me to spread the word, share beautiful music and give you and the people in your life the gift of song. 

You are guaranteed at any contribution level to get a digital recording from me upon completion of the mixing/pressing!

The Impact 

As a singer, I've always felt a little behind the curve not having a recording to share with people who have asked; it's like being a business with no website! This recording will change that. I can submit with this CD to clubs, venues, festivals, agents and managers. I also really care deeply about the legacy of being an artist and leaving something behind to share with the world; but mostly with family, friends and fans that have supported me and asked for this to happen.

UPDATE: This October I will be joining Princess Cruise Lines for a short Pacific contract where I'm the principal female vocalist. In addition to their wonderful shows, I get to do short sets of music of my own choosing! Those songs are represented here and this CD will be available for sale in the gift shop onboard! Another way to share with more people who love music.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for reading this and for considering my request. If you cannot make a contribution at this time, no worries! You can still use this page to share what I'm doing with others who may be able to contribute. I appreciate anything you can do.

story:
Bonjour tout le monde!

J'ai besoin de votre aide pour m'aider à financer le clip de ma chanson Libre Comme L'air! Voici le lien iTunes pour entendre un extrait ou pour vous la procurer ! :  https://itunes.apple.com/ca/album/libre-comme-lair-single/id1005108829?l=fr

Ce projet est vraiment important pour moi car un clip est un outil de promotion essentiel à une chanson ! De plus, les fonds m'aideront à financer mon EP (mini-album) 

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous y gagnez!

L'argent que nous recevrons nous permettra de payer un DOP (directeur de la photographie) ,ainsi que la réalisation ! L'argent qui restera sera investi dans le EP pour l'enregistrement de chansons. Le clip sera réalisé par Chronos films ! :)

Parmi les contreparties: Chandails dédicacés, performances privées, crédit de producteurs associés et même des covers (reprises)  aux choix :)

L'impact

Vous pourriez aider un jeune artiste qui est en début de carrière! Également, l'argent me permettra d’avoir un clip professionnel pour pouvoir m'aider à faire ma place dans le marché Québécois !

D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer vous pouvez aussi partager la campagne ! Merci à tous ceux qui vont me soutenir dans ce projet et aussi à ceux qui me soutiennent depuis le début !

vous y gagnez!
L'argent que nous recevrons nous permettra de payer un DOP (directeur de
la photographie) ,ainsi que la réalisation ! L'argent qui restera sera investi
dans le EP pour l'enregistrement de chansons. Le clip sera réalisé par Chronos films ! :)
Parmi les contreparties: Chandails dédicacés, performances
privées, crédit de producteurs associés et même des covers (reprises)  aux choix :)
L'impact
Vous pourriez aider un jeune artiste qui est en début de carrière!
Également, l'argent me permettra d’avoir un clip professionnel pour pouvoir
m'aider à faire ma place dans le marché Québécois !
D'autres façons d'aider
Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer vous pouvez aussi partager
la campagne ! Merci à tous ceux qui vont me soutenir dans ce projet et aussi à
ceux qui me soutiennent depuis le début !

story:
thanks to everyone!

Shurùq – What’s in a name?

Shurùq, Scirocco, Xaroco, Σορόκος, Eisseroc… the program takes its name from a wind originating in the Sahara that then blows northwards across the Mediterranean.  During the years of Arab domination in Spain and Southern Italy, culture, ideas and knowledge followed the same path, so that during the Middle Ages, the Arab influence on music, painting, architecture, and even cooking was found all across Europe’s Southern Coast.  And indeed, many of the instruments we see in the frescoes, miniatures and sculptors from medieval Spain and Italy are Arab ones, almost identical to those played today in the North African and Middle Eastern tradition.

Shurùq – the Story

In 2013, we gave a Master Class in Palestine that brought us into contact with two exceptionally talented young musicians  then in their final year of study at the Edward Saïd Conservatory.  The next Spring, Osama and Muhammed followed the Scirocco’s path – this time by EasyJet – for a six-month residency at the Early Music Department of the Conservatory of Geneva, and a collaboration with Lucidarium.  The goal was an exchange centered on modal music – both medieval and Middle Eastern.  There was analysis and discussion, but most of all we played, improvised and experimented.  The kind of experimentation where differences in geographical origin or cultural background seem to disappear by the simple act of sitting down and making music together.

Sound Samples from Shurùq

Shurùq – the Concert

This year, our old friend Aloijze Prosoli, director of the Dvigrad/Due Castelli Festival (in Istria, a region that was under Venetian rule for centuries where many still speak Italian at home) asked us to perform our traditional Arab-medieval program.  What could be more fitting than performing a program named for a wind that blows across the Mediterranean in a town on its Eastern shores? The festival is one of limited means that can only pay room and board and part of artists’ fees. The considerable expenses (two round trip tickets from Tel Aviv during the High Holidays, travel from Geneva to Milan to Istria, rehearsal costs, taxes, social security etc.) are beyond their means. In addition, we have two musicians waiting on standby, so that if there are enough donations, we’ll be able to perform the program with the group it deserves.

Shurùq - What your contributions will do

What is the project? 

A cooperative effort uniting artists from Italy, France, Palestine and the USA in an attempt to cut across traditional musical stereotypes – Eastern and Western, old and new, popular and classical, plugged and unplugged – in the search for a new, shared musical language.
Performers of different ages and musical backgrounds working towards a common goal: a program built on exchange that combines medieval music and Arab traditional repertoire, to be performed in a Mediterranean-based festival with limited financial means.  
You can help with travel, rehearsal and incidental costs and the hiring of two additional musicians

Why it doesn’t stop with one concert -

Your contributions will allow us to keep the program performance ready and to make demo-quality recordings.  This will help us to propose it to a number of different festivals to guarantee future performances and keep it going until we can record it next year.

Lucidarium – the group

Who are we? 

Lucidarium is a medieval-Renaissance group with an ongoing project devoted to the musical heritage of the "others," those that lived in the shadows of the cathedrals and courts that were the centers of written records, but have left traces in the oral tradition across the globe.  Innovative programs that explore the links between oral and written transmission, the mechanisms that brought tunes, texts, and dances across Europe and beyond are one of the group’s hallmarks.  Projects include "Hombres de Maiz," a program celebrating the links between the Northern Italian and the Northern Mexican musical traditions, "Con l'Arte e con l'Inganno - the Musical Roots of the Commedia dell'Arte" and a series of programs dedicated to the music of the Jews in Renaissance Europe. 

Lucidarium has recorded six award-winning CDs, and receives funding from foundations such as Pro Helvetia, the European Association for Jewish Culture, and the Canton of Geneva.  It plays regularly in the most important European (Resonanzen, Regensburg, Holland Early Music Festival/Network, York Early Music Festival, Royaumont Foundation etc.) and North American (Boston, Seattle, Houston, Pittsburgh, Toronto) Early Music Festivals, making frequent “crossovers” into Jewish and World music festivals: Weimar, Budapest, Berkeley and more...

Selected Reviews

“unaffected, poetic and fresh” (Thüringer Allgemeine)

“vibrant and robust” (Early Music America)

“… in Ensemble Lucidarium’s interpretation, the music did not seem at all ‘historical:’ relaxed and lustfully played, it seemed as fresh as on the first day” 
(BLZ Basel)

 “The whole group works like a perfectly-oiled machine, where everyone knows exactly what to do, changing improvisational style from piece to piece with an expertise that left the public astounded and delighted.” (Messaggero Veneto)

 “music that leapt effortlessly across the centuries” (The Whole Note, Toronto)

more

story:
Here we are! Resonances, my first album is about to be released. 

I'm DAP, an Italian born singer/songwriter. I started my project a few years ago and now I wish it to cross the borders of my own country also thanks to the album I produced myself. 

This campaign is extremely important because it is a little step on the path that leads to my dream: reach a wider audience with my music. Here, with a small contribution you can for example pre-order my album and at the same time you will help me doing everything possible to make my project grow. 

The goal I set is meant to cover the expenses I'm about to face: printing, promoting and building the launch event. From your side you can choose among many different perks and if you think something is missing, well, let's talk about it! :)

What else you can do? If you like what you see and hear, please share this campaign with your friends, relatives, lovers, colleagues and so on.

story:
Introduction

Hi! I'm Brian Keith Wallen, a blues musician from Indiana. I make my living playing music, and I drive about 70,000 miles a year out on the road. I've released several albums over the years, all recorded at my home studio, and printed at home as well. It's become apparent to me that I need an upgrade in that department, so I'm taking the plunge. I'm making a new album at the Lodge recording studios in Indianapolis. This is the same studio that artists like Bela Fleck, John Legend, and Eminem have recorded at over the years. In addition, I'm releasing a new live DVD! It has two shows on it, both recorded in multi-cam HD in Memphis, TN.

The new CD is called "The Stompboard Sessions", and it's completely different than anything I've ever done. All of my other albums have had full band style production, and a lot of layers. They were cool, but they didn't really sound like what I do on a day-to-day basis. This record is going to be have a really warm, raw, organic sound. All of the songs will feature the stompboard, of course, and it's going to have a dynamic, live feel, as opposed to layers of drum machines or fifteen electric parts. You're going to be hearing just a couple of guitars, stompboard, vocals, and bass on these tunes, but with the top notch production at the Lodge, it's going to sound HUGE in the most natural way.

The new DVD...man, I am STOKED about that. It has two different live sessions on it. A 30 minute concert I did on DittyTV at their state of the art studio in Memphis, and my set at the International Blues Challenge Finals. The one that got me 2nd place in the competition. It's all shot in HD, all of the audio was professionally recorded and mixed, and it looks and sounds fantastic. Not to mention, my graphic designer, Rachel Yoder, absolutely knocked the packaging out of the PARK. It evokes the feeling and atmosphere of Beale Street, and I can't wait for you to see it.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm asking for $6,000 to cover the total cost of the two new projects. Studio time, duplication, graphic design, licensing, the whole nine yards. Here's the exact breakdown. It actually adds up to $6,100.

  • Video for DVD - $600
  • Licensing for DVD - $200
  • Duplication for DVD - $1,465
  • Studio Costs for CD - $2,000
  • Duplication for CD - $1,335
  • Graphic Design - $500
There are SO many cool perks you can get for contributing to this campaign. T-Shirts, actual autographed Stompboards, house concerts, and of course, copies of the new releases! I hope that you find something you like.

Impact

These new projects are so crucial. Having top quality, professional releases can often push you up to another level in the music business. Being able to put my best foot forward with this stuff, whether it be when I send it to a radio station, or when people pick up a copy from my merch table, will make all the difference in the world. I am more excited about this than I have been about anything in recent memory!

Other Ways You Can Help

I just ask that you help me spread the word! Share this with your friends, and I'll be forever grateful!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Mica Mackenzie and I'm trying to release my very first EP album! I started singing when I was five and haven't stopped since. AMTC was a fundamental part of my musical journey and it really boosted my confidence when I went to the AMTC SHINE convention 2013 and made it into the top 10 teen singers! I've been playing guitar and writing music for the past 4 years and was given an amazing opportunity to put out an EP album and music video!(: I can't wait for it to be released at the beginning of next year so you can hear my best original songs! 

Here's the link  to my video blog on Youtube so you can see what I've got: https://youtu.be/psWZQYLcJRs

Stay tuned because micamackenzie.com is COMING SOON!(: In the meantime I would love for you to send me an email at micamackenzieemaillist@yahoo.com so that you can stay a part of my musical journey and receive awesome updates and pictures! 

What We Need & What You Get

What We Need:

We are hoping to raise $10,000 dollars. All of these funds, whether we reach our goal or not, will be going towards the music video, lyric video, photo-shoot, recording and mastering, EP artwork, etc.. 

What You Get: 

We are offering the following cool items as prizes for donations 10$ and up! 

10$+: Hand-written Thank You card

20$+: Hand-written Thank You card + signed lyric sheet

35$+: Hand-written Thank You card; signed lyric sheet; download of EP

50$+: Hand-written Thank You card; signed lyric sheet; signed photograph; download of EP

75$+: Hand-written Thank You card; signed lyric sheet; signed photograph; 5$ Starbucks gift card; free t-shirt; download of EP

100$+: Thank You phone call; signed lyric sheet; signed photograph; 5$ Starbucks gift card; social media shoutout; free t-shirt; autographed hardcopy of EP 

450$+: Skype lesson/guitar lesson or we can chat about anything you like for 45 minutes; social media shoutout; autographed hardcopy of EP 

750$+: Backyard performance if you live in Dallas/Ft. Worth or in my Oklahoma hometown of Laverne, Oklahoma. If not, I'll do a Skype concert; public shoutout thanking you for being such a blessing; 15$ Starbucks gift card; free t-shirt; autographed hardcopy of EP

1000$+: Recognized on my EP as a sponsor; signed lyric sheet; signed photograph; backyard concert if you live in Dallas/Ft. Worth or in my Oklahoma hometown of Laverne, Oklahoma and I'll bring the cupcakes. If you don't live in the area then I will do a Skype concert; public shoutout on all of my social media pages thanking you for being such a blessing; 20$ Starbucks gift card; free t-shirt; autographed hardcopy of EP

NOTICE: We will get your "perks" to you as soon as we possibly can. Please consider that we won't even have access to some of these things until closer to the release of the EP. Just be patient with us. 

ATTENTION: If you are receiving a download of the EP, Thank You phone call, Skype lesson/guitar lesson, backyard performance, or being recognized on my EP as a sponsor, then I need you to send an email with your contact information to micamackenzieemaillist@yahoo.com so that you can receive these prizes!
 Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate right now there are plenty of other ways that you can help! I would really appreciate it if you would get the word out about my campaign by telling people and sharing it on your social media! Getting more people to know about this campaign is the key to making it succeed! Don't forget that you can use the Indiegogo sharing tools, too! Thank you so much for your help!
